Did you know that 44 zettabytes of data are generated each day? That is a trillion Gigabytes. Data is everywhere, also in court. Legal professionals are experiencing a tsunami of data that has to be reviewed and anonymized. Missing one document in the heap of several million will jeopardize a legal case or accidentally leak sensitive information. ZyLAB helps legal professionals in law firms, corporations and government to sift through huge volumes of data to find the smoking gun or incriminating email. ZyLAB is a B2B scale-up with offices in Amsterdam and Washington D.C.. Our clients include the CIA, FBI and the UN War Criminal Courts.

But who are you?

We’re looking for someone with a growth mindset and that can help lift our Go To Market to the next level. A growth mindset means:

..never stop improving.

Status quo is not enough. We challenge each other to be the best we can be and value people with ideas. After all, ideas do not know hierarchy.

.. be ambitious.

We set the bar high. ZyLABers are working hard for 100% growth this year. You can make mistakes, as long as you learn from it.

 ..stay lean.

We strive to continuously get better at what we do and are looking for the best ratio between results and effort.

..you have experience in marketing to legal professionals, risk & fraud investigators or compliance professionals in law firms or corporations (500+ employees)

..you have experience or knowledge of either the US, Dutch or EU legal context for civil litigation, anti-trust investigations or corporate investigations

..you’re a quick learner of complex concepts and are open for new ideas and input

..you have demonstrated success in positioning and launching differentiated products

..you have experience or affinity with event marketing

..you’ve excellent communicative abilities in English

..you have at least 5 years of experience in Marketing, and at least 3 years in a Product Marketing role for a B2B SaaS solution

What you will do..

As a Product Marketer you are representing the voice of the customer, sales and the market. You will be connecting the dots between internal teams at ZyLAB and market segments. Events are a proven and important channel for educating potential prospects, so you will be responsible for developing and executing the event strategy and campaigns, with support of the Marketing team and the event owner / presenter.

Your responsibilities include:

Create consistent positioning statements, messaging and the associated proof points. This source material is used to generate public-facing marketing collateral (e.g. case studies)
Develop and evolve market segmentation for each product-market combination
Develop and organize customer-facing events, held by a ZyLAB point person
Create and present information about products and the markets these products serve
Perform competitive analysis
Analyze market trends
Organizing beta groups for new products & features
Gather feedback for product plans from customers and sales on features, timing, strategy, business terms and value proposition
Ensure that Sales has the collateral, messaging and talk tracks that resonate with customers
Analyze sales data and channel information and then create plans to improve sales most likely using marketing and sales techniques
Working with the Customer Services team to organize and direct customer research to get insights on products and business problems
You will be working with a, currently, small marketing team, together with a content marketer and growth marketer, and reporting to the Director of Marketing. Outside of the Marketing team, you will collaborate with the US & EU Sales team, Professional Services and Product Management.

 Enough said..

Share your dreams and a number of your failures. Explain the choices you want to make. Get in touch if you see a challenge in 100% growth and want to change the way in which legal professionals in top institutions worldwide discover facts in data.

Language

Dutch (preferred) & English (preferably North American, with solid exposure to North American culture)

OPTICS11 Life is looking for an International Sales Manager to sell our revolutionary measurement instruments to the life science industry and academiaCompany Background: History:Optics11 was founded in 2011 as a university spin-off. With a promising unique technology based on optical fiber sensing, a first product was built in 2012: an extremely sensitive measurement device that could break new ground in the field of tissue engineering and regenerative medicine. After this product, many more unique sensing products were developed and put in the market. The company now has two business units serving different markets with different products: Optics11 Life and Optics11 Industrial Sensing. Over the last years the company has grown rapidly and employs over 50 professionals, with an installed base of successful products all over the world.Market Opportunity:Optics11 Life is addressing a large market opportunity. Medical treatment is going through a multi-faceted revolution. Drug development is seeing a paradigm shift towards 3D cell culture and Organ-On-a-Chip (OOC), thereby drastically reducing development cost, failure rates and time to market of vital treatments. Regenerative medicine, which aims to replace damaged tissue in patients based with stem cell based engineered tissue, will provide a cure for previously untreatable conditions, and contribute to a solution for shortage of organs for transplantation.These fields are now developing at a high pace, starting in academia and in R&D and moving towards near-future industrial value chains. This will revolutionize medical treatment in many ways. These changes require new instrumentation, both to drive progress, to validate the achievements and to monitor and control the future industrial processesOne of the driving forces behind both the revolution in regenerative medicine as well as Organ-On-a-Chip, is a deepened understanding of the role of mechanics and forces in physiology and disease. From stem cells to organoids, from hydrogels to engineered tissues, it is becoming increasingly clear that the mechano-biological state is of major importance to the biological processes. Being able to characterize, monitor and control the mechano-biological state is going to be a key element in the emerging chains.Optics11 Life is at the leading edge of these emerging industries, and is extremely well equipped to be able to provide the key instrumentation that these new industrial chains will need.The key responsibilities of a Sales Manager: Lead and grow the International Life Atlassian is continuing to hire with all interviewing and on-boarding done virtually due to COVID-19. All new and existing Atlassians will continue to work from home until it’s safe to return to our offices. When our offices re-open, we will provide the choice to work from home or return to work in an office unless a job requirement makes it necessary for a particular role to be performed at an Atlassian office.
Do you want to be part of the team driving Atlassian's business in Southern Europe? Have you managed a channel business before and want to do it at a hyper-growth company and in an non-salesy business model? Atlassian's low-touch model together with our existing channel partners has served us very well, but we also understand that at scale, doing business in this territory requires a stronger local presence.
The Channel Manager's primary responsibility is to focus on extending Atlassian's business model through the recruitment and development of a portfolio of consulting and services Partners. The Channel Manager will be responsible for finding, growing and shaping partners to build Atlassian mind and market share in the region. Atlassian is growing and we are building out our channel with System Integrator partners. We are looking for an exceptional individual who understands the channel business, and also understands how to grow and manage a region. Recruiting and enabling partners is a large part of the position, as is the ability to drive marketing and sales activities with your partners to increase brand awareness and Atlassian product adoption.
This position reports to the Manager for Southern Europe Channels and is part of a global organisation that is tasked with building a channel that deliver value-added services to our customers. You will work closely with the partner program, enablement, and field marketing teams, to develop and deliver programs that suit the needs of our local partners, as well as represent Atlassian in the field. The Global Channels team is part of the broader sales team, which has a very unique approach to selling. Most of our sales are done via credit card over the web through a self-service, no negotiation, no discounting model. That being said, we have great teams that work directly with customers of all sizes to ensure that they have the information they need to make a decision. We believe in transparency and this includes our pricing which is all on our website.


More about you:
Fluency in Italian and English.
You are highly motivated and have a minimum of 5+ years experience in recruiting and managing partners in the software industry and you have also worked in consultancy/services organisations.
You understand the complexities of working with small and large partners, each with their own culture, challenges and opportunities.
You have worked with enterprise accounts but you're also an all-rounder who can actively contribute to local marketing and community activities.
“Recruit, Enable and Sell” is your motto, and partners actually enjoy doing business plans with you. You want a new challenge at a hyper-growth company, and are not afraid of new business models.
Here's an idea of the kinds of things you'll get to do:
Accelerate and develop partners, focusing on larger regional system integrators;
Grow local presence of larger local system integrators and Atlassian share
Demonstrate the business opportunity, sell “Atlassian” and our solutions offerings
Drive the top partners and developing partners;
Drive local field marketing events and trade shows;
Present/speak at local events;
Be an internal spokes person for the region
Excited about those options, and have a few ideas of your own? We'd love to hear how your skills could support our mission!
More about our benefits
Whether you work in an office or a distributed team, Atlassian is highly collaborative and yes, fun! To support you at work (and play) we offer some fantastic perks: ample time off to relax and recharge, flexible working options, five paid volunteer days a year for your favourite cause, an annual allowance to support your learning & growth, unique ShipIt days, a company paid trip after five years and lots more.
More about Atlassian
Creating software that empowers everyone from small startups to the who’s who of tech is why we’re here. We build tools like Jira, Confluence, Bitbucket, and Trello to help teams across the world become more nimble, creative, and aligned—collaboration is the heart of every product we dream of at Atlassian. From Amsterdam and Austin, to Sydney and San Francisco, we’re looking for people who want to write the future and who believe that we can accomplish so much more together than apart. At Atlassian, we’re committed to an environment where everyone has the autonomy and freedom to thrive, as well as the support of like-minded colleagues who are motivated by a common goal to: Unleash the potential of every team.
Additional Information
We believe that the unique contributions of all Atlassians is the driver of our success. To make sure that our products and culture continue to incorporate everyone's perspectives and experience we never discriminate on the basis of race, religion, national origin, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, or marital, veteran, or disability status.
All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

The team accomplishes this by ensuring milestones are hit, risks are mitigated when there are exceptions, all while project-managing and communicating with internal and external stakeholders.
Netflix is seeking a manager to lead a growing team of Title Project Managers based in EMEA. You will be part of a larger Product Creative Operations leadership team who innovate approaches to tooling, vendors and quality assurance so that we can work smarter and increase efficiency and quality.

Are you an expert who is skilled in data & analytics, and have a passion for leading and mentoring people? Do you want to be part of creating vital products for a fast-growing global business? Then we're looking for you!
Our story (the bitesize version)

Since our creation in 2000, we've grown from a small attic business to become a global food delivery powerhouse. As Just Eat Takeaway.com, we serve millions of people across 23 countries — from the Netherlands to New Zealand.
Operating in a competitive industry, we need to offer the best products for colleagues and consumers alike. From Product Owners and analysts, to developers, designers and researchers, our product experts ensure we have the recipe for success.


About the role

In the Back Office Product vertical we focus on establishing and maintaining efficient business operations, by creating and providing high-quality products and services to make our operations scalable, compliant, and more efficient. We're connected to every part of the organization, and our efforts have an impact on thousands of our colleagues as well as the entire food-ordering platform.
Each of our multidisciplinary product teams focuses on a specific domain, from order management to the restaurant signup funnel, restaurant-data entry, invoicing, and many more. We use modern product-management techniques to identify opportunities that will improve the way people work and help them to add the most value to our company. Together with UX designers and software engineers we build fitting, intuitive and innovative solutions through an iterative process of testing, validating and learning.
There's an abundance of data to explore, analyse, and utilise. We're currently in the process of adding a Product Analyst to each team, and that's where you come in! We're looking for an experienced and proactive Team Lead to hire, lead and mentor these analysts, and take the way we work with and use data to the next level.
Once offices reopen, you'll be located in the Amsterdam HQ along with the Back Office Product Lead, the Amsterdam Team Lead, and various product teams. While the analysts will be part of teams across our offices in different countries, they will all report directly to you. Together you'll establish a more data-focused mindset and culture within our vertical. You'll educate the teams in making data available and digestible, using it to come up with actionable insights, and making more informed product decisions.
While this role doesn't require hands-on work per se, you need to be capable of this to better understand the needs of your analysts and help all team members improve. Along with the other Team Leads you'll also be working on improving the entire Back Office vertical, especially in the way we set up and use OKRs for strategic decision making and goal-setting.

What you'll focus on

Create, lead, and mentor a high-performing team of Product Analysts
Drive impact with data in strategic decision making, and throughout the product-development process
Set up processes that enable the analysts and their teams to better understand user behaviour and product performance
Lead the teams to create actionable insights from data and empower them to make data-informed decisions
Help the teams identify key metrics that measure and drive product outcomes, set up quarterly OKRs, and measure progress
Align with data & analytics people from other verticals, as well as our Business Intelligence department, to drive company-wide initiatives to improve data fluency within JET
What we're looking for

You have 5+ years of experience in an analytics, product or data science role, of which 2+ years leading a team and mentoring people
You're down-to-earth, practical, focused on outcomes, and driven to have a positive impact on the people around you
You have an understanding of and experience with modern product management concepts and product discovery and delivery activities
You have sharp business judgement and easily separate signals from noise when it comes to summarising and presenting actionable insights
You can effectively communicate complex matters and requirements to non-domain experts in a clear, simple and concise way, both visually and verbally, and you are fluent in English
You have very strong communication and networking skills to communicate cross functionally and with senior management
You're able to deal with a fast-paced and ever-changing environment; experience working in a hyper-growth e-commerce environment is a plus
What we offer

A competitive salary and relocation support for this position
A varied and impactful role and the opportunity to create and lead your own international team
A fast-paced environment with challenges that enable you to grow as a professional
Travel costs are covered for 1st class public transportation
26 holidays a year on a full-time basis
Pension plan 60% paid by Just Eat Takeaway.com
An office location within the heart of Amsterdam
Internal as well as external schoolings and conferences
Awesome team events!
Ready to make the jump?

If you're the person we're looking for, click Apply Now and send us your CV and a motivational letter in which you use the word "pizza" at least once.

Tiffany & Co….. the name instills images of Beauty, Romance and the iconic Blue Box. It is a Symbol of Excellence. Tiffany & Co. Sales Professionals are dream makers, they strive for excellence in every customer interaction. Customer Experience & Sales

As our Product Photographer for Grip you provide input and art direction to all the photo-realistic content that is created in our in-house 3D studio within e-commerce/digital marketing. With your product photography background you know what makes an image appealing and you make sure we can deliver the best quality to our clients, aligning on their creative strategy. You understand what a technically and visually good image is. It’s a real mix of QA (technical requirements) as well as creative (beautiful content). Basic understanding of 3D is very helpful in this role in order to translate client needs to our internal team, but it is not necessary.
About INDG

At INDG we develop technology that enables engaging, hyper-realistic digital product experiences. Our goal is to make "every product playable", by combining the science of technology with the artistry of computer-generated content. Our offices are in Amsterdam, Bucharest and New York. Clients include Adidas, Yamaha, Ralph Lauren, Electrolux, and Philips.

Our CG artists, interactive designers, and developers focus on creating virtual versions of our clients' products, so lifelike it feels like you could reach out and touch them.

Our culture brings together creative, tech and business individuals. It’s a heady cocktail that keeps us inspired, empowered and passionate.
What’s Grip?

Grip supports brands to cope with the fast-accelerating challenge of the exponential grow and need for content. Grip is web-based software that automatically generates visual content. It’s based on photorealistic 3D, capitalising on INDG’s twenty-year-long experience in that field. 3D is good because once your beer or your juicer or your rocket is on Grip, it can be used and re-used for multiple media: images, videos, iOS apps, and such.
What will you do?

Provide input and art direction on our 3D assets
Translate client needs to our 3D artists
Ensure consistency is maintained in our deliverables
Work with our Technical Artists to improve our style definition and 3D photostudio
Judge and evaluate the work of the 3D artist with your product photographer knowledge
Who are you?

You have a background in product photography or similar and you understand what a technically good image is (lightning, compositing, etc)
Basic understanding of CG
What we offer

With the role being located in the heart of Amsterdam, our environment and our creative space are very important to us. Furthermore we offer a competitive salary, paid annual leave, an office overlooking the Amsterdam canals, get fit schemes, a pool table, darts, fruits, snacks, and dinner options each evening those staying later than working hours. If applicable, we also have an extensive relocation package for those moving to the Netherlands.
You can apply via the link below. Please be aware that we ask you to send your (up-to-date) CV and portfolio along with your application.

Hey there! We are Gorillas & we are influencing the way people live their lives. Groceries being delivered to your door in 10 minutes is a concept that up until recently was unimaginable. Overview

Work closely with the Operations team to ensure that the supply chain runs smoothly between our suppliers and our stores in each market

About VICE

VICE is an international media company that captures people at the heart of all our stories. We focus on the ideas, issues, and context that other outlets miss. Launched in 1994, VICE operates in 35 cities across the globe, making 1,500 pieces of content every day. The company has five lines of business: VICE Digital, an award-winning international network of digital content; VICE STUDIOS, a feature film and television production studio; VICELAND, an Emmy-winning international television network; a Peabody award-winning NEWS division; and VIRTUE, a global, full-service creative agency with 26 offices around the world.

VICE x Vision and Values

We are here to create a place for people and their ideas. VICE was started by people who wanted to make things they cared about, and who took on the world with curiosity, radical thinking, and an audacious spirit. We are still that company.
That is why our values are:

1. Bring Who You Really Are
2. Grow While You're Here
3. Do Work That Means Something To You

Role x You

We're looking for a freelance Digital Campaign Manager to join our team and be primarily responsible for the management of our branded digital media campaigns. You will be responsible for executing all elements of the media plan, such as content, social, display and video activation across different digital platforms. You will be part of the regional EMEA team of Campaign Managers and work together with the local teams in France and Belgium. You will join a specialist campaign team within the company, providing insight and strategy on digital advertising.

In the short term you will be trained on how to pick up the activation of branded digital media campaigns. A specialist team of Campaign Managers will train you how to set up Content, Display and Video campaigns. You will familiarise yourself with our operating system, Facebook Business Manager, Asana (tasks priority tool), and will work closely with our Ad Operations, Sales and Project Management teams.

But after 6 months in this role and after thorough training, you will begin to execute your campaigns independently, while gaining more knowledge about how campaigns perform and can be optimised to get the best results for our clients.

And after a year -you will be able to manage your digital campaigns with confidence while you gain more insight of what works best for our campaigns. We'd like to see you also become an advisor for our Planning team by sharing these campaign insights with the wider teams.

Accountabilities

Activate branded content and paid social campaigns on VICE's channels (Facebook, Instagram, Snapchat, and Youtube).
Activate digital media campaigns on and off platform (Video / Display / Native).
Maintain an excellent relationship with internal and external stakeholders.
Optimise campaign towards the best possible results, making sure all goals are hit
Build client facing reports about the performance of their campaigns.

Required skills:

A degree in Communication, Digital Advertising or Digital Media
Excellent problem solving skills, ability to perform under pressure and in fast paced environments
Excellent organisational and multitasking skills with a great attention to detail
Strong teamplaying spirit as well as a passion for social and digital advertising, the marketplace and technology.
Fluent in English and French, written and spoken

We'd love if you also had these:
Experience working with Facebook / Instagram Business Manager to activate dark posts.
Understanding of broader digital platforms including display, performance, and mobile.
Comfortable with excel and reporting
Knowledge of Operative 1, Salesforce, Asana, and NetSuite.
Dutch / Flemish language skills is a plus

Working at VICE

VICE prioritises the ideas and people that other media companies miss. We believe that innovation is a direct result of diverse, inclusive cultures; so we don't just 'tolerate' differences, we celebrate them and see them as essential to our staff, culture and business. We are proud to be an equal opportunities employer, and embrace diversity in our culture. We strive to create a happy and healthy workplace for our teamWe expect all employees to be an ambassador for the business at all times representing the VICE Media brand with respect to the way we conduct business, the standard of work we deliver, and the culture we adopt.

For our Technology division in Amsterdam we are looking for an Operations Manager who is able to support and drive our rapidly changing and fast paced Supply Chain Operations facilitating an Industry 4.0 manufacturing and fulfilment plant. Someone with a hands-on approach and tactical mindset, participating in a local/global team mastering the operational supply chain elements while optimizing efficiency and automating to scale. We’re looking for a supply chain professional who brings an engineering and business economics background, a strong drive and data savviness that helps driving the operations to the next level.

Syncreon Amsterdam - servicing a corporate startup

Speed, scale and efficiency is the foundation of our success. We think fast, act fast and change fast. Our customer is at the center of everything we do and we don’t stop until the job is done. Our team is very international and we like to challenge each other to continually evolve and grow. We don’t do hierarchy, egos or boundaries and “not possible” is not in our vocabulary, but freedom to think and act is. We encourage out-of-the-box thinking and bringing an element of fun into our work. If you are ready to join the power of speed, scale and efficiency with one of the greatest corporate tech startups in the world, then continue reading…

Operations

At Syncreon we have long lasting customer relationships with a history of solving complex problems and providing innovative solutions.
Our operations are at the heart of the business and we drive for speed, accuracy and exceptional service.
About the Role
How you will contribute

As a Supply Chain Operations Manager, you will have the opportunity to lead a material flow operation that facilitates both manufacturing and in/outbound operations across two shifts within the Supply Chain Fulfilment Center. You will be responsible for leading, developing, and engaging an exceptional talented team that makes innovation possible. One of your main focuses will be motivating, mentoring, and coaching your team to become the best in class. You are a creative problem solver who is able to dream big, play big and deliver meaningful results that drive productivity, efficiency and business model changes.
Your responsibilities
Some of the position’s key responsibilities include;
Preach a safety first culture with safety awareness programs ensuring a safe work environment for everybody involved
Coach, empower and develop a team of first operators, supervisors and associates by embodying Leadership Principles
Create, communicate and maintain quality control policies and standard work procedures
Lead process change initiatives and build productivity improvement plans
Partnering with other managers to share best practices
We are committed to developing a diverse workforce and committed to work with you to make that happen.
Your Key Qualifications
Basic qualifications;
Bachelor’s or master’s degree in Engineering & Business Economics
Ownership in your work and the team
Obsessed with customer experience and able to meet and exceed challenging demand
Eye for efficiency and experience identifying and implementing large-scale process improvement initiatives using data-driven techniques
Flexibility to work across multiple time-zones
Preferred qualifications;
+5 years of management experience in a manufacturing, fulfilment and distribution services
Led large-scale process improvements through Lean, Kaizen, and Six Sigma
Strong and inspiring communication skills
Data savvy
Entrepreneurial with calculated risks taking
Advanced data analytics tools and CRM management experience
At syncreon we are fully committed to the health and safety of our employees. We have full prevention and mitigation processes in place, including cleaning and sanitization practices, as well as screenings, masks and social distancing. syncreon complies with national, state and local orders and aligns with the guidelines.
Compensation
syncreon offers exciting and challenging roles within a growing international organization. We strive to hire and develop the right people, locally and globally; stimulating personal growth and self-development within an informal atmosphere. We offer a market competitive compensation package.
About syncreon
syncreon delivers tailored, progressive and scalable solutions to premier global automotive and technology brands, such as Jaguar Land Rover, Harley Davidson, BMW, Dell, Xerox and Canon. We supply 3PL and 4PL solutions that adapt as quickly as industry and the marketplace evolve. For over 60 years syncreon has provided unique and innovative expertise in providing highly integrated, warehousing management, inbound to manufacturing, reverse and repair, export packing, aftermarket services, fulfilment services and transport. Today we have 14,000+ employees working in 100+ locations worldwide who enjoy our supportive culture, dedication to work-life balance, people development and superb career opportunities. For more information, visit www.syncreon.com.
Note
Candidates chosen to move forward within the Recruitment Process, may be required to undergo an assessment and/or submit further background information. Any offers of employment may be conditional on completion of required checks and provision of relevant documentation, in accordance with the applicable local legislation.

The Team
The PVH Europe Sustainability Department is responsible for establishing and driving the sustainability vision for Tommy Hilfiger Global & supporting CK Europe’s sustainability commitments. Our new Make it Possible strategy has launched on Aug 2020 and is led by our vision to Create Fashion that Wastes Nothing and Welcomes All, with two main focus areas: Circularity and Inclusivity.
The Position
We are looking for an enthusiastic Sustainability Manager who will work in the Tommy Hilfiger/PVH Europe Sustainability team at our office in Amsterdam. You will be part of the Sustainable Operations Team, with an initial focus on the development of the Sustainable Logistics and Waste Management Programs, supporting the Greenhouse Gas Reduction Program, and reporting to the VP of Sustainability.
In your role you will be responsible for the co-creation of initiatives and programs related to the implementation and expansion of the sustainable operations strategy across PVH Europe and Tommy Hilfiger Global. Along with driving the strategy in the operations area, you will also grow strong communication externally and drive the internal embedding and operationalization of the diverse programs to secure integrity as well as maximum return on investment for the brand.
Greenhouse Gas reduction program
Together with the Sustainable Operations Team, you will lead and influence the development & operationalization of Greenhouse Gas reduction program focusing on:
Renewable Energy Sourcing using various procurement mechanisms such as Green Contracts, Power Purchase Agreements, and Biofuels. This includes Certification Processes (GoO, RECs)
Sustainable Logistics (Upstream & Downstream transportation and distribution), E-commerce (full value chain, including logistics, reverse logistics and post-consumer)
Sustainable business travel and events
In addition you will:
Influence & drive engagement of key stakeholders to ensure successful program implementation
Provide ad-hoc support for PVH Europe Logistics and Omni Chanel teams, advising on sustainability content
Educate & inform internal stakeholders on key topics such as Green Contracts and Renewable Energy Certification Processes
Provide tailored support to PVH Europe Logistics and Omni Chanel teams, to create frameworks for sustainability programs and internal targets
Assist in providing subject matter expertise and content on selected environmental impacts, ensuring internal claims are substantiated with quantitative data based on Life Cycle Assessment approach
Support the Greenhouse Gas reporting process in line with international accounting standards (GHG Protocol, CDP)
Waste management
Lead the Zero Waste Program for European markets focusing on:
Co-create and implement the program roadmap and activities
Support the investigation and implementation of Circular Design and Circular Business Models for the build environment
Bring visibility to the program and embed within the business
Ensure project KPIs and targets from agreed-upon project plans are met
Provide input to ensure Tommy Hilfiger needs are met during co-creation of future sustainability program plans and initiatives
Support local European teams to ensure visibility of data, and discussions with third parties
Represent brand interests at global forums and meetings with external stakeholders including key stakeholders from the industry
The Ideal Candidate
University degree in Environmental Science, or equivalent
7-10 years of related work experience
Demonstrated experience in setting up change driving programs and Project Management
Excellent knowledge of MS Office, especially Excel, Project and PowerPoint
Fluent spoken and written English
Demonstrated knowledge of waste management strategies (prevention and disposal), sustainable logistics and greenhouse gas reduction strategies (Scope 1, 2 & 3)
Excellent communication and stakeholders management skills
Experience with sustainability and numerical assessment
Knowledge and previous experience working with: Sustainable Logistics, Carbon Footprint Accounting and Reporting, Greenhouse Gas Abatement Measures, Life Cycle Assessment, Circular Economy, Circular Design, and Waste Management
Demonstrated experience in project management and sustainability strategy development & implementation
Good analytical skills and strategic insight
Ambitious and results oriented
Flexible, creative, collaborative, positive attitude and a team player
Pro-active and responsive
What can you expect from us?
Become part of a great team of passionate people that drive sustainable change;
A beautiful state-of-the-art Campus, complete with a gym and a People’s Place café, located by the water in the heart of Amsterdam;
An international environment which respects diversity, equality and individuality;
A culture of development, offering training and learning opportunities;
A chance to unwind with weekly social activities;
To top it all off, you will be working in an organization that encourages an entrepreneurial mindset, employees that are driven, solution oriented and value a collaborative culture.

Job Title: Senior Director Omnichannel Development & Business Operations
Job Description:
About PVH Corp.
PVH is one of the most admired fashion and lifestyle companies in the world. We power brands that drive fashion forward – for good. Our brand portfolio includes the iconic CALVIN KLEIN, TOMMY HILFIGER, Van Heusen, IZOD, ARROW, Warner’s, Olga and Geoffrey Beene brands, as well as the digital-centric True&Co. intimates brand. We market a variety of goods under these and other nationally and internationally known owned and licensed brands. PVH has over 40,000 associates operating in over 40 countries and $9.9 billion in annual revenues. That's the Power of Us. That’s the Power of PVH.
The Team
The Omnichannel Development, Finance & Business Operations department formalizes the omnichannel strategy, drives the development of associated business processes & consumer services as well as leading their operational implementation. The department is also in charge of evaluating the business and financial performance of the omnichannel business.
Within the department, the Omnichannel Development & Operations team drives the design, development, implementation and operational execution of all omnichannel and retail services, processes and tools. The team identifies and scopes new initiatives, innovations & business opportunities to offer both an improved consumer experience and an always more efficient omnichannel operating model. The team covers end to end ownership of all Omnichannel Development initiatives from design to daily operations.
The Omnichannel Development & Operations team encompasses 3 teams:
The Omnichannel Product development team drives all activities related to product management. The team prioritizes the initiatives & features to be worked on, designs business requirements and steers the development teams to ensure the maximum value is delivered to the business
The Omnichannel Expansion team designs the approach and drives the implementation of all Omnichannel Products, processes, tools and services within the markets to maximize impact and engagement. The team oversees all activities related to the go-to-market phase of the projects, from designing the overall change management strategy, driving rollout plans and timelines up to coordinating operational go-live activities.
The Omnichannel Operations team focuses on supporting and improving omnichannel and retail tools & processes deployed in Markets and stores, aiming at optimizing operational efficiency. The team ensures processes and tools are effectively deployed, fully functioning and are properly used by end-users once the rollout phase of the project is over when processes & tools enter the daily run phase.
Partnering with the Strategy Department and the different channels, the team prioritizes the initiatives & features to be worked on to ensure the maximum value is delivered to the business. Working closely with the Analysis team, the Omnichannel Development & Operations team ensures product and processes are performing according to business objectives.
The team drives complex and innovative initiatives and products, which sits across multiple departments and technologies. The team is composed of product owners, expansion and operations specialists, interacting daily to cover end to end activities related to all omnichannel initiatives. The team environment is dynamic, open and value-oriented.
The Omnichannel Development, Finance & Business Operations department formalizes the omnichannel strategy, drives the development of associated business processes & consumer services as well as leading their operational implementation. The department is also in charge of evaluating the business and financial performance of the omnichannel business.
The Position
Reporting into the VP Omnichannel Development, Controlling & Business Operations you will be responsible for driving all activities related to the design, development, implementation and operational ownership of all services, processes and tools for the Omnichannel & Retail domain.
Key Responsiblibities
You will be responsible for the teams and their performance. In more detail, you will;
Lead & develop a team of direct reports of 4, within a wider team of 30+ people (internal and externals) to expand their skill sets to further develop and deliver according to objectives
Enable the team to drive projects and manage initiatives autonomously, by supporting them on methodology, stakeholders management, removing impediments and ensuring they follow the right priorities
Further shape the Department strategy, role and plans. Adapt the team organization and work methodologies to ensure the team delivers maximum value to the business
Collaborating with the Strategy team, define north star ambition for the omnichannel consumer experience and associated operating model.
Own roadmap of Direct to consumer services, process optimization and tools to ensure new initiatives are properly prioritized in terms of business value and delivered in the best timing, aligning with stakeholders
Identify potential innovations, improvements and new initiatives, scope & evaluate those based on business evaluation as well as technical and implementation complexity
Design new consumer services & associated processes, coordinate delivery and ensure go to market with the highest engagement of store associates and consumers
Define approach and drive execution of change management plans across HQ and countries. Enable co-ownership and cooperation to create long-lasting change, strong engagement, and business performance
Formalize a north star vision for Omnichannel Operational excellence, design improvements roadmap and adapt organization and resources to achieve this ambition
Manage (senior) stakeholders to ensure that omnichannel initiatives are successfully embedded within the organization in a sustainable way
Manage Development & Operations budget
You will need to forge strong partnerships and collaboration with the channel leaders, who are accountable for business performance, with the strategy team who shares direction on the overall omnichannel business strategy and with the Tech team, who steer the system roadmap. It is key to have a strategic view of the business priorities and team processes.
The Ideal Candidate:
Approximately 12- 15 years’ relevant Omnichannel experience, including 8 years leading/coaching a team of varied displines
Experience in project, change and product management with a track record of driving cross-functional, complex projects within agile methodologies, from design to implementation
Experience in driving high change impact initiatives across multiple departments in a matrix organization
Previous experience in large complex Ecommerce and/or Retail brands, within an end consumer-focused, fast-changing, new technology-driven environments
Highly structured and organized
Able to meet high expectations, full autonomy, high pressure in a complex environment
Outstanding people and relationship skills; and ability to interact with different levels of a multi-cultural, international organization
Open & charismatic personality to be able to influence various stakeholders across the organization
Communicate & translate technical & strategic direction successfully with stakeholders across levels and cultures
What You Can Expect from Us:
A beautiful state-of-the-art Campus, complete with our very own People's Place Gym & People's Place Cafés
A company culture that fosters development, offering training and learning opportunities through our very own PVH University
An international environment which respects diversity, equality, and individuality
A smart work program that empowers our associates to work at their preferred location within a flexible schedule
A chance to unwind with weekly social activities
We’d love to know why this is the role for you, so please include a motivational letter with your application!
PVH Europe and our brands, TOMMY HILFIGER and CALVIN KLEIN, are committed to fostering an inclusive and diverse community of associates with a strong sense of belonging. We believe we are bettered by all forms of diversity, and take pride in working with top talent from every walk of life and corner of the world. In the spirit of inclusivity, qualified applicants will be considered without regard to age, ethnicity, ability, gender, gender expression, gender identity, nationality, race, religion or sexual orientation.

Mambu is the leading SaaS core banking engine. If you’re a customer of the largest digital bank in the Americas or Europe, then you’ve probably interacted with our platform and didn't even know it. We are at the heart of what makes digital banks and lenders work, the system that processes banking transactions and updates accounts and other financial records from deposits to loans and credit balances. But we are different. We are not just cloud-native, lean and flexible, we are helping revolutionise financial services globally. We are in a growth phase and we’ve only just begun.
To help us on our mission, we bring together people with the best skills and attitude. It doesn’t matter where you are from, what matters is the impact you have and your passion to make a difference.
To continue our success story we are looking for a skilled and enthusiastic Project Manager to be a part of our rapidly growing Customer Onboarding team here in Amsterdam. As a Project Manager, you’ll be responsible for helping our customers to get the best out of our platform by setting the direction of the project implementation and steering multi-disciplinary teams involved in the implementation on Mambu and the Customer side. You are the backbone of the Mambu team and you ensure the whole project life cycle meets customer value expectations for quality and functionality.
You'll get to work with every type of FinTech company across the world from large banks to small startups while applying your banking and FinTech knowledge to help our customers launch the next generation of financial services.
Your responsibilities will be:
Planning, organising, and facilitating the completion of a Customer Onboarding Project while ensuring these engagements are completed on-time, within scope and contractual obligations
Working in close collaboration with Mambu Consultants, CSMs, Product Management and Customer/Partner Project Manager(s) in order to optimise the Customer Onboarding experience and increase customer trust in Mambu’s products, solutions and services
Managing accurate and consistent communication on project status and reporting, as well as excellent stakeholder management
Identifying potential areas of optimisation in the Customer Onboarding process and driving their implementation, and setting a forum with customers for sharing knowledge, challenges, and innovative ideas
Be an active part of shaping Mambu's culture as a company
What you need to have:
Certification in Agile & / or Project Management (PMI, IPMA, PRINCE2)
Minimum 5 years of relevant work experience in a similar role, preferably on complex technical delivery projects by having worked in the banking or FinTech industry
Familiarity with SaaS Implementations and technical transformation projects

The Next Closet is a fast-growing digital marketplace for second hand designer fashion.

Our mission is to change the textile industry by inspiring people to invest in quality and reuse what they already have. We have been in business since 2013 and our customer base, sales and revenue are growing at a rapid pace. Our office is located in central Amsterdam.

Despite the corona-situation which has for the time being limited our access to the physical office we need an Office & People Manager to hold the fort and prepare for the great return (hopefully very soon). In fact this role is just as important when we work from home as from the office only it requires extra good people and communication skills to manage. The happiness, well-being and constant development of our employees have our top priority! Your budget is limited so you will need to be creative and find smart solutions. You are a do-er and not afraid to take on tasks that are new to you.

The ideal candidate is someone who is hands-on, flexible, excels in multi-tasking and someone who is a genuine people person. Your professional background could be something other than people- and office management. What we care the most about is that you have the proper skillset.

Because we need you in and close to the office we will only consider applicants who already live in (or in commuting distance to) Amsterdam. You must be fluent in English and preferably also in Dutch.

HR:

Getting procedures and processes defined to match our future needs
Determining and refining frameworks for salary, employee evaluation and other perks
Leading the recruiting flow including on- and off-boarding of employees

Help planning and executing fun team events and strategic sessions

Support in finding a solid replacement of our CAO

Contract creation & management

Help with updating the salary administration

Office:

Point of contact for external suppliers, landlord, Gemeente, etc.
In charge of ordering and maintaining hardware and software
Make sure the office looks nice and has a good vibe to it


Bonus qualifications

Experience with (Dutch) legal contracts
Experience with BambooHR (our HR and hiring tool)
Know (basic) photoshop
LinkedIn wizard

Marketing Operations Manager in Amsterdam, The Netherlands
Introducing Sam Media
Sam Media is a team of passionate and confident creatives, marketing experts and developers focused on delivering excellent products and services to hundreds of millions of mobile consumers worldwide.
Our commitment to pursuing growth and continued learning core is one of our core values. We are all about investing in people. We stimulate personal initiatives and development by offering chances and freedom. We are passionate about travel, and we believe it enables people to grow both personally and professionally. We are proud of our social culture, where we have team nights and regular company activity days. Sam Media has a recognition and reward culture.
We are a pioneer and a leader in the mobile micro payment industry, we build and advertise our products, which include Mobile Apps, Video and Music Streaming Services, Online Learning and Mobile Games, with millions of users every single day. We are actively growing our performance marketing, behavioural targeting, real-time bidding and programmatic media buying capabilities.
Sam Media is a big and diverse family. with a variety of skills and 25 nationalities with offices in Kuala Lumpur, Amsterdam and Hanoi.
What is the role?
As a Marketing Operations Manager you will manage all operational aspects in the local markets that will be assigned to you. You need to ensure smooth operation and payment processing of our local services by monitoring, performance analysis, optimizing, managing compliance, trouble shooting and escalation of issues to the relevant department(s) and/or partner(s).
You will work from our office in Amsterdam, but will closely cooperate with your colleagues in Asia (Malaysia and Vietnam).
The Marketing Operations Manager is the operation contact person for our payment solution providers and our marketing compliance and monitoring partners all over the world.
As a Marketing Operations Manager you will work side by side with the Business Development Manager on connecting new markets while operating existing markets. You will work closely with other departments: Marketing, Design, Tech, Data Science and Business Development.
We are looking for a goal orientated and proactive person to manage all operational and commercial aspects of the markets in his/her responsibility.
What will you be doing?
Have a full overview on the status of each market by daily monitoring of statistics from each market within your responsibility (billing, sales and fraud checks).
Troubleshoot where necessary and provide the analysis to relevant managers for actions to be taken.
Communicate within your designated country team on progress in connectivity optimizations, integrations, service set ups, projects and daily tasks.
Prepare and set up services for approval by payment service providers.
Set up new campaigns and testing its functionalities.
Making sure tasks are progressing towards completion in optimal pace and desired quality.
The good stuff:
Established in 2006, we are a market-proven, well-established, international company with an informal culture and ability to move fast;
We invest in the personal development of each Sam Median by taking courses, attending conferences, and other learning opportunities;
We have regular team(building) events, including lunches, monthly office birthday celebration, and a yearly company trip;
We have a creative office in the heart of Amsterdam with tasty coffee, tea, fresh fruit, daily fresh lunch, and beers on Friday afternoons.

ABOUT DELIVEROO

When you first think about Deliveroo, you probably think of getting great food to your house in less than half an hour. Awesome right? But behind the scenes is the real story. This story is one of high growth, huge challenges, and an enormous opportunity ahead of us. It began with our founder Will, arriving in London over 5 years ago and finding it almost impossible to order great food, despite the wealth of incredible restaurants in the city. Fast forward 5 years and we operate in 12 countries with over 50,000 riders who deliver orders from 50,000 restaurants in over 200 cities worldwide.

We want to be the definitive food company - the app you go to any time you have a hunger pang. We are transforming the way people think about food. We are providing people with limitless access to different cuisines and restaurants, turning cooking from a chore to a choice, and giving people the freedom to eat what they want when they want, where they want it.

We work with riders, restaurants, and consumers. We operate one of the most complex three sided marketplaces in the world and we do this in real-time. Millions of customers and thousands of restaurants and riders rely on us to match them within milliseconds. The algorithms behind that marketplace are the secret sauce that allows us to deliver our orders in under 30 minutes.

And we’re just getting started

The scale of the opportunity ahead of us is immense. The global food market is valued at £7.7 trillion but only 1% of it is currently online. Contrast that with the digital disruption of countless other industries - from banking and travel to retail and communications - it’s clear that our journey in the food sector has only just begun.

We are already a multi-billion dollar company that is more than doubling in size every year. Deliveroo came top in the FT’s’ list of Europe’s fastest-growing 1000 companies in 2018, and we were the first company ever to win Deloitte’s ‘UK Top 50’ two years in a row. Yet most of the extraordinary value this company will generate lies ahead of us.

The Business Strategy Manager will be part of the Deliveroo NL Management team and will report directly to our General Manager

RESPONSIBILITIES

In this role, you will look after the medium-to-long term projects and challenge the way we do things, driving innovation forward. The responsibilities will include:

Working on the planning of different elements of the business strategy -acting as our internal strategy consultant
You will participate in the constant optimization of our activity by submitting hypotheses based on, in particular, quantitative and qualitative analysis.
You will develop favorable relations with the key players of our activity
Cross-department project management based work
Working within and across departments, as well as across geographies to bring new strategies to life
Supporting the General Manager with the quarterly and annual reforecasting/budgeting process
Forecasting for annual budget: work with Head of Departments and General Manager on quarterly and annual reforecasting/budgeting process
Collaborating with Head of Departments on quarterly KPI setting
You will motivate the teams and each employee individually to achieve the business objectives
Producing analytical types of reports for management review
This is a unique opportunity in an ever changing business environment!

REQUIREMENTS

 This role demands an entrepreneurial individual with an analytical background and experience of working on projects with multiple stakeholders. The ideal candidate has a track record of delivering strong analytical results, can work to tight deadlines and has a bias for action working in a fast-paced ambiguous environment.

We are looking for someone who can juggle many projects at once!!

Required Skills

4+ years work experience, ideally with 2 years+ professional experience in a strategy consulting firm
An HBO or University degree
P&L and relationship management experience
Can demonstrate strong analytical achievements and confidence with numbers
Excellent interpersonal, communication and presentation skills
Ability to effectively communicate and influence local market stakeholders
Strong track-record of hitting and exceeding businesses expectations
Experience in working in a dynamic high-growth company
Ability to work quickly in tight deadlines
Experience in managing complex projects with many actors
Analytical power, tact along with humility and patience
Fluent English (written and spoken)
A passion for food


LIFE AT DELIVEROO

We are a growing team, with a very large impact, seeking to answer some of the most interesting questions out there. We move fast, we’re always looking for new ideas and we’re very transparent about the decisions we make and why we make them.

There are so many questions we need to answer and plenty more we haven’t even encountered. How do data and technology help restaurants to grow as consumer habits change? How can we predict what someone wants to order for dinner long before the idea has even crossed their mind? At Deliveroo these are just some of the tough problems we are solving - and there is no challenge that cannot be yours. No solution is owned by a particular team, which means the scope for growth and personal impact is enormous.

Benefits and Diversity

At Deliveroo we know that people are the heart of the business and we prioritize their welfare. We offer a wide range of competitive benefits in areas including health, family, finance, community, convenience, growth, time away, and relocation.

In 2018 we announced our decision to give every employee equity in the company. We did this because we wanted all of our employees, regardless of location, level, or role to be owners and because we believe that this is the right thing to do. We believe this helps build a culture where everyone is committed and able to share in the company’s success.

We believe a great workplace is one that represents the world we live in and how beautifully diverse it can be. That means we have no judgement when it comes to anyone of the things that make you who you are - your gender, race, sexuality, religion, or a secret aversion to coriander. All you need is a passion for (most) food and a desire to be part of one of the fastest-growing start-ups around.

The ideal candidate will have previously been responsible for running a P&L and have expertise in operations, logistics or management consulting. Ideally in the transportation, logistics or last-mile space.
This team works closely with our Central Operations Team who are responsible for the defining the processes, training and operational KPIs for operations at LINK, and will also work closely with Finance, Product, Engineering, Supply Chain and other business-oriented departments in the company. This role reports to the VP of Operations. In your work, you will uphold our values and amplify the success of our business and products through operations.
The position is based in Amsterdam, NL; however, remote candidates will be considered. The position will require frequent travel throughout the region. We are looking to hire immediately.
What you’ll do:
Own the P&L for our EMEA Operations. You will be responsible for the budgets, P&L performance and optimizing our financial performance.
Lead and Manage the team of Region Operations Managers across our EMEA Region.
Ensure achievement of KPIs, and drive operational excellence across the markets.
Engage with Central Operations teams to understand our current processes, opportunities for increased efficiency, and areas where we can scale processes at a centralized level.
Oversee compliance with local regulations and policies
Build and develop strong relationships with cross-functional leaders including Market Operations, Product, Strategy, Policy, Engineering, Quality, and Supply Chain.
Set the cultural tone of the team and develop a strong culture of continuous improvement to consistently raise the bar of execution.
Who you are:
You have 7+ years of experience in operations, logistics, management consulting or analytics or related experience. High-growth start-up experience is a plus.
You possess 3+ years of people management experience and you demonstrate you are able to motivate, inspire and create an inclusive and positive work environment for all.
You’ve earned a Bachelor’s degree with a major or emphasis in engineering or business discipline; MBA or related advanced degree preferred.
You have previously run a P&L.
You are an expert communicator and display strong interpersonal skills. You must be able to communicate and articulate to all levels of the organization comfortably.
You demonstrate an entrepreneurial DNA.
You use analytical thinking and possess a data-informed mentality combined with strong business judgment. You are able to roll up their sleeves to analyze data and pull key insights for your team.
You drive a creative, solutions focused approach and emphasize operational excellence and achieving results.
You prove you lead by example and have the show the ability to unleash the potential of high performance teams.
You demonstrate a passion of micro-mobility and providing sustainable transportation.
You are able to travel domestically and internationally as needed.
