FedEx was built on a philosophy that puts people first, one we take seriously. We are an equal opportunity employer and we are committed to a diverse and inclusive workforce in which we provide growth opportunities for all
Our Company
FedEx Express is one of the world's largest express transportation companies and has consistently been selected as one of the top 10 World’s Most Admired Companies by "Fortune" magazine. Every day FedEx delivers for its customers with transportation and business solutions, serving more than 220 countries and territories around the globe. We can serve this global network due to our outstanding team of FedEx team members, who are tasked with making every FedEx experience outstanding.
Our Philosophy
The People-Service-Profit philosophy (P-S-P) describes the principles that govern every FedEx decision, policy or activity. FedEx takes care of our people; they, in turn, deliver the impeccable service demanded by our customers, who reward us with the profitability necessary to secure our future. The essential element in making the People-Service-Profit philosophy such a positive force for the company is where we close the circle, and return these profits back into the business, and invest back in our people. Our success in the industry is attributed to our people. Through our P-S-P philosophy, we have a work environment that encourages team members to be innovative in delivering the highest possible quality of service to our customers. We care for their well-being, and value their contributions to the company.
Our Culture
Our culture is important for many reasons, and we intentionally bring it to life through our behaviors, actions and activities in every part of the world. The FedEx culture and values have been a cornerstone of our success and growth since we began in the early 1970’s. While other companies can copy our systems, infrastructure and processes, our culture makes us unique and is often a differentiating factor as we compete and grow in today’s global marketplace.

What We're Looking For:

your role at Tony’s

Tony’s Chocolonely exists to make 100% slave free the norm in chocolate. As Tony’s Global Content Manager you’re part of the Movement team based in Amsterdam. Together with the Movement team, you take on projects to make illegal child labor and modern slavery a shame of the past. How? By setting the strategies for our content programs for global roll-outs on Tony’s owned as well as earned channels into the right direction!

Lead the Global Social Media Manager and Content Producer and form a close team with your peers in the Movement team, such as the Global PR Manager, Project Manager and Copy Writers. Together, you’ll create impact!
Are you ready to raise the bar with us as our Global Content Manager? Here’s what you’ll do:

Take ownership over the global content calendar
Set up smooth processes for effective collaboration between you, the local marketing teams, the Content Producer and Global Social Media Manager
Create content formats and implications for all owned channels
Closely collaborate with your manager, the Movement Lead, to ensure content is on-brand and your work follows the general marketing and communication strategies
Manage projects from initial brief to final delivery, including creative development, design and production
Provide a clear direction and feedback to your key stakeholders – especially the local marketing teams – and coordinate internal and external production teams
Build on seasonal narrative and apply brand story-telling
Identify trends in the market and translate them into adaptations in your work
Stay on top of the numbers! Manage the budget and track performance data

the ideal candidate

You love transforming creative content into globally relevant marketing campaigns and can identify yourself with Tony’s brand and mission? Read further!

For our Global Content Manager position, we are looking for someone with 7-10 years of experience in relevant positions, out of which you should have spent at least 3 years in a global content management role with coordination of international marketing teams. Social Media Management is part of your expertise – you have a proven track record of ensuring social content aligns with the global content strategies.

You speak and write English on excellent level. Dutch or French are plus. Maybe we should write the following as a benefit, but let’s keep it here for now: You’re experienced working with different cultures and are open to travel to West Africa (once it’s possible and safe to travel again, obviously).
Since Tony’s is not just another chocolate company, but first and foremost an impact company, we’d like you to be serious about our mission. Ideally, you come with experience working on content strategies for a mission-driven company already. Keeping several balls in the air at the same time and working under tight deadlines makes you perform at your best – there are lots of cool projects awaiting you!

what we offer
An enthusiastic team of great, driven colleagues with a lot of love for our mission and Tony’s Chocolonely.

An inspirational and fast-growing international work environment in which you can show that things can be done differently and you will get challenged to raise the bar.

The possibility to help build Tony’s Chocolonely and our mission. Only together can we change the chocolate industry!
A minimum of 28 annual leave days, that’s right minimum. More is fine too.
Once you have a permanent employment contract you are eligible to join our employee shares scheme: Tony’s Golden Wrapper.
We take your development very seriously and have annual personal training budgets.
Once we go back to working from the office, a super tasty lunch & enough (healthy) snacks every day. Better than at home, we hear often..
Working out during work hours; to keep you sharp, and fit! Oh and your sports outfit is on us, of course.
A pretty sweet office in the middle of the Westerpark in Amsterdam and lots of little surprises to make you feel connected to everyone even though we’re working from home for now.
Fun! Don’t get us wrong, we know how to work our socks off too, but do this with loads and loads of fun
And of course, as much chocolate as you can carry!
sounds like you?

Hotel Co 51 is looking for a Regional Sales Manager (Dutch Speaking).


The Regional Sales Manager is accountable for proactively soliciting and handling sales opportunities for our hotels in the Netherlands: Courtyard Amsterdam Arena Atlas and the soon to open Moxy Utrecht. You will be able to demonstrate that you are an individual that regularly exceeds their goals. You will focus on the transient and Group segments including special corporate and leisure for each hotel by contracting local and National companies, achieving participation in corporate travel programs and working with wholesalers to drive leisure demand. You will work with the Global Sales Organisation and individual company’s procurement departments as well as with wholesale partners. You assist in leading all day-to-day activities related to sales with a focus on building long-term, value-based customer relationships that enable achievement of sales objectives.


You report to the Corporate Commercial Lead.


KEY RESPONSIBILITIES


1. Build successful relationships that generate sales opportunities

Build and strengthen relationships with existing and new customers
Work collaboratively with off-property sales channels to ensure sales efforts are coordinated, complementary and not duplicated
Manage and develop relationships with key internal and external stakeholders


2. Manage Sales activities

Participate in sales calls to acquire new business and/or close on business
Activities include sales calls, entertainment, FAM trips, trade shows, etc.
Execute and support the operational aspects of business booked (e.g., generating proposal, writing contract, customer correspondence)


3. Use knowledge of market trends and target customer information to maximise revenue

Identify new business to achieve personal and location revenue goals
Understand the overall market - competitors' strengths and weaknesses, economic trends, supply and demand etc. and know how to sell against them
Serve the customer by understanding their business, business issues and concerns, to offer better business solution.


4. Provide exceptional customer service

Support the company's service and relationship strategy, driving customer loyalty by delivering service excellence throughout each customer experience.
Service our customers in order to grow share of the account.
Interact with guests to obtain feedback on product quality and service levels.


QUALIFICATIONS


The ideal candidate
Has 2 to 5 years’ pro-active sales experience in hospitality industry or related professional area
Has worked in B2B Sales of Hospitality- or Professional Services
Has worked in companies that were an integrated part of international firms
Is a EU-Citizen or unlimited EU-working permission holder
Has a BA or master’s in economics with Major in Hospitality Management
Language Skills: excellent written and spoken Dutch and English
Is a team player and is entrepreneurial
Has affinity with Moxy DIY Concept and next generation travellers


MORE INFORMATION


Hotel Co 51 is a growing hotel management company based in Amsterdam and is part of the Vastint Group, who is the owner of the hotels that are operated by us. Currently we are operating 27 hotels under a franchise agreement with Marriott International Inc., mainly Moxy Hotels, Courtyard by Marriott and Residence Inn by Marriott. More to come in the next years.


Marriott International, Inc. is offering the most powerful portfolio in the industry, 30 brands and 7,000+ properties across 131 countries and territories give people more ways to connect, experience and expand their world. Founded by J. Willard and Alice Marriott, and guided by family leadership since 1927, their principles remain embedded in the company’s culture and in everything we do today. The company is headquartered outside of Washington, D.C. in Bethesda, Maryland, USA.

The Nike Direct Stores team focuses on delivering store-level member centric insights, profiles and landscapes, and analyses member signals to drive product, experience, service and location optimization for our Nike Live, Rise and House of Innovation stores.
WHO WE ARE LOOKING FOR
We are looking for a Nike Direct Stores Analytics Director to join our Insights and Analytics team based in Nike’s European Headquarters. This role is critical to enable the member centric vision of our Nike Direct business, by making every business decision better because of data. As lead of the Nike Direct Stores Analytics team, you are an expert of retail analytics who supports strategic functional decision making, understands current and anticipate future customer and business needs, and unlocks tactical optimization with in-season, real time insights to leaders.
You are an experienced people leader, you feel comfortable working with multiple stakeholders, managing multiple deliverables simultaneously and you are able to deliver quality results within complex timelines, even when things are not certain or the way forward is not clear.

WHAT YOU WILL WORK ON
As Nike Direct Stores Analytics Director you will be leading a team of data and business analysts, delivering cutting edge insights on Nike Direct inline stores to proactively drive Monobrand fleet revenue and productivity, consumer engagement and retention growth. Your key responsabilities will be around:
Store Consumer Analytics, driving store level insights on member signals, profiles and shopping behaviors
Concept, Service & Experience Analytics, using performance and member data to provide recommendations around locations and stores concepts, identifying opportunities for growth of these unique business model concepts through enhanced services and experiences
Assortment and planning analytics, leveraging consumer level data to inform the product lifecycle management in stores, and the most effective products levers
Measurement and performance tracking, standardizing and evolving consumer-level stores KPIs, including member and services KPIs
WHO YOU WILL WORK WITH
You will report into the Nike Direct Analytics Sr Director, with the Nike Direct Inline Stores team as primary stakeholder. You will also be expected to work closely with the Merch, Planning and Member Growth functions to fuel member centric insights into their business decisions.

WHAT YOU BRING
Strong understanding of a retail business in a consumer goods, preferably sportswear, environment
Minimum 8 years’ experience driving end to end analytics projects in a retail environment, either in a business analytics or consulting function or company
Proven ability to prioritize workload, and the capabilities to lead multiple workstreams and projects
Experience managing a team of 3+
Deep understanding of data management (e.g. SQL), visualization (e.g. Tableau), and analytics (e.g. R, Python) languages and tools. Advanced Excel is mandatory
Advanced presentation & visualization skills with ability to turn data into insights and insights into stories and actions

We go beyond the obvious, using intelligence, passion and creativity to inspire new thinking and shape the world we live in.
To start a career that is out of the ordinary, please apply...
Job Details
The Consulting division of Kantar in Amsterdam is specialised in building purposeful organisations: Identifying growth opportunities, creating purposeful brands and building futureproof capabilities are at the core of our expertise. Change now occurs at warp speed and impacts every aspect of how people live and buy. You can imagine that in recent times that pace has only increased further. This challenges companies to look beyond traditional sources and methods to drive growth. We believe that businesses have an unprecedented opportunity to find new sources of growth by harnessing the power of people, technology, data and digital to fulfil consumer needs before people even knew they had them.
About the role
We are looking for a Consultant who has a passion for helping our clients grow through developing and embedding strategies and capability. As a Consultant you work closely with middle and senior management within a team of analysts and consultants to help clients identify and capture (purpose-led) growth opportunities. To do this effectively we are looking for people able to combine “right” and “left” brain thinking to enhance our client deliverables. Our projects focus on developing and delivering optimal strategies, operating models and training programmes for the Marketing, Strategy and Insights departments of our clients.
Consultants play an integral role in all aspects of client engagements by conducting (financial and non-financial data) analysis, designing & analysing models and methodologies, translating data into consumer insights, communicating with clients, developing strategic recommendations, creating client presentations and preparing client workshops. Travel is a part of many client engagements, but usually does not exceed 10% of time requirements, and with COVID we see that moving towards virtual delivery has become more effective and less travel is required than in the past.
KEY DAY-TO-DAY OUTCOMES
Synthesizes and interprets (qualitative and quantitative) data to inform strategic recommendation
Develops strong storylines and is able to convey those to (senior) stakeholders
Strong project management resulting in timely completion of client deliverables
Cultivates meaningful relationships with client teams
Uses entrepreneurial spirit to grasp opportunities to make a difference in a growing and evolving business
CAPABILITIES
A minimum of 2+ years experience working for or with a global brand in brand marketing
Strong academic background, including Bachelors or Masters degree or equivalent
At least one year of experience in consulting, other professional services or client side marketing is required
Must be currently located in the Netherlands and/or hold a valid employment permit to work in the Netherlands
Proven and strong business/brand acumen
Critical and structural thinker, able to synthesize and interpret complex data to inform strategic recommendations
Strong interpersonal and English communication skills , both written and verbal
Resourceful problem-solving skills and ability to take initiative
Excellent organization and time management skills with the ability to multi-task
Strong work ethic with superior attention to detail, with the ability to work independently and within a team
Excellent working knowledge of Microsoft Office, in particular PowerPoint and Excel; experience with coding and/or analytical tools such as SPSS a plus

JOIN US
At Kantar we have an integrated way of rewarding our people based around a simple, clear and consistent set of principles. Our approach helps to ensure we are market competitive and support a pay for performance culture, where your reward and career progression opportunities are linked to what you deliver. We go beyond the obvious, using intelligence, passion and creativity to inspire new thinking and shape the world we live in. Apply for a career that’s out of the ordinary and join us.
We love to hear about your affinity to brands in general and how our company fits into your career ambitions.
About Kantar Consulting
We are a powerfully diverse mix of cultural, innovation and future experts, marketing, brand and organization consultants, data and marketing scientists. We take a whole human approach to understanding the customer and the commercial opportunity, and a whole business approach to delivering our growth strategy through your people, brands and total customer experience. As part of WPP and Kantar, Kantar Consulting is a member of the world’s largest network of advertising and marketing consultancies. https://consulting.kantar.com/
In Amsterdam we have a highly diverse team of 35 people including 12+ nationalities. We have a strong culture, the team is challenging and supportive towards one another and there is focus on personal development. Working hours can be organized very flexibly

Job Title: Supply Chain Operations (Marketplace Operations) Senior Business Analyst
Job Description:
Become a Part of the NIKE, Inc. Team
NIKE, Inc. does more than outfit the world’s best athletes. It is a place to explore potential, obliterate boundaries and push out the edges of what can be. The company looks for people who can grow, think, dream and create. Its culture thrives by embracing diversity and rewarding imagination. The brand seeks achievers, leaders and visionaries. At NIKE, Inc. it’s about each person bringing skills and passion to a challenging and constantly evolving game.
The NIKE, Inc. Supply Chain team is the engine that propels product around the world. Supply Chain experts ensure that every year, almost a billion units of footwear, apparel and equipment arrive at the right place, at the right time. To ensure this complex job goes off without a hitch, Supply Chain teams work with a network of more than 50 distribution centers, thousands of accountants, and more than 100,000 retail stores worldwide — making the impossible happen every single day.
Become a Part of the NIKE, Inc. Team
NIKE, Inc. does more than outfit the world's best athletes. It is a place to explore potential, obliterate boundaries and push out the edges of what can be. The company looks for people who can grow, think, dream and create. Its culture thrives by embracing diversity and rewarding imagination. The brand seeks achievers, leaders and visionaries. At Nike, it’s about each person bringing skills and passion to a challenging and constantly evolving game.
At Nike, the EMEA Supply Chain Operation (Marketplace Operations (MPO)) team takes pride in serving the consumer in the connected marketplace – whether they shop in a Nike store or online, or at one of our retail partners. We are relentlessly elevating our strategy and driving improvement in our supply chain to reach a more premium service level for our consumer.
At Nike, the EMEA Supply Chain Operation (Marketplace Operations (MPO)) team takes pride in serving the consumer in the connected marketplace – whether they shop in a Nike store or online, or at one of our retail partners. We are relentlessly elevating our strategy and driving improvement in our supply chain to reach a more premium service level for our consumer.
We are recruiting 2x positions, 1 for Nike Direct Digital, and 1 for a Strategic Wholesale Partner
WHO WE ARE LOOKING FOR;
As our Supply Chain Operations (Marketplace Operations) Senior Business Analyst you will be responsible for crafting and driving innovative and analytical solutions to sophisticated supply chain challenges and opportunities in support of key operational objectives. You will have strong problem-solving skills, the ability to break down unstructured questions, connect the dots and turn large volumes of data into impactful business insights. You feel comfortable working with multiple cross functional partners, managing several projects simultaneously, as well as operate optimally and independently, even when things are uncertain, or the way forward is not clear.
WHAT YOU WILL WORK ON;
Craft and deploy effective analytical solutions to tackle key supply chain issues
Deploy predictive or explanatory models and/or experimentation processes that help Nike understand, describe and predict consumer behaviors, e.g. extracting deep interests and behavioral tendencies from supply chain performance data
Design end-to-end testing, research, and analytic plans to seek opportunities to improve delivery performance and consumer satisfaction.
Work with key partners to understand requirements and improve opportunities to drive knowledge into action
Work independently and take initiative to identify, explore and overcome problems
Champion analytical thinking and identify opportunities to embed analytical techniques in operations teams
Collaborate with partner teams to define relevant analytical questions
WHO YOU WILL WORK WITH; You'll work in a cross-functional, agile environment that spans across EMEA and services the business unit’s operational needs. You’ll be reporting into the Supply Chain Director (Marketplace Operations Director) and will work closely with the operations team, product owners, data engineering teams, central analytics functions, and the broader analytical community at Nike.
WHAT YOU BRING
5+ years of professional experience in an Analytics role with an emphasis on building data and analytical products in a retail environment. Supply chain/Logistics experience preferred
Deep understanding of data management (SQL), visualization (Tableau preferred), and analytics (Python preferred) languages and tools. Advanced Excel is required.
Strong data wrangling experience with structured and unstructured data
Advanced presentation & visualization skills with ability to turn data into insights and insights into stories and actions
History of analytical teamwork and building collaborative business partner relationships
Strong communication skills with the ability to simplify the complex

NIKE, Inc. is a growth company that looks for team members to grow with it. Nike offers a generous total rewards package, casual work environment, a diverse and inclusive culture, and an electric atmosphere for professional development. No matter the location, or the role, every Nike employee shares one galvanizing mission: To bring inspiration and innovation to every athlete* in the world.
NIKE, Inc. is committed to employing a diverse workforce. Qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, veteran status, or disability.

NIKE, Inc. is a growth company that looks for team members to grow with it. Nike offers a generous total rewards package, casual work environment, a diverse and inclusive culture, and an electric atmosphere for professional development. No matter the location, or the role, every Nike employee shares one galvanizing mission: To bring inspiration and innovation to every athlete* in the world.
NIKE, Inc. is committed to employing a diverse workforce. Qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, veteran status, or disability.

Salary range: 30-60k (depending on experience)

The mission.

The world does not need a slightly better website or app. What it does need, is an amazing Veriteer product manager that understands how to make consumers' lives better by crafting incredible interactions across all channels. Our product managers don't just wrangle stories and mindlessly go through the motions of Agile , they pull out all the stops to connect brand value to consumer value, drive product development and deliver measurable outcomes. Above all, like every Veriteer they have a clear passion for what they do and they raise the bar in every piece of work. If this sounds like you, we'd love to speak to you.

In practical terms, here's the kind of thing you might get up to:

As a product manager at Veriteer you will work on a variety of transformational projects to manage the vision of digital products for our partner brands. Practically, this means that you will do some or all of the following:

Collaboratively develop product vision and direction for global brands;
Create and refine detailed stories and requirements across multi-disciplinary Agile teams;
Coordinate teams of business analysts, functional and technical experts and create amazing team culture;
Plan and prioritise feature backlog and development of the products;
Workshop and meeting facilitation;
Test solutions to accept developed stories;
Work closely with Product Leadership to integrate your product roadmap into programme and company objectives;
Advise on eCommerce, Marketing or Customer Service capability best practices;
Coach clients in product and agile methodologies;
Engage senior executives to provide visibility of programme/project status; and
Be an advocate for more effective ways of getting things done.

In addition, you will get to be part of Veriteer's exciting adventure.

We want to walk the talk, and demonstrate what good really looks like. This means bringing a range of project management skills to help our partner brands achieve better performance.
You will be working both independently or as part of a project team depending on the project at both client sites and in our offices.
The dynamic nature of our work means that your tasks can vary, sometimes day-to-day, and include workshop facilitation, preparation of documents and presentations, delivery of training and more.
Our work often requires us to co-locate with our partner brands on their sites.
We need passionate and ambitious product managers that can being the tip of the arrow on all of our work, both internally and for partner brands.

The bit about you.

As a product manager at Veriteer, you will have:

Practical experience working with Agile methodologies in multi-team agile environments;
Ideally, experience working with system integrators and technology vendors;
Ideally, experience working with databases and APIs;
Ideally, experience working in a consulting capacity on client-based projects;
Ability to work under pressure whilst delivering against many conflicting priorities;
A knack for communicating to executive stakeholders; and
View of the big picture and an ability to develop effective business strategies.

All Veriteers strive to achieve the incredible, and we believe that diversity will help us achieve this:

Current capability is more important than background. It doesn't matter where you've come from if you can bring aptitude and experience to your role.
Personal impact is more important than academic attainment. You can have demonstrated this in one or more of a business, creative or technology discipline.
Teamwork is more important than individual skills. Although Veriteers will work in different ways, these must be compatible with, and tolerant of, all of your colleagues.
We value people joining Veriteer from another career. This could be from the retail or FMCG industries, a strategy consultancy, a software development lab, project management or something completely different...just be clear about what you bring.

Experience aside, we know what it takes to be a Veriteer. If the following sounds like you and the people you want to work with, then Veriteer will feel like home, so get in touch:

You are honest
You are collaborative
You commit to the incredible
You want everyone to value the time they spend with you

The bit about us.

Veriteer is a customer experience consultancy on a journey of rapid expansion. We partner with the world's biggest brands and high-growth startups to set customer-focused strategies, create successful customer experiences, and enable the delivery of ground-breaking initiatives.

It's not easy to be a Veriteer, we're doing the stuff that no one else can do. So bringing someone new into the family is always our biggest decision, and our biggest investment.

We come in all shapes and sizes, but we all back each other in our quest for the incredible.

This means we share a number of key characteristics:

We always believe that there is a better way;
We are the calm in the storm; and
We have a redoubtable will and an indomitable spirit.

The small print.

You must be able to work in the EU with no visa requirements or restrictions, and have no existing preclusion from working in the USA.
You must be flexible to travel, including internationally.
You will be provided with all technology, insurances and expenses to enable you to perform your duties as expected.
Membership of a professional body is not required, but all professional certifications and memberships should be detailed in your application for this post.
You must declare up front, any restrictions on the nature of work that you can perform, including any client-specific covenants in place that would limit your ability to work for them.
Please note that have locations across Europe and the UK, so if this role is not in the right location for you, then contact us anyway, and see what we can offer.

As a global leader in (Tech) Consulting, Assurance, Tax and Transactions services, we’re using the finance products, expertise and systems we’ve developed to build a better working world. That starts with a culture that believes in giving you the training, opportunities and creative freedom to make things better.
Within (Tech) Consulting specialized consultants work in various disciplines; from developing until implementing a strategy within diverse company branches and different segments. Our multidisciplinary teams crossing cultural borders work at companies within the fields of Data Analytics, Technology, IT, Data Privacy, Cybersecurity, Strategy, Finance, Risk, Supply Chain & Operations and Life Science & Healthcare. We believe that by managing our clients’ challenges we can make a critical difference.
What you can expect – enriching experiences that will last a lifetime
EY 's Supply Chain & Operations (SC&O) practice supports clients across different domains: Service Operations (both private and public), Supply Chain, Procurement, Manufacturing Excellence and Smart Factory. In this role as consultant your main focus will be Service Excellence.
In the Service Operations team, we help leading companies to increase effectivity of their operation, ranging from small process improvement to entire organizational transformations. When we say ‘Service Operations’, we mean all (highly repetitive) core processes in service oriented organizations as well as supportive back-offices or Shared Service Organizations.
Together with our team, you will actively contribute to these improvements by preparing and facilitating training and workshops, coaching the customer, and realizing tangible process improvements through the execution of improvement projects. In doing so, you are making big impact and generate value for our clients.
As a consultant you will be in charge of sub-projects as part of larger transformation programs. You work independently as well as in different teams, both virtually with the client and/or at the client’s location. You coach and support other EY consultants and client project members, analyze all elements of the client’s operation and processes and are very well able to present these findings both internally and to the client.
Based on your knowledge and experience, you build strong relationships with both external customers and internal EY colleagues. On top of that, you make a contribution to explore and develop new opportunities for exciting new projects.
You have an active role within the team and contribute to the development of the knowledge and growth of the team.
What you can contribute – skills for shaping the future
Minimum of 1 year work experience in Consultancy and/or within the field of Operational Excellence / Lean / Continuous Improvement within Services Organizations.
A Master's degree preferably in the field of Business, Operations Management, Supply Chain Management, (Industrial) Engineering or similar studies.
You have a passion for Operational Excellence or Continuous Improvement in service environments and experience and knowledge regarding project management. Lean Six Sigma Green Belt/Black Belt certified is an advantage.
Fluent in Dutch and English.
Excellent analytical capabilities, strong communication, influencing and people skills, result-driven, the ability to be pragmatic in execution of projects and conceptual thinking.

What we are offering – an inspiring work environment
We offer a competitive remuneration package where you will be rewarded for your individual and team performance. Our comprehensive Total Rewards package includes support for flexible working and career development. At EY, your competencies and your areas of interest will determine your future, plus we offer you:
Join in the steep learning curve and improve your skillset and earn management responsibilities.
Acknowledgement: Receive constructive support, coaching and feedback as a part of our Leadership & Development process on a regular base; feedback of counselors and planning of personal and professional development goals.
Become part of international projects through our global network and work along multicultural teams.
Find out more here about the many benefits to which you are entitled as employee at EY.

Become part of our high-performing teams!
If you have any questions, please contact Liselotte Breitenstein via +31(0)6 21251438 or via email Liselotte.Breitenstein@nl.ey.com

An (online) assessment and a pre employment screening are part of the application procedure.
Due to laws and regulations, and because EY (and in some cases its clients) has high demands on the reliability and integrity of its employees, every new employee will be screened. Depending on your rank the pre employment screening could contain the following: Certificate of Conduct (in Dutch: VOG) or - if requesting a Dutch VOG is not possible - Criminal Background Check of the country you are currently living or have lived during the last five years, integrity questionnaire, verification of ID, diploma’s and/or work experience and consultation of the Dutch insolvency registry.
If you have any questions, please contact the recruiter as mentioned above.

Zoomies help the world connect — and deliver happiness while doing it. We set out to build the best video conferencing product for the enterprise, and today help people communicate better with products like Zoom Phone, Zoom Rooms, Zoom Video Webinars, Zoom Apps, and OnZoom.
We’re problem-solvers and self-starters, working at a fast pace to design solutions with our customers and users in mind. Here, you’ll work across teams to dig deep into impactful projects that are changing the way people communicate, and enjoy opportunities to advance your career in a diverse, inclusive environment.
Business Development Representative Nordics
Since 2011 Zoom has grown at an extraordinary rate and is continuing to grow. Our global expansion gives you the opportunity to be part of a company that has historically embraced leadership, honesty, innovation and community.
We are calling on people who want to be part of upholding our values, our commitment to our customers, the community and the Zoom family.
If you have the skillset we are looking for, we would love to hear from you.
Who are we?
Zoom helps businesses and organizations bring their teams together in a frictionless virtual environment to get more done. Our cloud platform is easy and reliable for all your communication needs: video, voice, content sharing and chat. Our products work seamlessly across mobile devices, desktops, telephones, and room systems.
What role do we need you for?
Business Development Representatives Nordics (BDR) Danish, Norwegian or Swedish speaker is a key role within our Amsterdam team. This position involves creative outbound outreach (so to not mince words - cold calling). Your job will be to interview prospects, discover their needs and then deliver happiness by matching them the perfect Zoom solution. Once you’ve qualified the lead, you hand over the heavy lifting to your business partner in the sales team. If your ambition is to move into an account executive role, this is the ideal starting point.
Have you developed some of the below career skills that will be needed to hit the ground running? (rework with minimum requirements)
An engaging and effective communicator
Detail oriented, tenacious, responsible and self motivated
Receptive to feedback and willingness to adaptable
Active Listener - to customers as well as management
What you can expect to be doing day to day
Identify, develop relationships, and schedule meetings with Major accounts. These are companies with 1,001 employees up to 10,000+ employees (non Named Accounts) and Enterprise 5,000+ level prospect accounts
Strategize with top-producing Account Executives to target prospect accounts to fill pipeline and develop overall skill-set
Conduct high-level conversations with C-level and VP-level Executives to address business needs.
Create strategic emails to target prospect accounts
Continuously maintain and update Salesforce.com
Evangelize Zoom product offerings across territory or named accounts
Conduct on-going research to identify new leads, obtain contact information and begin targeting through
Achieve quarterly qualified lead/meeting quotas
BDRs will utilize Salesforce and other marketing automation efforts to qualify contacts, and ultimately give our sales team more qualified opportunities for gaining new customers.
What skills will you develop while in this role.
With coaching and encouragement from our trained managers we will work with you to further develop yourself professionally in areas such as:
Product research
Resilience
Adaptability
Problem solving
Multitasking skills
Flexibility
In addition you will know how to:
Respond and not react
Deliver in high pressure situations
Stay grounded
Speak either Danish, Norwegian or Swedish at a professional level
All together we aim to prepare you for future advancement in to an account executive role (hopefully) within Zoom.
Why you’ll love working here.
The benefits of the product - you are connecting the world and making a difference.
You’re in a Service Oriented Culture - We all look out for each other
Rewards for your performance - Zoom shows it’s appreciation to its employees
Each office globally is encouraged to discover and express their office’s culture and how they deliver happiness within their teams.
Be part of Global virtual clubs and events sponsored and/ or hosted by Zoom employees
Here’s what the team thinks…
 “Zoom does so much more than what it says on the tin! Not only does Zoom deliver happiness, but it allows for each employee to enter into the most inclusive, diverse and rewarding family unit. Pinch yourself moments happen every day - the product, the culture, the growth…Zoom truly is la crème de la crème.” Laura Finn, BDR with Zoom since May 2019
“After graduating from university, I wanted to start a career more than a job.
I found in Zoom purposes, amazing friends, passions and the impact I always wanted to make. I realised I didn’t join a simple company but a great family.
Zoom focuses on our growth with a supportive and inclusive culture and it keeps exceeding my expectations as a company. I’m grateful to be part of such a team.”
Simon BDR since June 2020

Job Title: Team Leader Live Operations: NW Europe
Job Description:
Team Leader Live Operations: NW Europe

Are you a natural leader with a passion for logistics and tech? Enjoy bridging departments to improve operations on an international scale? Then we're looking for you!
Our story (the bitesize version)

From fantastic fries to superb sushi, we deliver millions of delicious dishes every day. Having expanded as Just Eat Takeaway.com, we're now active in 24 countries worldwide – taking 250 million orders in the first half of 2020.
Many of those deliveries happen thanks to ‘Scoober'. That's our courier logistics operation, supporting restaurants in getting the food to your door. Our Live Operations experts play a vital role in Scoober, ensuring we're always in top gear.
All about the role

As our Team Leader Live Operations: NW Europe, you manage specialists across six countries, ensuring they achieve the best results possible. That includes developing all culture, process and performance improvements, developing a highly effective real-time response team.
In this wide-ranging Live Ops role, your focus also includes:
Achieving the best possible efficiency in terms of service levels, costs and support for the Netherlands, Belgium, France, Switzerland, Denmark and Norway
Reporting into the Global Live Operations Team Leader, and supporting Supervisors. You translate business vision into data-driven decisions & deliver on these
Working closely with our workforce management & training team to ensure the development and optimization of your team
Building strong relationships with the Local Operations and Customer Service departments for effective collaboration, information sharing & KPI improvement opportunities
Defining, regularly evaluating and reporting on KPIs related to growth & development
Can you deliver…

Here are the skills and experience we need from our Live Ops lead:
Extensive experience in an operational environment, including 3+ years' experience in a managerial position, leading staff in areas like logistics, corporate hospitality etc.
Excellent analytical skills and the ability to produce valuable logistical insights
A strategic mindset, with a clear understanding of the wider issues impacting your markets
A proven track record in performance improvement, change management, optimising departmental procedures and exceeding targets & KPIs in a customer support environment
Enthusiastic about working in a dynamic, constantly-evolving environment and coaching your team through the ride
Skilled in connecting with other departments on an international scale to boost performance and stakeholders management
Excellent English (written & spoken) and good communication skills. Fluent French and Dutch is a big advantage
Here is our offer

Like the perfect food pairing, your expertise and these great rewards belong together:
Competitive salary
A varied and impactful leadership role with international scope
Fantastic company and team events
A dynamic, friendly workplace in the heart of Amsterdam (when you're in the office)
Contribution to your pension plan
26 days of holiday per year
Budget for internal & external training and conferences
Working from home allowance and a budget for ordering lunches
Join us on our Live Ops journey. Click Apply Now and send us your CV!

We have a fast paced, high growth culture which means you’ll have a lot of autonomy and flexibility to help build the company. You will be responsible for helping our clients maximize value from our product, and to transform how our clients perform in a digitized era. You will play an integral role in ensuring product engagement and building strong working relationships through exceptional client service to help grow UiPath business. As a Global Account Manager, you will represent the voice of our existing clients and prospects alike, and liaise with internal cross functional teams to shape the future of UiPath’s product development strategy.
This is what you’ll do at UiPath:
Identify new opportunities within our Global Accounts; engage meaningfully with C level and Executive decision makers at the enterprise levels.
Develop and maintain a comprehensive multi-year global account plan to meet or exceed customer objectives and share of wallet.
Forecast and manage sales pipeline to meet revenue targets and company goals.
Operate as the main point of contact for all matters specific to the global account.

Job Title: Sales Manager - Emerging Markets - Northern Europe
Job Description:
Zoomies help the world connect — and deliver happiness while doing it. We set out to build the best video conferencing product for the enterprise, and today help people communicate better with products like Zoom Phone, Zoom Rooms, Zoom Video Webinars, Zoom Apps, and OnZoom.
We’re problem-solvers and self-starters, working at a fast pace to design solutions with our customers and users in mind. Here, you’ll work across teams to dig deep into impactful projects that are changing the way people communicate, and enjoy opportunities to advance your career in a diverse, inclusive environment.
As part of our growth we're looking for an experienced sales leader to join our EMEA team as an Enterprise & Majors Team Manager. This role leads our growing and successful majors team which has a focus on clients with 1000+ users for Majors and 10000+ for Enterprise to cover Northern Europe.
Responsibilities:
To build and lead the Emerging Markets Enterprise team to success by fostering a culture of sales excellence through rigorous discovery, innovation, integrity and client satisfaction.
Ensure excellence with reporting, pipeline management and client happiness.
Be an innovator that will help our team discover new ways to sell our service and drive new business initiatives.
Develop, launch and execute an effective sales strategy designed to deliver on team goals.
Prepare and present sales presentations to Executive and C- level prospective clients.
Manage the sales pipeline from first contact through the successful implementation of our solution.
Communicate regularly and effectively with Sales Operations, providing accurate and timely sales forecasts and maintain accurate records in all internal CRM and reporting tools.
Drive team growth through effective and strategic hiring.
Continuously work to educate and promote growth for direct reports.

Requirements:
Proven leadership experience managing a high performing team in (ideally) Unified Communications, Cloud Telephony, Video or Web collaboration solutions sales.
Experience of leading/selling business transformative solutions in the areas of Digital Workplace Transformation.
Inspiring leadership persona, focussing teams on a philosophy of sales development & execution through a business outcome & client satisfaction approach.

Thorough and demonstrable knowledge and execution of sales methodology
The ability to manage complex sales situations and large projects.
Demonstrable excellence in communication & presentations skills with ability to build relevant & strategic messaging.
Collaboration and relationship skills
Detail oriented, organised, ethical, responsible, self-motivated.

Are you inspired by the rapidly changing environment today’s CFOs operate in? Do you want to help our clients’ CFOs and finance functions adapt and excel in a new digital world and reap the benefits of advanced analytics? Are you eager to learn and apply the latest in digital technologies at our clients? Are you a motivated and experienced finance (consulting) professional who combines EQ with IQ? Interested in working with clients across all industries and in a skilled and fun team to operate at the intersection of business and technology?
Then the position of CFO & Enterprise Value Senior Manager is what you are looking for!

Your Job
You will be part of the Accenture Strategy & Consulting CFO & Enterprise Value team, a highly skilled and motivated team to drive the CFO agenda. You will help leading companies anticipate business and technology trends, design innovative operating models, and improve their ability to create valuable insights from data and build the CFO organization of the future.
We offer you many opportunities to grow and develop your finance expertise, consulting and leadership skills, through practical experience in an international environment and training. Through your projects you will gain in depth insights in many leading organizations within a short period of time. You will have the knowledge and expertise of the global Accenture network at your disposal.
As a CFO & Enterprise Value Senior Manager, you will:
Interact and manage relationships with CFOs and their direct reports and help them to:
Drive greater efficiency using data and advanced analytics
Foster new Digitally driven business models by building a CFO organization with finance professionals with the right skills that is fit for the future
Collaborate with CEOs to develop data- and insight-driven strategies,—creating sustainable growth, long-term value and profound change
Lead and manage larger transformation programs and multiple highly motivated cross-functional and often international teams across various client engagements
Inspire your team(s) to deliver the best every day and develop their careers through coaching, training and leadership
Take ownership to develop and close business opportunities at new and existing clients
Build the Accenture business by developing and implementing new ideas and client offerings
Collaborate across the various businesses of Accenture (including Strategy & Consulting, Interactive, Technology, Operations) to bring the best solution to our clients’ CFOs
Your team
Our consultants in Strategy & Consulting are changing businesses every day using deep industry insights, knowledge and innovative ideas. Positioned at the crucial intersection of business, technology and industry, we devise creative new strategies based on trends, insights and data. With an eye for competitive advantage, digital disruption, operating models and the future workforce, we take on the challenge of designing and implementing transformative business solutions, using the newest technology.
Our research-based advice and situational analyses enable our clients to act with speed and confidence. Whether we're investigating complex issues or identifying new opportunities, our work always comes down to one thing: unlocking value and creating real, tangible impacts.

Your background
Master’s (WO) degree in Economics, Finance, Business, Econometrics, Computer Science or Engineering
Minimum of 8 years of relevant consulting experience, either through your work at other consulting firms or through leading operational improvements or business transformation programs
Fluent in Dutch and English
Deep understanding of the challenges that CFOs face, finance operating models, intelligent finance processes and enabling ERP technologies
Experience with data modelling, analytics and data visualization and affinity with artificial intelligence and machine learning technology
Strong presentation and storytelling skills, ability to build rapport with CFOs and senior finance professionals
Leadership and communication skills to mentor, challenge, advise, and coach team members and foster a team-oriented environment
Strong business development skills and relevant network in the CFO functions / community of our (potential) clients
Experience from positions such as finance director, senior business controller or FP&A director is a plus

Our offer
Accenture is an incredible place to work - and keep learning. By joining us, you’ll become part of a global company with a world-class brand and reputation. Besides the work we do for our clients, we’re proud of our vibrant, diverse workplace culture: we believe in openness and honesty, fairness and equality, common sense and realism. We want to get to know the real you and help you explore and grow - whatever it is you're great at. So, you will always have lots of learning opportunities (formal and informal) to improve your role-specific skills and expertise.

Besides our high-profile, challenging projects and our nurturing work environment, we offer excellent employee benefits, including:

A flexible transport arrangement that suits your personal situation (electric car or bicycle, flexible budget including NS business card)
An expense allowance
Discount on Accenture shares
The possibility to work 4 x 9 hours a week

Interested?
Are you ready to join Accenture for a career where you can be yourself and do what you love? Apply now and change the world around you.

Questions? Connect with Inge Neuteboom through inge.neuteboom@accenture.com.

You will be part of the Finance team and be reporting to the Senior Collections Manager. As a Collections Specialist, you will hold a customer-facing role and will primarily be responsible for contacting our customers with overdue account balances. If you love talking to customers, are familiar with accounting practices and can remain friendly, calm and authoritative, then this is the job for you!

What you'll be responsible for

Making outbound collection calls in a professional manner while keeping and improving customer relations
Resolving client-billing problems and reducing accounts receivable delinquency, applying good customer service in a timely manner
Collecting customer payments in accordance with payment due dates
Maintaining accurate and complete notes of conversations with delinquent customers in order to facilitate further collection activity
Identifying issues attributing to account delinquency and discuss them with management and with Sales Rep
Setting up and documenting payment arrangements with debtors
Providing timely follow-up on payment arrangements
Identifying, preparing and forwarding accounts to the appropriate collection agencies
Interacting with collection agencies through on-going communication to resolve delinquent accounts
Meeting monthly recovery targets

What you'll be bringing to the team

1-2 years of experience in a collections position or customer facing role
Strong English and Dutch communication skills (oral/written)

Who you are

You are self-motivated, and you possess strong organizational skills
A problem solver with an analytical mind
A strong Critical thinker and skilled negotiator
Someone who is able to work independently and to adapt to a fast changing environment
Detail oriented and have an eye for accuracy

Even better if you have, but not necessary

Fluency in French
Knowledge of Mac OS X
Proficiency in any accounting system
Knowledge of Excel (VLOOKUP, Pivot tables)

What's in it for you

Lots of autonomy, flexible and fun work culture
Amazing benefits & perks, including equity for all Lightspeeders
A chance to be a part of an operations team building the foundations of a global payments business
Opportunity to learn, expand your skill set, forge wonderful relationships and make your mark within the diverse and inclusive Lightspeed family, a true Canadian tech success story

Who we are

Lightspeed (TSX/NYSE: LSPD) powers small and medium-sized businesses with its cloud-based, omni-channel commerce platforms in over 100 countries around the world. With smart, scalable, and dependable point of sale systems, Lightspeed provides all-in-one solutions that help restaurants and retailers sell across channels, manage operations, engage with consumers, accept payments, and grow their business.

Headquartered in Montréal, Canada, Lightspeed is trusted by favourite local businesses, where the community goes to shop and dine. Lightspeed has offices in Canada, USA, Europe, and Australia.

We're passionate about enabling people to do their best work. Come work with us and find out what you can do!

Are you enthusiastic, energetic and eager to make a difference? At OIA Global we offer high calibre solutions involving transportation, warehousing, packaging, materials management, and supply chain optimisation programs. We are looking to grow and develop our 4PL services to new customers using any or all transportation methods for the movement of their products and are in need of passionate sales people to support this expansion. If you are a dynamic personality with a good understanding of freight forwarding, we would love to hear from you.
You will be able to identify and provide 4PL solutions for the transportation management needs of customers and prospects. This includes companies with an existing 4PL model in place as well as companies currently having a 3PL model in place and can be guided into a transition towards a 4PL model.
This role would suit someone who wants to progress into a business development role who has extensive knowledge of 4PL Account Management skills.
You will be responsible for:
Developing and maintaining long term strategic relationships with decision makers on all levels with new and existing customers.
Identifying prospective customers through your own research.
Ensuring high customer satisfaction and an excellent customer experience.
Real-time updates of the Customer Relation Management (CRM) system
Providing weekly sales updates to the Global 4PL management team as well as the EMEA Head of Sales.
Follow-up on sales leads assigned through the CRM system.
Customer visits throughout the EMEA region to call on regular and prospective customers to solicit additional business and/or present OIA Global 4PL services.
Creating and presenting formal presentations representing OIA Global and its service capabilities.
Coordinating and assisting with customer implementation and on-going maintenance, including the coordination of customer training.
Quoting prices and credit terms for business obtained in collaboration with the global 4PL management team.
Investigating and facilitating resolution of customer supply chain management problems and identifies opportunities.
What we need from you:
Solid sales skills to include presentation skills, account analysis and development, and sales prospecting
Strong interpersonal, analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills
Engaging, collaborative and innovative presentation and (online) meeting skills.
Comprehensive knowledge and understanding of International freight forwarding operations and supply chain management required.
Eagerness to learn and understand customers processes, systems and performance indicators to relate to customers supply chain management challenges and identify opportunities for OIA Global’s services.
Working knowledge of accounting, logistics, pricing and informational technology.
Ability to work and deliver under strict deadlines.
Strong negotiation skills
Resilient, tenacious and persistent
Self-motivated and performance driven
 Education and Experience:
Bachelor’s degree from a four-year college/university; or 5-10 years related experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience
1-5 years of 4PL services
5-10 years air/ocean freight forwarding and/or supply chain management
Proven business development / account management success, negotiation, persuasion and presentation skills
What we can offer you:
Competitive remuneration package including a personalised sales incentive plan
Work performance indicators such as customer calls per week, and quotation activity will be flexible and personal to each individual.
Flexibility on location and office alignment, depending on personal circumstances
Training and development
Friendly, fun and relaxed culture

Know Your Client (KYC) Operator
Goal
Provide operational support to business units with regards to Know Your Client procedures with regard to New Client Adoption.
Responsibilities
The Know Your Client (KYC) Operator role focuses on new client adoption (NCA) and exceptions in line with regulatory standards and jurisdictions.
The KYC Operator assists the Bank’s business units, managing all KYC requirements with appropriate governance and controls. They operate in an environment of strict adherence to Key Operating procedures (‘KOP’s) and Desk Top Procedures (DTP’s) to achieve accurate and timely completion of NCAs.
Ensure the correct processing of KYC client static data requests, within the agreed SLA times
Perform due diligence on national and international corporate clients in line with policies and procedures
Manage internal client relationships to ensure the KYC process will be handled in a timely manner.
Highlight and escalate operational, regulatory and other risks to management or risk functions
Level Descriptors
Develops competence by performing structured work assignments
Has conceptual knowledge of theories, practices and procedures in a discipline
Uses existing procedures to solve routine or standard problems; applies limited judgment and discretion
Has limited decision-making authority; works within technical guidelines and direction to achieve objectives and meet deadlines
Education, knowledge and working experience
Bachelor degree
Pre: 1-2 years of experience in KYC / AFC
Experienced in Word and Excel
Fluent in Dutch and English

We embrace a culture reflecting a variety of perspectives, insights and backgrounds to drive innovation.
