Job Title: EMEAR Webex Northern Europe Field Marketing Manager
Job Description:
Cisco Webex is growing faster and becoming more innovative than ever. Technology is one of the most exciting sectors to work in and Cisco is the #1 Best Place to Work in the world for the second year in a row (Great Place to Work and Fortune). There couldn’t be a better time to become a Cisconian !

This is a dynamic role for strategic, proactive and results-driven marketing manager who will work within the EMEAR Collaboration team. The role will focus on managing the Collaboration field sales and partner enablement, alongside the regional Cisco team, and the wider global Collaboration team.
This person should have strong organizational skills and a balanced understanding of omni-channel marketing, corporate marketing, partner marketing, and channel activities.

Key responsibilities include managing and supporting marketing programs ranging from country events, field demand generation, social selling and tracking KPI’s to drive increased market adoption and meet revenue goals alongside field priorities.

What you’ll do: Work as a part of a field marketing team focusing on sales and partner enablement for the Cisco Webex team across Europe, Middle East, Africa and Russia Focus on enablement in the form of country events, content localisation , campaigns, customer and partner advocacy Co-build quarterly plan and manage budget to support Northern Europe field marketing activities and budgets Work with Northern Europe country sales team to enhance brand, demand and pipeline Work with Northern Europe partners to build joint campaigns to drive demand and growth of Cisco Webex Manage audience-based marketing (ABM) campaigns in alignment with field priorities Manage social selling field enablement programmes

Who you’ll work with:
You will work with a fun and hard-working marketing team of Cisconian’s based across EMEA. You will also work closely with sales teams, partner marketing teams and the wider global Collaboration Marketing group.

Who you are:
You have experience with business and marketing strategy across the North of Europe. You are fluent in English and have a second language. You are a well-rounded field marketer that can think strategically, proactively and outside of the box. You can build marketing plans for various segments, lines of business and verticals.

You have proven experience in field enablement strategy and implementation including demand generation, funnel growth and sales metric tracking. You have the ability to develop actionable insights from data in order to influence business decisions. You can synthesize results from various sources of information to provide recommendations.

Our minimum requirements for this role: Bachelor's degree in Marketing or Business, or equivalent digital marketing experience 5+ years of field marketing Fluent in English required (second language a plus) Strong understanding of Collaboration and Webex Strong experience in collaboration with global and country teams in driving regional execution Strong presentation and communication skills in presenting to cross functional teams A highly motivated individual who thrives in a fast-paced team environment and is readily adaptable to changing market and organizational requirements Strong project management skills with ability to execute marketing programs from planning, conceptualization, execution and measurement Experience driving field marketing strategies that generate measurable demand Experience building audience based marketing campaigns Experience building social selling campaigns

Highly desirable: Ability to travel to company, industry, and event locations if needed Fast learner and agile Entrepreneurial work ethic, sense of urgency and desire to succeed Team player Results-driven Self-Starter Strong understanding of lead and campaign systems Strong understanding of marketing automation (Eloqua) best practices. Speak another northern European Language SaaS background
We Are Cisco
#WeAreCisco, where each person is unique, but we bring our talents to work as a team and make a difference. Here’s how we do it.

We embrace digital, and help our customers implement change in their digital businesses. Some may think we’re “old” (30 years strong!) and only about hardware, but we’re also a software company. And a security company. An AI/Machine Learning company. We even invented an intuitive network that adapts, predicts, learns and protects. No other company can do what we do – you can’t put us in a box!

But “Digital Transformation” is an empty buzz phrase without a culture that allows for innovation, creativity, and yes, even failure (if you learn from it.)
Day to day, we focus on the give and take. We give our best, we give our egos a break and we give of ourselves (because giving back is built into our DNA.) We take accountability, we take bold steps, and we take difference to heart. Because without diversity of thought and a commitment to equality for all, there is no moving forward.

So, you have colourful hair? Don’t care. Tattoos? Show off your ink. Like polka dots? That’s cool.

#LI-NW1

Job Title: SMB Account Exec VAST - Middle East (Arabic Speaker)
Job Description:
Zoomies help the world connect — and deliver happiness while doing it. We set out to build the best video conferencing product for the enterprise, and today help people communicate better with products like Zoom Phone, Zoom Rooms, Zoom Video Webinars, Zoom Apps, and OnZoom.
We’re problem-solvers and self-starters, working at a fast pace to design solutions with our customers and users in mind. Here, you’ll work across teams to dig deep into impactful projects that are changing the way people communicate, and enjoy opportunities to advance your career in a diverse, inclusive environment.
Zoom is growing at an explosive pace by every measure - revenues, people, innovation, and customers. Led by Eric S. Yuan, the #1 ranked CEO on Glassdoor, our unique culture makes Zoom an awesome place to work. We are expanding teams across the organization. If you are motivated by delivering happiness, come join us at Zoom!
We are looking for an Account Executive- Small Medium Business with the right energy, competitive spirit, personal drive, and track record of success in s ales to join our VAST team (Value Added Sales Team) for the Middle Eastern Region. This position involves working with existing customers to provide them the right additional Zoom services and solutions that meet their video and online meeting needs. You will proactively engage with targeted companies, as well as follow up and close on various sources of inbound leads. This position involves working with small and medium business clients (employee count of 11-251).
Responsibilities:
Meet or exceed sales and product objectives
Effectively qualify leads and identify prospect needs, engaging technical resources as required
Respond to inbound leads
Create client demos/ presentations, quotes/ proposals, and Quarterly Business Reviews (QBRs)
Conduct high-level conversations with C-Level and VP -Level Executives to address business needs
Utilize solution-selling techniques to effectively guide sales process to close
Develop and maintain business within existing accounts, manage complex sales situations and sales campaigns
Upsell and leverage business from new and established customer relationships
Utilize Salesforce CRM to provide timely and accurate sales activity tracking and status updates
Work strategically with management to deliver forecasts, identify trending opportunities/challenges, and provide recommended solutions
Forecast sales activity and revenue achievement while creating satisfied customers
Resolve client issues in a timely and thorough manner; escalates issues to manager as appropriate
Keep informed of product line, competition and industry trends that may impact client business activities
This position will cover UAE + Egypt + Ethiopa (GCC except Saudi) GCC=UAE, Jordan, Lebanon, Iraq, Oman, Qatar, Bahrain, Kuwait, so fluent Arabic is essential
Experience selling into this region is essential

Trivium Packaging is a global leader in metal packaging with more than 60 locations worldwide and employs close to 8,000 people and has annual revenue of approximately $2.7 billion. Trivium serves a diverse range of customers in a variety of end markets such as food, seafood, pet food, nutrition, beauty and personal care, household care and premium beverages.

Strategy Analyst

Department: Strategy and Business Development

Location: Europe – Flexible

We are seeking a Strategy Analyst to support the development and implementation of strategy for Europe, with an emphasis on new product development opportunities and expansion of recent products into new markets. You will support the Strategy & Business Development team’s efforts by leading market research and competitive analysis efforts, identifying opportunities for growth and building the business case, and executing special projects.

Key Responsibilties

Market / Competitive Intel:
Assist in developing and executing Trivium knowledge strategy and development plan
Leverage and analyze multiple data sources for the purpose of monitoring, reporting and providing insights on any given market, competitor or key customer activities: Own building and maintaining dataset of market and competitive intel; Perform store audits and maintain dataset
Leverage market and competitive intel to support commercial needs and provide details on untapped opportunities
Support preparation of the C-suite for quarterly and ad-hoc investor relation calls, combining market research with Trivium performance

Commercial Support:
Work closely with Commercial teams and Business Development colleagues to develop plans for market penetration and value proposition for selling new products
Support buildout of both competitive intel and prospect intel to better inform go-to-market strategy
Support Trivium response to RFPs for large proposals as needed

General Strategy and Business Development Support:
Participate in building the long and short-term strategy for Europe
Provide analytical support for large business development opportunities across Europe
Support execution and implementation of special projects
Perform data gathering, validation and analysis to derive fact-based insights
Work with BU leaders to identify improvement opportunities and proactively propose new initiatives

R&D Interface:
Work closely with R&D teams to assess feasibility of new products identified from market research

Key Skills & Experience

Excellent analytical and numerical skills are essential – possesses a comfort in working with numbers and presenting data
Working experience in an analytical focused role
Demonstrated competence in the use of software tools for data extraction, manipulation, analysis and presentation
Structured, strategic thinker with the ability to be creative in problem solving
Highest standards of accuracy and precision
Highly organized and able to manage a project independently
Able to work independently and across teams, with a high level of self-sufficiency
Articulate with excellent verbal and written communication skills

What We Offer

High exposure to senior leadership; this will be a flat hierarchy and your ideas will be heard
Opportunity to work on growth projects that will define the future of Trivium
Commitment to your professional development
Competitive compensation and benefits
High-performance culture with impressive and experienced colleagues from industry and consulting

At Trivium, people are the driving force in all our successes by bringing expertise and talent to help us stand out, achieving excellence through their commitment and drive and maintaining a focus on continuous improvement in everything they do. Together, our goal is to be the number one choice for customers seeking sustainable metal packaging solutions.

Trivium respects, values and welcomes diversity in its workforce, beyond mere compliance with laws and regulations. Our policy is to provide equal employment opportunity for all applicants without taking into account factors such as ethnicity, colour, religion, gender, national origin, ancestry, age, disability, marital status or sexual orientation

The EMEA Procurement Manager for Indirect Spend will lead a team of three Buyers, reporting to the Director, Procurement – EMEA. With the goal to independently perform spend analysis and seek out projects and categories where Procurement support will drive savings as well as lead the team.

Tasks


Drives appropriate Procurement involvement with business owners covering all aspects of Indirect spend.
Involved in key decision making for Capex and indirect spend in EMEA.
Develop and implement Strategic Sourcing initiatives across categories and regions which include the management of risk
Assign suppliers and categories to the strategic buyers team
Provide leadership and support on resolving sourcing issues to meet business requirements.
Key leadership aspects include embracing and engraining Quaker Houghton culture in the organization by bringing core values to life, encouraging and modeling transparent communication and teamwork to drive change, and coaching and counseling team members
Ensure that all Indirect procurement activities are compliant to governing policies and procedures within the region and across company.
Develop, study and analyze market intelligence for key supply markets that impact on pricing and availability
Delegate; oversee quality level of and contribute to; forecasting/reporting, Supplier & Contract Management, Market/Category Intelligence.

Requirements


Strong business background, ability to understand customer needs, etc.
Regionally relevant professional procurement certification preferred (e.g.; ISM, CIPS)
Lean Six Sigma/ Continuous Improvement experience preferred
A degree in engineering is preferred (mechanical engineering, electrical engineering, chemical engineering)
Negotiation skills, organizational skills, communication skills
Entrepreneurial and results oriented
Team leader, motivator
Procurement management

Benefits


Competitive pay programs with excellent opportunities in all geographies, essential to attracting and retaining global talent.
Opportunities to see your efforts contribute toward the success of the business. Solving problems and creating value are part of our DNA.

About the Role
At Uber, providing world-class customer support is a core feature of our product experience. Delivering this caliber of support isn't easy - it takes leaders who can understand Uber's operations, adapt to our constantly changing business, and help solve problems where no solution currently exists.
The "Program Leader - EMEA Safety" is a unique opportunity to lead a strategic and impactful program management team, working across all of Uber's lines of business (Rides, Eats, etc.). Reporting into the Head of Safety, Risk, and Compliance, EMEA Community Operations ("CommOps"), you will be responsible for managing a team of 3-4 reports, working across a vast network of internal and external service providers.
The EMEA CommOps Safety Team is responsible for innovating and curating Uber's customer experience during critical, safety-related moments. As the "Program Leader - EMEA Safety", you'll be responsible for thinking through every aspect of Safety Support in the region. You will usher complex global and EMEA-level projects through the entire lifecycle, lead cross-functional collaboration, and improve our operations through data analysis, project management, and teamwork. You will play a key role in the strategy and execution of improvements to the current safety support processes and products, while supporting research and resolution of complex issues to improve the customer experience and enhance the safety of the Uber app.
This is a business operations role with strong data orientation, where robust stakeholder management is required of functional and local teams. You are expected to be a strong thought partner to global, regional, and sub-regional leadership on the best approach for operationalizing Uber's Safety support strategy.
We're looking for someone who has experience managing teams and has demonstrated the ability/willingness to "roll-up sleeves" and get involved with operations. We want a creative thinker who will drive innovative solutions, while also holding firm to "do what is right". They need to have the emotional intelligence to manage a large team in a fast paced environment, including a diverse set of stakeholders all over the world.
What the Candidate Will Need / Bonus Points
- What the Candidate Will Do -
Be the voice of EMEA's Safety needs with Global business leaders and cross-functional teams such as Operations, Product, Marketing, Legal and Policy
Leverage data to arrive at conclusions and make process/operation, policy, and product recommendations
Formulate the Safety roadmap for CommOps in EMEA
Identify metrics and targets for the Safety program in EMEA, steer business performance to achieve and go-beyond targets
Establish a culture of "safety first" and "doing the right thing" within Uber Operations, even when not popular, by setting the right tone from the top
Motivate and leverage existing and new team members to continually up-level their results, expectations, and stretch for increasingly higher levels of impact across all core operational functions
- Basic Qualifications -
8+ years of deep, hands-on management of functions that included combinations of the following: business operations, analytics, people, and project management
Strong business judgment and critical thinking skills with the ability to use data to quickly establish the highest value priorities and develop a strategy to pursue them (ability to take strategy and convert it into on the ground execution)
Ability to operationalize processes
Conflict resolution experience and resilience. Ability to be calm in the eye of the storm.
High energy and motivational leadership driven by personal influence and example with direct staff, peers, and senior leaders across all company functions
Experience working closely and communicating effectively with internal and external stakeholders in an ever-changing, rapid growth environment with tight deadlines
Strong experience managing cross-functional teams across multiple offices and territories
You're an Uber evangelist-you care about the product and the customers
Experience with Lean / Six Sigma a plus
At Uber, we ignite opportunity by setting the world in motion. We take on big problems to help drivers, riders, delivery partners, and eaters get moving in more than 10,000 cities around the world.
We welcome people from all backgrounds who seek the opportunity to help build a future where everyone and everything can move independently. If you have the curiosity, passion, and collaborative spirit, work with us, and let's move the world forward, together.

Job Title: Public Sector Sales Strategy Specialist, North
Job Description:
To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts.
Job Category
Finance and Operations
Job Details
About the Company :

Salesforce.com is the global leader in customer relationship management (CRM) software. We pioneered the shift to cloud computing, and today we're delivering the next generation of social, mobile and cloud technologies that help companies revolutionize the way they sell, service, market and innovate-and become customer companies. We are the fastest growing of the top 10 enterprise software companies, the world's Most Innovative Company according to Forbes and one of Fortune's 100 Best Companies to Work For. Our;more human, less corporate; culture is built around doing work that matters, winning as a team and celebrating success Aloha-style.

Ready to join the #SalesforceOhana?

About the Position :

The Public Sector Sales Strategy Analyst, will play a crucial role in supporting the Global Public Sector Business Unit, the fastest growing business unit at Salesforce. This role is hybrid of traditional jobs in strategic planning, sales operations, finance, and sales collaboration - requiring a mix of market analysis, sales optimization and business operational support. This role will support the EMEA Public Sector sales team, focused on the Benelux and Nordic regions, and be directly involved in driving the continued success of Salesforce by supporting our growth strategy. Sample projects range from the strategic to the tactical including evaluating

market opportunities, supporting quarterly forecast process, long range business planning, and day-to-day operations. Deliverables include detailed analytic models, custom performance analysis, building a scalable
reporting infrastructure, and packaging findings into presentation-ready content for Salesforce executives. The role requires interaction and trust with various areas of the organization and provides exposure to senior
executives. The successful candidate will have relentless curiosity, great interpersonal skills, and possess a passion for creating innovative analysis to identify opportunities.

Responsibilities :

Manage business unit related day-to-day operations
Assist in developing and delivering presentations for senior executives
Contribute to the monthly and quarterly forecast process
Support strategic initiatives including fixing weak business areas and identifying areas of opportunity
Prepare analysis and recommendations for strategic decision making
Design the sales coverage model for the Global Public Sector Business Unit
Desired Skills/Experience :

2+ years of experience in a sales strategy, consulting, finance, or product management organization.
Valuable work experience focused on quantitative analysis, Excel, and logical reasoning
Bachelor's degree.
Self-starter and high degree of motivation to go above and beyond the task at hand.
Exceptional problem-solving skills: demonstrated ability to structure complex problems, develop solutions.
Hands on experience with Salesforce CRM and Tableau analytics building reports and dashboards.
Knowledge of European Public Sector Market is a plus.
Accommodations - If you require assistance due to a disability applying for open positions please submit a request via this Accommodations Request Form.

At Salesforce we believe that the business of business is to improve the state of our world. Each of us has a responsibility to drive Equality in our communities and workplaces. Position:
Purchasing Specialist
Job Description:
About the role
As Purchasing Specialist you will actively create and expand the supplier base for EMEA market, focusing on computing and technology producers.
You will be identifying new suppliers, sourcing and filling customer requirements, negotiating transactions, ensuring that the purchased products meet technical specifications, negotiating purchase terms, and evaluating supplier performance.
What will you be doing?
No day is like any other day at Converge, but most of the time you will be busy with:
Researching and identifying prospective suppliers
Sourcing of products and negotiating prices, purchase terms and time of delivery
Proactively create supply and sales opportunities
Liaising with internal sales teams and commodity manager
Building and maintaining strong relationships with suppliers
Provide market information on target commodities

Lokalise is the fastest-growing language-tech B2B SaaS. Being a collaborative productivity platform, it helps to structure and automate the translation and localization process for any company in the world.

Job Title: Customer Marketing Manager Grey Goose/Patrón/Tails Benelux
Job Description:
In this role you will be responsible for delivering excellent Integrated Activity Plans (IAP) and for delivering perfect execution of those plans for your respective brand for both the on & off trade channels.
You will play a crucial role in working with the European Commercial Planning & Activation (CPA) Brand Manager & external agencies to develop game changing purchaser marketing programs and activities to ensure we win across the on & the off trade.
As part of this process you will be expected to input to the Region on local needs for the Below The Line (BTL) activation playbooks they will develop, to lead agency briefings both creative & production to localise the playbook developed regionally and deliver best in class local IAP activations.
You will be the go to person for the local commercial teams for all aspects relating to execution of the IAP activations for your brands and you will be responsible for keeping them informed & updated through the activity communications process.
You will be a key member of the cycle plan meeting process ensuring effective KPI setting and tracking of your brand related IAP activities and work with the CPA Manager to advise on course corrective actions if required.
You will be responsible for the local management of brand related Point Of Sale Materials (POSM) ensuring we have the right tools to deliver against the local market commercial Key Performance Indicators (KPI) and that these are utilised and stock is managed effectively.
Within this role, you will be the On-Trade Single Point of Contact (SPOC) for CPA, responsible to ensure coordination and maximisation of all brands on trade plan.
You will be responsible for the overall budget management of your brands. This involves a continuous follow up through Business Intelligence (BI), Supplier Relationship Management (SRM), budget phasing, Last Estimate (LE) updates.
You will ensure our focus internal selling platforms (Sales Map, Bar Talk, Picture of Success) are updated on a regular basis providing sales with the best tools to deliver against their KPI’s.
The nature of the role will mean the majority of your time will be spent within the local market. An attendance of min. 2 days/week in the other market (NL/BE) is required for the job. Consequently, we request you to be open to travel cross-border. Off trade & On-Trade visits/support and customers visits will be essential part of the role.
Responsibilities
For assigned brand house:Be the #1 business partner for commercial teamsResponsible for building and executing best in class local IAPConsults and advise key local stakeholders on brand/category level plans & activitiesLocalises BTL activation toolkits and produces materials and services incl POSMInput and assists European CPA Brand Manager in the development of playooksMaintains channel activity grids and local activity commsBTL agency management & briefing responsibilityMember of local cycle planning teamManagement, selection & optimization of local POSDeliver breakthrough commercial sell in propositions
Cross all Brands:Be the On Trade Single Point of Contact for CPA, leading the consolidation and maximization of all brands plans for on trade channel
Skills and Experience
Critical Experience for Success:
University degree or higher commercial education5-8 years relevant experience (brand management, customer marketing, sale, agency side)On trade experience is considered a must for this role.Proficiency in English, fluent in Dutch and/or French is a definite plus
Functional Excellence:
Experienced in working with stakeholders to develop and implement clear agendas and longer term execution plans
Experienced in balancing long and short term priorities to create efficiencies
Experienced in managing stakeholders to ensure timely delivery of best in class IAP plans. Actively builds and leads interactions between the functions to ensure plans are implemented with high standards and goals met.
Experienced in developing and actively influencing internal and external networks of influential contacts and decision makers
Digital capability: think digital first, social media, 1st party data.Ability to work under pressure and to deal with ambiguity
Comprehension of competitive market for brand and Category in the Cluster and how to use available data to develop initiatives to grow the brand
Remains abreast of legal regulations in the industry for the Country

Leadership Excellence

Living our Values and demonstrating high Learning Agility will be fundamental not only for success in this role, but also for potential growth to other roles across Bacardi in the future. We have a clearly defined Leadership Excellence framework, and you will be expected to be a role model of all 6 elements: Focus Externally to Win / Drive Execution & Results / Lead Strategically & Know your Business / Make the Matrix Work / Lead by Example / Develop and Inspire Talent

This is Adyen

We took an unobvious approach to starting a payments company, building a platform from scratch. Today, we're the payments platform of choice for the world's brightest companies. Our unobvious approach is a product of our diverse perspectives. This diversity, of backgrounds, cultures, and perspectives, is essential in helping us maintain our momentum. Our business challenges are unique, we need as many different voices as possible to join us in solving them - voices like yours. So no matter where you're from, who you love, or what you believe in, we welcome you to be your true self at Adyen


Graduate Business Analyst

We are looking for a self-starter who will scale our cash management and payout solution together with our partners. This role falls within the Merchant Finance & Treasury team that is responsible for Adyen's treasury operations.

Managing liquidity in over 25 currencies across different time zones, the goal of Merchant Finance & Treasury is to provide our merchants the fastest and most efficient solution to receive their funds. For this role we are looking for someone with strong analytical skills and who is able to design and organize a project as well as taking end-to-end responsibility for the implementation.


What you'll do

Design and implement solutions to enhance our payout functionalities and automate our cash management processes in different time zones and currencies.
Work closely together with commercial, data and IT development teams within Adyen, as well as corporate external partners.
Take responsibility for daily processes and automating those to be able to cope with the increasing volumes and complexity while ensuring our customers receive their funds as fast as possible, across the world, in their desired currency.

 Who you are

You recently graduated with a master degree;
Strong analytical skills and willing to dive into the details;
Hands-on mentality, strong interpersonal skills as you will work together with IT-development team to solve (operational) issues;
There are no set career tracks, you are able to create your own path;
You are able to structure and prioritize in a rapidly-changing environment.


Who we are

Adyen is the payments platform of choice for the world's leading companies, delivering frictionless payments across online, mobile and in-store channels. It is the only provider of a modern end-to-end infrastructure, connecting directly to Visa, Mastercard, and consumers' globally preferred payment methods. With offices around the world, Adyen serves nine of the 10 largest U.S. internet companies and many worldwide retailers. Customers include Facebook, Uber, L'Oreal, Casper, Bonobos, and Spotify.

Job Title: Global VP of People Experience Tech / Deputy CHRO
Job Description:
DocPlanner is a world-leading online marketplace for doctors amp; patients and a medical practice booking amp; management SaaS in over 15 countries. Each month, we serve 2 million active doctors, 40 million patients from seven offices around the world with almost 1500 team members.
People are not your most important asset. The right people are. - Jim Collins
In Docplanner Tech we believe in passion and autonomy. We love what we do and have a huge impact on how to do it. Our turnover in the Tech team is under 10% and the eNPS over 65 so be ready to get inspired in the long run! Take a look at what it’s like in here.

ensure alignment and commitment to the product and company goals (OKRs)

hire top Tech talents world-wide

design and implement global HR frameworks and best practices together with the CHRO that put the HR strategy into action
Requirements
WHAT WE REQUIRE
a track record of performance in talent acquisition and culture building as an HR Head in a Tech company
experience in and love :) to complex project management
ease and effectiveness in working with C-level managers
an analytical mind matched by the passion for people
a strong business acumen
a track record of leading remote teams
and endless drive to build a great company through and with people
Benefits
WHAT YOU WILL FIND:
Impact. You’ll build and implement the HR strategy side by side the CHRO.
Equity - That's right. To feel like an owner it's best to be one.
Great people - We get things done. We know our stuff. And have fun in the process =)
Leave your comfort zone - There were a handful of us when we started. Now there are over 1300 of us on 4 continents. We learn and grow so the company can.
Focus on results, not tasks - No one can tell you what to do because.. no one has ever done it yet. Every day is a new challenge. No matter if it’s an evolution or revolution, you have all the power to start it.
Give feedback now, directly - We know very few mind readers. None actually. We don’t read the minds of our users. We A/B test. We don’t read the minds of each other. We ask for and give feedback.
Keep it simple - Right.
Do what you love - Alright, we work for the money. But once that is out of the way, why do you do what you do? We believ

Amsterdam


Is ‘attract, engage and close’ your mantra?


This is CarNext.com
CarNext.com is a scale-up with a start-up mentality. We’re bold and have a passion to change the status quo. We’re building a transparent digital marketplace that customers can trust. And it’s the same at CarNext.com. We’re proud of our open culture, collaborative ethos, vibrant environment and can-do approach. As we grow our business, we’re keen to hear from people who understand what we’re about and can help us achieve our mission.


Are you our new Senior Recruiter?

CarNext.com is growing – and growing fast. As a recruiter you know what that means: the hunt for talent is on! That’s why we are looking for someone who knows how to attract, engage and close.

 As a Senior Recruiter at CarNext.com you get the chance to develop and implement a recruiting strategy to reach our ambitious staffing goals. But you will do a lot of recruiting, too, from sourcing to onboarding. All of that takes place in a real digital scale-up company so you need to feel at home in that kind of environment.

You are a true brand ambassador, representing the company and its job opportunities in the external market place. You build company presence and pipelines, all the while guarding our values, policies, and HR principles.

There a lot of things going on at CarNext.com. Therefore it is key that you can prioritize and manage multiple requests at the same time. Needless to say, strong communication skills are indispensable. With your enthusiasm you win candidates’ hearts and build relationships with hiring managers.


Your responsibilities
Manage jobs in applicant tracking system, pre-screen resumes, and conduct phone screens
Support hiring managers and HR Business Partners in screening candidates, scheduling interviews, and extending and negotiating offers
Communicate with candidates at every step of the recruiting process
Actively build and nurture a talent pool for key roles
Make and analyze management reports to improve efficiency and ROI
Be a brand ambassador, e.g. by guarding our values, and attending recruitment and career events
Create and implement a recruiting strategy for each position
Participate in the development and implementation of recruitment and talent acquisition related projects, e.g. onboarding, employer branding, assessments, tooling, training etc.

 Education

Bachelor’s degree, preferably in recruiting, HR, or a related field

5+ years’ work experience in sourcing and recruiting talent in a high-volume and fast-paced environment

Self-starter: naturally take initiative and ownership
Excellent communication skills
Team player with flexible mindset

About Us

With electric vehicles (EVs) expected to be nearly 30% of new vehicle sales by 2025 and more than 50% by 2040, electric mobility is becoming a reality. ChargePoint is at the center of this revolution, powering one of the world’s leading EV charging networks and a comprehensive set of hardware, software and mobile solutions for nearly every charging need. We bring together drivers, businesses, automakers, policymakers, utilities and other stakeholders to make e-mobility a global reality.

Since our founding in 2007, ChargePoint has focused solely on EV charging and established a business model that's been validated by more than a decade in business and thousands of customers. As we near a public listing milestone that will broaden our market leadership and build on years of innovation, ChargePoint offers a once-in-a-lifetime chance to build our all-electric future and dominate a trillion-dollar market.

Join the team that is building the EV charging industry and make your mark on how people and goods will get everywhere they need to go, in any context, for generations to come.

Discover what it’s like to help build the fueling network of the future - check out our Engineering Blog.

Reports To

Director, Strategic Factory Operations


What You Will Be Doing

The Strategic Factory Operations Manager is the cross-functional leader of factory change initiatives. By partnering with materials management, technical operations, new product operations, and strategic suppliers, the SFO manager makes sure projects are properly planned across disciplines and executed on time and on-budget. The in-region operations manager represents ChargePoint in daily interactions with factory leaders and makes sure ChargePoint’s headquarters team is connected to local operations activities.

What You Will Bring to ChargePoint
Expert ability to organize multi-dimensional problems and identify/track critical actions and checkpoints
Strong understanding of factory operations, including line qualifications, shopfloor systems, materials handling, staffing, quality management, production planning, and logistics
Knowledge of success and risk factors impacting quality, cost, and schedule
Incredible attention to detail without losing the big picture
Excellent follow-through
Appreciation for how factory operations fit into larger supply chains, including order fulfillment models, return merchandise authorization (RMA), and refurbishment processes
Curiosity and drive towards smarter ways of working, using data
Natural ability to build relationships and marshal disparate groups of people
World-class communication across cultures, functional groups, seniority levels, and time zones


Requirements
College degree in Industrial Engineering, Mechanical Engineering or Electronics Engineering.
Minimum 5 years project management or supply chain management leadership experience in complex and fast-moving manufacturing environment; At least 3 years experience related to contract manufacturing.
Able to travel within Europe on short notice.
Able to travel periodically to US.
Fluency in English required; In German preferred.
PMP certification preferred.
Experience with high power systems and/or regulatory compliance preferred

Amsterdam, Netherlands

Finance Business Operations Associate
As a Finance Business Operations Associate at IDEXX you will be at the heart of our Financial and order processing operations. You will be a part the European Finance Business Operations Team, responsible for all accurate, timely and compliant order entry, checks and processing for some 21 countries? Are you Tech savvy and can you work under pressure? Can you prioritize your workload and manage expectations? Do you want to work in a key position for the Global Market leader in Veterinary Diagnostics?
Then we really want to connect with you!
In this role
The Finance Business Operations Team at IDEXX is responsible for processing and managing all orders and service contracts within EMEA. This involves topics such as billing adjustments, product returns, rebates, discounts and special pricing on which you will have contact with several internal stakeholders. You will be working directly with IDEXX Sales professionals, the Marketing Department and Finance to ensure smooth and compliant order flows.
Customer orders that come in through SAP or one of many mailboxes for capital products, standing orders, and service contracts are your responsibility. Our products are in such high demand, and the volume of orders coming in so big, that we require the successful candidate to excel in speed and accuracy. You are tech savvy, have an eye for detail, you can prioritize your workload and work well with a range of different stakeholders.
The team plays a key role, and is the gatekeeper, to ensure SOX compliance for revenue recognition. This requires knowing all the revenue recognition rules and knowing the control cycles impacted by the team.
What you need to succeed
To be successful in this role you must have experience in data entry. What makes you a high achiever is a continuous balance between speed and accuracy. You get on well with different systems and can handle a high workload. Working in a big team doesn't present any problems for you.
You have a high School diploma or equivalent.
You have 2 to 3 years of relevant working experience (preferably in a Shared Service environment, E-Invoicing or Data Entry).
Experience with SAP and Order Management is a big plus.
You have experience with international companies.
You have an excellent command of the English language (written and verbal).
You enjoy working in a multi-national and multi-cultural environment
You are Strong user of MS Office and especially Excel.
You have the ability to work alone and, in a team, you are self-motivated, solutions driven, within a changing, fast-paced environment.
You have emotional intelligence, humility, willingness to learn and take and receive feedback constructively.
High ethical standards.
Why IDEXX
We’re proud of the work we do, because our work matters. An innovation leader in every industry we serve, we follow our Purpose and Guiding Principles to help pet owners worldwide keep their companion animals health and happy, to ensure safe drinking water for billions, and to help farmers protect livestock and poultry from disease. We have customers in over 175 countries and a global workforce of over 9,000 talented people.
So, what does that mean for you? We enrich livelihoods of our employees with a positive and respectful work culture that embraces challenges and encourages learning and discovery. At IDEXX, you will be supported by competitive compensation, incentives and benefits while enjoying purposeful work that drives improvement.
Let’s pursue what matters together!
Due to the current pandemic, as it relates to COVID-19, our employees' safety and well-being are top of mind for us. Currently, our team is working from home full-time and will continue to do so at least through to 2021. This means that we are providing our onboarding, training, and support for our new hires (like yourself) virtually.

Department
Customer and Content marketing, part of CMI\SMC
About the role
Customer and Content Marketing Managers tell stories about Orange Business services to Sales, so they can tell those stories to their customers, and to customer, to increase their knowledge about us and about the ways in which we can help them do business. We tell these stories from the customer’s point of view, and in a transversal way, linking services, teams within our organization and concepts together to make sure we meet our customers’ needs.
We support our global Sales organization by thinking about ways to position Orange Business Services’ messages about products and services in the market, and training them on this. We adapt the way we talk about our solutions to our various customer profiles and verticals, starting with their business drivers. In return, this will enable us to better showcase the services associated with our products.
Customer and Content Marketing Manager will be to work with Orange Business Services’ BU’s and experts to create customers value propositions to support the sales community in addressing specific customer segments. You present these value propositions to sales in online trainings, and to customers, through blogs, social networks and customer events. Based upon the value proposition, you will create global marketing campaigns, which will be executed to generate leads, brand awareness and customer loyalty across the globe.
The job is divided into 2 major activities
1. Customer Value Propositions
Work with the international sales channel, international marketing organizations and analyst relations teams to identify priorities in terms of market and technological developments
Conduct marketing research to identify market trends, business drivers, priorities and challenges
Work with marketing and product development experts in the various Business Units to identify the key differentiators and transversal solutions sales should position to answer our customers’ main business drivers
Build Customer Value Propositions to position a set of transversal Orange Business Services products and services towards our customers; tell the story from the viewpoint of our customers’ business drivers and challenges.
Build supporting Sales Enablement documents (Market Overview reports, Sales Scripts and Customer References books)
Provide training to sales on the CVP through webinars, building appropriate learning materials and involving expert speakers, taking into account all time zones.
Support local marketing teams with adapting Customer Value propositions to specific market sub-segment or accounts
2. Global marketing Campaigns
Based upon the Customer Value Proposition for any given subject, build a coherent campaign plan detailing audience, geography, target, content plan, communication strategy, main messages, timing and budget.
Create and lead a matrix project team consisting of team members from digital marketing, marketing automation, market intelligence and solution experts. Ensure progress, regular communication and timeline management.
Ensure alignment with, and get buy-in from, regional marketing and sales organizations
Work with external agencies and internal experts to create campaign content: white papers, brochures, videos, blogs, articles, eBooks, infographics, interactive online tools, webpages, social media posts, Inmails and nurturing emails.
Monitor and communicate any leads coming from the campaign
Adjust the campaign content over time, as markets and services evolve
Report on campaign results and ROI towards executive management.
about you
Excellent interpersonal and networking skills. Ability to work with people from different cultures, different teams and different job levels. Ability to create teams, communicate goals and empower and motivate team members.
A solid overview of Orange Business Services’ portfolio, experience from network provider, CSP, or others much appreciated
The ability to find and organize information from various sources
Public speaking skills and the ability to express yourself well
Web-writing skills to create communication materials, whatever the format (web - video - classic formats)
You got to love PowerPoint. It’s going to be one of your main tools, and pretty graphics have to make you smile.
Creative skills to think of new ways to get stories across
Languages: Fluent English is required (work language) and French fluent to collaborate with HQ in Paris

additional information
We will only accept applications from employees with an EU nationality and right to work in The Netherlands.

Become a trusted advisor to the world’s leading insurance companies as a management consultant. Bring your vision to life and help clients adapt to the changing world of business by supporting strategic decision making and developing innovative solutions through insight. Start a career with Accenture Strategy & Consulting and transform your ideas into reality.

Your Job
As an Insurance Consultant, you will be responsible for designing and shaping direction that help our clients move forward in every part of their business, from strategic planning to day-to-day operations. You will play a key role developing our business in the Insurance industry by becoming a trusted partner to support our clients from strategy to execution, identifying business development opportunities and continuously strengthening both your analytical and executive capabilities.

Your team
Our consultants in Strategy & Consulting are changing businesses every day using deep industry insights, knowledge and innovative ideas. Positioned at the crucial intersection of business, technology and industry, we devise creative new strategies based on trends, insights and data. With an eye for competitive advantage, digital disruption, operating models and the future workforce, we take on the challenge of designing and implementing transformative business solutions, using the newest technology.
Our research-based advice and situational analyses enable our clients to act with speed and confidence. Whether we're investigating complex issues or identifying new opportunities, our work always comes down to one thing: unlocking value and creating real, tangible impacts.

Transmit Security is the leader in identity and risk innovation. We power enterprises with airtight security and a seamless user experience. Our agile, unique technology is proven to reduce all forms of identity attrition and enterprises are able to save substantial costs. Transmit Security was founded by serial entrepreneurs, Mickey Boodaei and Rakesh Loonkar in 2014 with the aim of changing the security identity landscape.

As a Customer Success Manager (CSM) in Transmit Security, you will work closely with our customers, build strategic relationships with them, and help them achieve their business goals as a trusted advisor. You will orchestrate and be the single point of contact for all services and support related matters. Your main goal is to gain and maintain the satisfaction of our customers through deep understanding of the customers' issues and environment. The CSM will lead guided success services which realize a solid and sustained partnership to improve customers' experience. The CSM will host strategic review meetings periodically to align and update the success plan with customers.

Understand our customers' business needs, use cases and priorities.

Build knowledge of customer's environment, become the customer's champion at Transmit Security
Review customer's evolving needs with the Product Management team.
Present product roadmap and confirm alignment with the customer's agenda.
Ensure smooth on-boarding and help maximizing product value.
Act as a "trusted" adviser to the customer to strengthen customer relationships.
Lead The Customer Success Analyst in his technical tasks
Engage with Professional Services Consultants on specific project-based activities
Keep track of customer health score, communicate and escalate risks
Work with Sales and Field Engineers to develop new opportunities.
Be accountable for the solution provided to the customer to ensure great service, customer satisfaction and success.


Qualifications

5 years minimum experience in sales engineering, customer success management, technical account management or program management with SaaS, software or Cyber Security vendors
Bachelor's degree or equivalent work experience.
Proven track-record of establishing executive level relationships
Excellent time management, multi-tasking, prioritization skills and ability to manage multiple concurrent projects/customers.
Detailed knowledge of and passion for SaaS and Security applications.
Consistently demonstrate strong organizational, project/program management, change management, and problem-solving skills.
Excellent interpersonal, verbal and written communication skills.
Ability to communicate effectively with both internal staff and external clients.
Ability to work independently as well as part of a team.

Tiqets is one of the fastest-growing tech scale-ups in the Netherlands. To keep it moving fast and making culture more accessible, we’re hiring a Business Controller to join us!

Full-time · Amsterdam
Who are we?

We’re revolutionising the way people buy tickets to culture and attractions in cities all over the world. Our technology allows users to easily browse and book tickets to the best attractions in seconds, meaning customers can enter museums, zoos, theme parks and more simply by showing their smartphones. About time, right?

We’re dedicated to bringing simplicity to the world of travel and entertainment. If you want to join our team, working as an International Business Controller, send us your resume. We might be looking for YOU!

Our values

Be accessible: Help out, communicate honestly, and be there for each other.
Be remarkable: Have fun, think creatively, and celebrate great moments together.
Skip the line: Be fast, flexible, and smart; take responsibility and push forward.
Life at Tiqets
What you will do

As Business Analyst, you will be part of the Tiqets Finance team and report to the FP&A Manager. Together with the FP&A Manager, you are responsible for business reporting and creating all sorts of business analysis. You are data driven and like to support the business in taking the right decisions on strategic and operational level with amazing business analysis.
You are a team player, result driven, ambitious and like getting things done as quickly as possible, in a smart and accurate way.
Responsibilities

Support and drive with the FP&A Manager the planning and control cyclus

Involved in the business part of the monthly closing and reporting

 Analytical review and reporting of the financials versus budget/forecasts

Initiate improvements of the monthly & quarterly review and reporting process

Support with the construction of a complete outlook for P&L, Balance Sheet and Cash Flow (forecast and scenario planning)

 Prepare financial and non-financial data for business performance reviews

Provide departments with relevant analysis on performance and costs (IT, Marketing, CS and Brand)

Analyze growth and margins for the various venues, cities and countries

Create and improve daily/weekly reports and dashboards

Perform ad-hoc data analyses and develop reports in Looker (BI tool)

Qualifications

Bachelor or Master's degree in Finance/Accounting/Economics

 2 to 5 years of work experience

Experience in an international fast growing environment is a plus

You have the potential to be become a trustful business partner for internal stakeholders and MT

Careful attention to details and a desire to continually learn and share

Startup mindset

Professional, credible, committed

No 9 to 5 mentality

Excel and PowerPoint skills are a must. SQL is an asset

Fluent in Dutch and English

Living in the Netherlands

 Perks and benefits at Tiqets
Young, energetic, international work environment
Bright, welcoming office located in the centre of Amsterdam

About the Company
PVH is one of the most admired fashion and lifestyle companies in the world. We power brands that drive fashion forward – for good. Our brand portfolio includes the iconic CALVIN KLEIN, TOMMY HILFIGER, Van Heusen, IZOD, ARROW, Warner’s, Olga and Geoffrey Beene brands, as well as the digital-centric True&Co. intimates’ brand. We market a variety of goods under these and other nationally and internationally known owned and licensed brands. PVH has over 40,000 associates operating in over 40 countries and $9.9 billion in annual revenues. That's the Power of Us. That’s the Power of PVH.
The Department and Team
Here at PVH we are transforming the fashion industry by breaking conventions, exploring ways to push boundaries to deliver fashion for good and constantly accelerating the pace in which we do business. The sustainable business and innovation team are pivotal in developing PVH into a more sustainable, equitable and future focused organization that continuously rethinks value. Innovation; product, business and digital, have become a key driver to achieving our success across our brands and business. In order to retain relevance with the consumer and grow the business in a world with constrained resources we must create new products, develop digital approaches and re-engineer our business models. We partner with vendors, innovators, start-ups and accelerators as well as with business divisions and departments on the development and creation of new materials and products, digitalization of the value chain, new (digital) consumer offerings and breakthrough business models that reinvent our business.
The Position
As a member of the sustainable business & innovation leadership team, this role is responsible for defining and leading the Innovation strategy, and the tactical oversight on project creation, scoping, project management, execution, and delivery of the innovation funnel, from concept-to-consumer for all PVH brands and departments. Looking to the horizon this role drives innovation through our organization and is key to adapting our approaches and accelerating our business growth in a VUCA, ever-changing world.
Key Responsibilities:
Set and safeguard the innovation North star, objectives and priorities, at all times linking them to the broader company and brand strategies
Strategy and end-to-end ownership for innovation roadmap and new bets for global brand and the PVH Europe organization
Develop the 4 different streams under Innovation to seamlessly deliver on the global brand and business vision, with an emphasis on further development of the digital, business and culture streams, bringing in more holistic concept thinking into the product team and structuring long-term innovation capacity
Ensure the right approaches and capacity for all phases of the innovation funnel and steer the team for results and focus from concept creation to launch, in partnership with the relevant stakeholders
Realize commercialization in close alignment with the commercial business teams to ensure adoption and scale up of projects
Own the discipline behind the go to market process driving to execute seasonally as relevant
Structure a value-based approach through a combination of financial viability, consumer orientedness and data driven methodologies
You will partner with core teams across Design, Sustainability, Circular Business, Digital Ventures, E-commerce and Retail to understand current business models and to introduce mid and long-term innovation plans to accelerate and transform our organization
Increase the innovation adoption capacity of the broader organization through the right structures, support and capacity building
The Ideal Candidate:
At least 15 years of working experience in an international business environment
Strong knowledge and experience in innovation, in fashion or another FMCG environment
State of the art understanding of innovation funnel management (including long term innovation), design thinking and consumer centered innovation
Strong understanding of digital product development
Excellent business acumen and strategic capacity
Visionary leader with a participative style
Creative and entrepreneurial mind
Sound understanding of consumer and brand environment and ability to constantly find the connection with consumer, brand and business strategy
Very strong communication skills
A truly collaborative mindset with excellent stakeholder and relationship management skills
What You Can Expect from Us:
Working in a fast-paced international business environment in the fashion industry that encourages an entrepreneurial mindset, employees that are driven, solution oriented and value a collaborative culture
Direct exposure to Tommy Hilfiger Global and PVH Europe executive management teams
Managing a highly skilled team of 14 people, with opportunity to grow
A beautiful state-of-the-art Campus, complete with our very own People's Place Gym and People's Place Cafés
A company culture that fosters development, offering training and learning opportunities through our very own PVH University
An international environment which respects diversity, equality, and individuality
A smart work program that empowers our associates to work at their preferred location within a flexible schedule
NOTE: This job description is not intended to be all-inclusive. Employee may perform other related duties as negotiated to meet the ongoing needs of the organization.
PVH Europe and our brands, TOMMY HILFIGER and CALVIN KLEIN, are committed to fostering an inclusive and diverse community of associates with a strong sense of belonging. We believe we are bettered by all forms of diversity, and take pride in working with top talent from every walk of life and corner of the world. In the spirit of inclusivity, qualified applicants will be considered without regard to age, ethnicity, ability, gender, gender expression, gender identity, nationality, race, religion or sexual orientation.

Job Title: Market Insights & Analytics Business Partner Benelux
Job Description:
Job Title
Market Insights & Analytics Business Partner Benelux
Job Description
In this role, you have the opportunity
Shape marketing strategy by using advanced analytics and tools to deepen Philips’ understanding of our consumers and customers. You will deliver game changing insights that enable faster, smarter business decisions that ultimately drive growth across EU7 markets.

You are responsible for
Driving local (predictive) performance insights including Forecasting:
Analyze performance dashboards comprising multiple data sources and advanced (data science) analytics, to create & deploy local insights, including predictive insights
Drive action resulting from insights, including: mkt share/sales-in/sales-out target setting and forecasting, promotional effectiveness, media optimization, marketing content optimization, digital & web insights, care/NPS insights, and pricing
Lead local commercial daily management meetings , using analytic dashboards to identify business gaps and opportunities and recommend appropriate countermeasures
Key MI&A point of contact for local stakeholders, fielding key business questions, ensuring data driven decision making, and feeding back data and analytics opportunities to dashboard production, CoE and analytics teams.
Managing local data streams & suppliers:
Where required by global MI&A planning, identify and source internal and external local data, including: Sales-in, Sales-out, Market share, IGM, Pricing, Unique local customer data (eg: local retailer data), promotional effectiveness, shopper data.
Manage suppliers of local data ensuring quality control, and compliance to local regulations eg: GDPR, Antitrust
Manage local budgeting and resource requirements for supply of local data
Acting as a consultative business partner (local sounding board for global initiatives):
Consult with Strategy and Portfolio Marketing, regional Business Partner on creation and localization of source of business and local market strategy, including ownership local strategic insights and mapping local sources of business.
Validating local, strategy and source of business modeling.
Consult on scoring ability to win and attractiveness of IVPs within the local Market.
Ensure centrally deployed tools are locally relevant and deployed across local teams.
Local shopper, competitor and retailer insights:
Facilitates the Trade Shopper Marketing and Category Management team on: Shopper insights, shopper CDJ, shopper segmentation, category growth drivers.
Identify local competitor movements, needs and issues.
Subject matter expert in local war gaming and in developing local competitor approaches.
You are a part of
The local management team and drive insights into action within the PH domain. In this position he/she will interpret analysis provided by the regional team and global central team into practical winning actions for the Market. The role will require a strong overview of the commercial triangle, research and analytics approaches and their application.
To succeed in this role, you should have the following skills and experience
University degree (Bachelor Degree)
> 5 years of related experience
Familiarity with market and customer research techniques and strong working knowledge of basic analytical tools and sharp predictive skills to work on large amounts of data
Familiarity with marketing strategy forces and the structure in the health technology and health provider market across the Health Continuum.
Familiarity with benchmarking market sizes and market opportunity estimates with various external sources.
Act as a role-model for our Philips behaviors: Customer first, Quality & Integrity always, Team up to Win, Take Ownership to deliver fast, Eager to improve and inspire.
Cross-Functional Connector. Build bridges across the organization to deeply understand the business, and amplify the learnings to infuse the voice of the customer into a culture that thrives on consumer understanding
In return, we offer you
To grow your career in a company with a unique purpose to make the world healthier and more sustainable through innovation. You can join an innovative health-tech company that values the interaction between technology and people, working in a multinational and multicultural environment. You will be surrounded by diverse colleagues who share your passion to create superior consumer experiences. Your work will be challenging and full of opportunities for growth. Variety and challenge will be part of your daily routine.
Why should you join Philips?
Working at Philips is more than a job. It’s a calling to create a healthier society through meaningful work, focused on improving 3 billion lives a year by delivering innovative solutions across the health continuum. Our people experience a variety of unexpected moments when their lives and careers come together in meaningful ways. Learn more by watching this video.
To find out more about what it’s like working for Philips at a personal level, visit the Working at Philips page on our career website, where you can read stories from our employee blog. Once there, you can also learn about our recruitment process, or find answers to some of the frequently asked questions.
Contact

If you have any other questions regarding the recruitment process please refer to our FAQs. In case of technical difficulties with the website, please send an email to careersite@philips.com.

About Calvin Klein
Calvin Klein is a global lifestyle brand built on iconic essentials and powered by bold, progressive ideals. The Calvin Klein brands — CK Calvin Klein, Calvin Klein, Calvin Klein Jeans, Calvin Klein Underwear and Calvin Klein Performance — provide us with the opportunity to market products both domestically and internationally at various price points, through multiple distribution channels and to different consumer groups. The Calvin Klein brands are also licensed for a range of products, including fragrance, women's apparel, footwear, eyewear, watches and jewelry in various regions. Global retail sales of products sold under the Calvin Klein brands were approximately $9.4 billion in 2019.

The tiered-brand strategy was established for Calvin Klein to provide a focused, consistent approach to global brand growth and development that preserves the brand's prestige and image. Each of the Calvin Klein brands occupies a distinct marketing identity and position. We believe that Calvin Klein is well positioned over the next few years to establish itself as the world’s favorite brand. With the North Star of "Defying the boundaries of self-expression" guiding its design, marketing and consumer engagement initiatives, we believe that Calvin Klein will convert its investments into ongoing commercial success

The Team

The Raw Material team owns the construction of Calvin Klein’s Demand Plan for fabrications selected for all Calvin Klein Apparel division.
Their key focuses are to foster a Demand Plan for Core Materials to ensure a steady flow of goods throughout the production process. They execute this via raw material commitments placed with external partners ensuring materials are continually replenished and available as needed.
These commitments are the starting point of the seasonal selection and the core foundation of Quick Response and NOS (Never Out Of Stock) aspects of the business. The team also manages global inventory of these staged raw materials and study the demand flucation to determine and mitigate liability risks.
Within Calvin Klein, they work closely with the following departments: Brand
Merchandising, Product Development, Quality Assurance and Corporate Responsibility. In addition, there is strong communication with the Manufacturing regions with both internally and externally partners.
The Position
Reporting into the Raw Material Director, you will add value by gathering and analyzing data and numbers using Excel. This will enable the team to forecast performance and make decisions.
Key Responsibilities:
Collaborate with Product Development & Merchandising to forecast the fabric need and validate supplier allocation.
Overseeing lead-times, delivery dates/delays and production escalation management in close collaboration with larger Buying and Planning team , and global Production team.
Responsible for maintaining accurate records of inventory levels for all fabrication based on commitments.
Communicator of Fabric Inventory levels to internal cross-functional teams and PVH Hubs to ensure accurate transparency.
Collaborate with suppliers, Design, Merchandising and PVH Hubs with the objective to minimize liabilities (e.g. leftover fabric).
Create and distribute analyses / reporting to relevant stakeholders (e.g. analysis on fabric performance / supplier performance, Fabric performance , Volume Drivers, Liability records).
Maintain close relationships with suppliers and assist with operational tasks where needed, monitoring performed tasks to ensure they are performed correctly (e.g. testing).
Engage in cross-functional projects and support the team with additional operational activities.

The Ideal Candidate:
You bring around 1 year of corporate experience, ideally in an international environment, but we are also open to ambitious entry level candidates with strong Excel; analytical and reporting skills gained through internships or relevant education such as bachelor degrees in Business Administration/ Management.
Excellent PowerPoint and Excel skills (Pivot Tables, VLOOKUP) and the ability to work with large datasets.
Knowledge of PLM (Product Lifecycle Management) would be a plus.
Strong numerical, planning and organization skills.
Great ability to build relationships with other internal and external teams.
Work to a high level of accuracy towards multiple deadlines.
Self-motivated and commercially aware with an ability to adapt to change in a dynamic environment.
Proactive and solution-oriented.
Excellent communication/ follow up skills with the ability to drive conversations with Vendors.
What You Can Expect from Us:
A beautiful state-of-the-art Campus, complete with our very own People's Place Gym and People's Place Cafés
A company culture that fosters development, offering training and learning opportunities through our very own PVH University
An international environment which respects diversity, equality, and individuality
A smart work program that empowers our associates to work at their preferred location within a flexible schedule
A chance to unwind with weekly social activities
Please include a cover letter with your application. We would love to know why this is THE role for you!

PVH Europe and our brands, TOMMY HILFIGER and CALVIN KLEIN, are committed to fostering an inclusive and diverse community of associates with a strong sense of belonging. We believe we are bettered by all forms of diversity, and take pride in working with top talent from every walk of life and corner of the world. In the spirit of inclusivity, qualified applicants will be considered without regard to age, ethnicity, ability, gender, gender expression, gender identity, nationality, race, religion or sexual orientation.

Kraft Heinz, The Company
As one of the world’s largest food and beverage companies, we are proud to spark joy around mealtimes with a global portfolio of more than 200 brands. Some are iconic brands like Philadelphia Cream Cheese, Kraft Peanut Butter, Kraft Dinner and Heinz Ketchup. Others are fast growing new sensations that defy status quo like CRAVE. No matter the brand, we are united under one vision To Be the Best Food Company, Growing a Better World . Bringing this vision to life are our 36,000+ teammates around the world, making food people love.
Together, we help provide meals to those in need through our global partnership and commitment with Rise Against Hunger. And we also stand committed to sustainability, and the health of our planet and its people.
Every day, we are transforming the food industry with bold thinking and unprecedented results. If you’re passionate like us - and ready to create the future, build on a storied legacy, and participate as a conscientious global citizen - there’s one thing to do join us.


Our Culture of Ownership, Meritocracy and Collaboration


We’re not afraid to think differently. Embrace new ideas. Dream big. It all comes down to the way we empower our people to own their work. It’s true Our employees are our competitive advantage.
As part of the Kraft Heinz family you’re supported to grow and achieve. You’re recognized and rewarded for outstanding performance at every level. You’re given the opportunity to leave your mark and build legacies. But you won’t do it alone. This is where our values and teamwork thrives and collaborative spirit fuels every day.
Job Description
About the Position
Here in KraftHeinz we have a unique opportunity available for an experienced Customer Excellence Project Manager to make a real difference in our Company. The position lies within the Logistics Center of Excellence Team, reporting to Josadarck Coutinho, Head of Customer Service Excellence for International.
In this exciting position, you will have a key role in developing the Strategy of CS for the whole of International, but as well as leading the implementation of those plans, from the Fundamentals to the Mature levels, helping our Customer Service strengthen the Partnership with our Customers and becoming a reference in the Market amongst our Competitors.
With a high exposition to Leadership, be ready to engage with all zones, from Australia & China in the morning, UK & Russia in the early afternoon, to Brazil and Mexico at the end of the day, having not only the possibility to immerse in different cultures and business landscapes, but as well a rare opportunity to be a crucial part of a Business Changing journey for all those Teams.

In brief, you will be responsible for;
Develop and Implement Strategy for the new Customer Collaboration Teams
Lead the Cost-to-Serve agenda with BU’s, reducing cost inefficiencies
Lead the Service Improvement initiatives with BU’s, reducing Sales Losses
Drive Customer Engagement plans, aiming the top 25% of our Customer’s choices
Lead overall Customer Service Excellence work stream
Qualifications

Hard Skills

Please kindly note that you need to have an EU Working Permit (Orientation Year Visa not included) in order to proceed for this position.
Bachelor’s and/Master’s degree in Business-Supply Chain or Engineering
Prior Supply chain experience is preferred
Advanced Excel knowledge
SAP knowledge is preferred
Fluent in English is essential

Professional Attributes
Structured Mindset
This Journey regards the whole of International, with a high complexity to bring Countries from where they are to the common goal. For that, the ability to organize and structure thoughts, ideas, and projects becomes a crucial need in the way of simplification.
Communication Skills
In this position, you’ll be dealing daily with a wide range of stakeholders, both on the BU’s and Senior Leadership. Having clear, effective, and engaging communication will make a big difference in whether the projects will or not be delivered in this role
Presentation Skills
When guiding such a wide Community through an unknown road, deliver the message goes often beyond speaking. In those cases, Presentations can be a Powerful tool, improving Clarity and Engagement, two basic ingredients in any successful Strategy Implementation
Project management Skills

We’re a very data-driven company. You know how to translate complex data into a simple solution with your analytical mindset.
What we offer you
An ambitious employer; we only want to the best for you;
A fast career track like only few other companies can match;
A competitive salary and excellent bonus structure (above market);
Permanent contract; for we believe in doing big bets on people;
Always room for new ideas; if you have an excellent idea, please let us know and we can set it in action!
