Company Overview

Filling Pieces is an Amsterdam-based luxury fashion and footwear brand, established in 2009 by designer Guillaume Philibert. Originally Filling Pieces started a brand that was bridging the gap between streetwear and high-end fashion.

Today, Bridging the Gap means so much more to us. Filling Pieces is built on the foundation of diversity. Bridging the gap between different worlds. Our company has evolved into a multidisciplinary fashion brand that transcends boundaries and cultures whilst inspiring meaningful change. We believe in a society united by diversity.

Job Profile

At the marketing department we are looking for a Marketing Operations Manager. An analytic and seasoned Team ánd Project Manager, who is in control of both the marketing department and all running projects within Filling Pieces. This role includes involvement in all marketing strategies, activities and partnerships to elevate the brand in order to consistently drive global brand awareness across all target markets and various relevant channels.
Your main responsibility is to safeguard the operational side of the department: You will lead the marketing team. You are responsible for the marketing budget spend, before, during and after costs and purchases. You keep track of the seasonal calendar and plan ahead to make sure that every aspect of marketing is aligned, shoots happen on time, and the entire team knows what has to be done and when, what has priority, etc. Last but not least, you make sure that every member of the marketing department can function well and happy within the team.
Besides leading the team, you will be the driving force behind most of our running projects. Ranging from seasonal campaigns to collaborations and events. From our own retail marketing to working with partners to create great experiences online and in their stores. In other words you do not blink when you are running multiple projects simultaneously.
What makes you great at Operational Management is your ability to always keep in mind the three constraints: budget, time and quality. You take the lead in improving the brand’s position and resonance with the modern consumer and community, together with our Commerce/Sales team.

Additionally, you are responsible for coordinating all marketing assets and brand materials for Filling Pieces, working closely with the Creative Producer, Online Marketing Manager and (lead) creatives..
Preferably you have experience with Media, PR and Retail. Most of all, you enjoy juggling projects within fashion, working with an international team made out of; Producing, Seeding, Product Photography, Digital Marketing, eCommerce, Retail marketing and Creatives. Delivering visually stunning and creative campaigns, hype product launches and continuously elevation the Filling Pieces brand.
Responsibilities

Leading the marketing team with full management responsibilities, including resource planning, optimising workflows and budgets.
Develop and execute the global marketing strategy. Develop strategy together with the Creative Director and Commercial Director. Execute within and altogether the marketing- (and sales) team.
Develop and manage global marketing campaigns and key product launches, from conception to global channel execution based on market and consumer insights and data aligned with the marketing strategy, together with the Creative Director and Online Marketing Manager.
Organising, planning and orchestrating all our major projects on our marketing calendar. Sharing updates with the team, keeping track of development, timelines and meeting deadlines.
Work closely with our Creative Producer and Creatives, Marketing team and involved departments to make sure projects are delivered on time, within budget and beyond expectations.
Manage our (media) partners, negotiate deals and take care of legal follow up.
Develop clear creative briefs for campaigns, social media, events etc.
Manage and execute collaboration projects.
Report progress updates and expectations to the Board, sharing evaluations and recaps with the wider company.
Skills & Qualifications

You have at least 3+ years experience in managing teams/departments within the fashion industry or in similar position
5+ years of proven experience in Project Management or Producing at an agency or high profile consumer-facing brand.
Proven experience in managing production budgets,
Experience in working with multiple stakeholders, varying from Directors, interns and artists, to production partners, brand-/sales managers, venues and media partners.
Ability to align people with different perspectives and priorities towards common objectives
Preferably have a network within the creative industry.
Skilled in project management tools such as Monday, Google Sheets and Microsoft Excel.
You are organised and structured and have strong planning, organisational and problem-solving skills.
You are strategic and analytical and own great communication and people skills.
Excellent communication in written and spoken English and preferable Dutch.
Able to perform in high-pressure environments.
Available full-time
Environment

We promote an honest and transparent atmosphere and strive to inspire meaningful progress in everything we do. Responsibility and accountability are key values within our company. We are a culturally engaged and innovative, young, ambitious and growing team, united by diversity. We offer an international work environment which is empowered by our progressive and positive mindset.

Job Title: MarCom Marketing Manager (m/f/x) - EMEA/ AMS/ APAC

Job Description:
Mambu is the leading SaaS core banking engine. If you’re a customer of the largest digital bank in the Americas or Europe, then you’ve probably interacted with our platform and didn't even know it. We are at the heart of what makes digital banks and lenders work, the system that processes banking transactions and updates accounts and other financial records from deposits to loans and credit balances. But we are different. We are not just cloud-native, lean and flexible, we are helping revolutionise financial services globally. We are in a growth phase and we’ve only just begun.
To help us on our mission, we bring together people with the best skills and attitude. It doesn’t matter where you are from, what matters is the impact you have and your passion to make a difference.
We are looking for a Sr. Talent Acquisition Partner to join our Global Talent Acquisition team by focusing on our growing EMEA region and operate as a key business partner on critical talent searches across non-technical roles. It doesn’t matter where you are from, what matters is the impact you have and your passion to make a difference.
What you need to have:
6+ year of recruiting & sourcing experience within the banking, technology or fintech space
You have a passion for sourcing, working with passive candidates and you are capable of driving sourcing projects independently
Dynamic strategist focused on driving growth and organisational change/design to Talent Acquisition programs, strategy and execution.
Excellent interpersonal skills with ability to positively interact at all levels of the organisation including the executive team, hiring managers, HR managers and vendors.
Data-driven with a proven ability to derive insights, establish metrics, monitor, and report against critical KPIs.
Accuracy and attention to detail come naturally to you, and so does keeping your ATS (Applicant Tracking System) updated on a daily basis. You are used to working with clear candidate- and sourcing-KPIs and managing your time accordingly.
Why Mambu?
Mambu has over 200 live deployments, helping to revolutionize financial services in more than 55 countries globally, and we're just getting started.
Our clients include FinTech innovators, traditional banks, business and consumer lenders as well as P2P platforms who are all looking to grow and scale.
We understand nothing ensures our customers' success more than a happy team, so Mambu is built on a culture of trust and a sense of ownership in everything we do.
Mambu proactively takes the initiative to improve the industry for the better.
More about us:
To stay on top of the latest Fin-Tech trends and our success stories, please follow us on Apply Now at Mustakbil.com

At EY, you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we’re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better, too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all.

We are looking for people to fill the position of Technology Consultant as part of the Technology Transformation Team. If you are interested in working on digital transformation topics that are on the agenda of every financial services CIO, then don’t look any further. Joining EY will be a great next step in your career.

The opportunity
EY is the only major professional services firm with an integrated Financial Services practice across Europe, the Middle East, India, and Africa (EMEIA). Our Technology Transformation team is fast growing and is part of the larger Technology Consulting FSO group of EY Netherlands. We typically advise clients on and help with the implementation of their IT strategies, IT operating model, IT architecture, and the adoption of new technologies (e.g. cloud, AI, and lowcode).

Your key responsibilities
You’ll work with financial services industry clients such as banks, insurers, wealth management firms, pension funds, and payment service firms to improve their customer journey, business processes, the way they store and use their data, and how they work and drive innovation – all by seeking ways to use (FinTech) technology. This work includes gathering and analyzing information, drawing key conclusions and making recommendations about the business, processes, people, and technological capabilities.

Skills and attributes for success
In this role, your thoughts and input are valued and you will have a lot of freedom to contribute.

To qualify for the role you must have
Obtained an university Master degree with a strong academic record and ideally an IT and business component.
Strong analytical thinker, preferably with experience in consulting and the financial industry.
Proven record of collaboration and leadership in a work setting and/or through extracurricular activities.
Fluent (oral and written) in English. Dutch is preferred or you have the motivation to learn the language.

Ideally, you’ll also have
Well-articulated interest and vision of digital trends, market developments, and regulatory changes in the financial services industry and how this impacts our clients.

What we look for
We are looking for someone who is a self-starter and who is willing to learn about new developments and to pick up new skills. You will be placed in a fast-paced environment and an open culture with lots of opportunity for personal and professional development. In this role, your thoughts and input are valued and you will have a lot of freedom to contribute. To help you achieve this, you will receive exceptional soft and hard skills training – along with plenty of education, coaching, and feedback.
What working at EY offers
We offer a competitive remuneration package where you’ll be rewarded for your individual and team performance. Our comprehensive Total Rewards package includes support for flexible working and career development. At EY, your competencies and your areas of interest will determine your future, plus we offer you:
Continuous learning: You’ll develop the mindset and skills to navigate whatever comes next.
Success as defined by you: We’ll provide the tools and flexibility, so you can make a meaningful impact, your way.
Transformative leadership: We’ll give you the insights, coaching and confidence to be the leader the world needs.
Diverse and inclusive culture: You’ll be embraced for who you are and empowered to use your voice to help others find theirs.

Find out more on www.werkenbijey.nl about the many benefits to which you are entitled as employee at EY

If you can demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please contact us as soon as possible.

The exceptional EY experience. It’s yours to build.

EY | Building a better working world
EY exists to build a better working world, helping to create long-term value for clients, people and society and build trust in the capital markets.

Enabled by data and technology, diverse EY teams in over 150 countries provide trust through assurance and help clients grow, transform and operate.

Working across assurance, consulting, law, strategy, tax and transactions, EY teams ask better questions to find new answers for the complex issues facing our world today.

An (online) assessment and a pre employment screening are part of the application procedure.
Due to laws and regulations, and because EY (and in some cases its clients) has high demands on the reliability and integrity of its employees, every new employee will be screened. Depending on your rank the pre employment screening could contain the following: Certificate of Conduct (in Dutch: VOG) or - if requesting a Dutch VOG is not possible - Criminal Background Check of the country you are currently living or have lived during the last five years, integrity questionnaire, verification of ID, diploma’s and/or work experience and consultation of the Dutch insolvency registry.

Amsterdam, Netherlands
Consumer Insights
At Netflix, we are shaping the future of entertainment because we believe there is a better way to enjoy TV. Like our members, we love movies and TV shows and we want the world to experience the joy of entertainment wherever and whenever they want.
To succeed around the world, we need an unparalleled level of consumer insight to understand what motivates ‘must-watch’ entertainment moments and conversation across a range of cultures.
We are looking for an experienced Senior Researcher to join our EMEA team for a role with a particular focus on Sub-Saharan Africa. This position will be based in the Netflix office in Amsterdam.
The Role:
Senior Researchers at Netflix are valued consultants who partner with our EMEA regional Content, Marketing, and Product teams. We help them tell incredible stories, develop world-class campaigns, and optimize the experience of using Netflix. You will work closely with the teams to understand their insights needs; then develop, execute, and deliver best-in-class research to address them.
We seek an individual who sees themselves in the following descriptions:
Can flourish in our unique company culture.
A consumer insights expert with deep cultural understanding of at least one of the following markets: South Africa, Nigeria, Kenya; and is able to speak about trends, market intelligence, and competition in these markets.
Has significant experience in consumer research and insights, and is passionate about content. Entertainment research experience is a plus.
Lives and breathes primary research (both qualitative and quantitative) and has extensive experience designing and executing studies on the ground in Sub-Saharan Africa. Experience with social listening tools is a plus.
Knows how to design a research project to meet the needs of the business question and can determine which methodology best serves the purpose.
Understands the consumer’s voice and how to turn what people say into actionable findings.
Is a great communicator written and verbal with experience presenting to colleagues and leadership.
Loves rolling their sleeves up and diving into projects while always looking to innovate and deliver more impact.
Is comfortable prioritising work across multiple requests and stakeholders to ensure that they have the greatest impact to the business.
Qualifications:
At least 7+ years of hands-on experience in a research/consumer insights department or market research agency in South Africa, Nigeria, and/or Kenya.
Ideally, entertainment and media industry experience (for example: a movie studio, TV broadcast, TV network, or research agency).
Experience presenting / socializing insights at all levels of an organization (and especially to non-researchers).

Are you an ambitious Leader in CRM looking for your next challenge? If so, read on!

We’re front runners in the photo product industry, blazing a trail across the globe with six different brands – Albelli, Bonusprint, Fotoknudsen, Onskefoto, MonAlbumPhoto, and Resnap. We’re proud of what we do and the way we do it, attracting talent from all over the world. At the last count, our offices were home to over 40 different nationalities. As one of the fastest-growing eCommerce companies in the Netherlands, we’re constantly striving to push boundaries and drive our business further forward. Because of this, we set ourselves bold ambitions and expect everyone working here to do the same.
Purpose

As our Head of CRM you will be working at our headquarters in Amsterdam. You will manage, coach and develop a sizeable CRM team across multiple locations, and you will be responsible for managing the strategy, operations & development of our CRM channels for all our European markets. This role is of high strategic importance for albelli and comes with significant ownership, autonomy, and a big impact on our customer’s experience and our business performance. The ideal candidate is a senior CRM leader with a background working in international environments and a track-record in developing world-class teams and programs in a fast-paced eCommerce environment. The role reports into our Head of Marketing.

Responsibilities:

Enable career paths, purpose and individual growth and success for team members; mentors and grows individuals and further develops a high-performance culture with high attention to team development and talent management.
Ensure excellent technical performance of the CRM channels by having expert knowledge on industry-leading practices with specific focus on mobile capabilities, tooling and automation, and a deep understanding of the general CRM landscape.
Constantly develop and refine our retention strategy to deliver on our ambitious financial targets and customer KPIs.
Ensure flawless execution of the strategy via multi-channel campaigns across the key retention channels (Email, Push etc.) in tight collaboration with key stakeholders across albelli.
Steer the performance of our retention channels with high attention to detail, thorough KPI monitoring, day-to-day performance management and forecasting - relentlessly focusing on generating new insights and continuously driving improvements that fuel customer life-time value and revenue growth.

Requirements:

At least 5 years of experience in leading large CRM teams in fast paced international e-commerce environments.
Proven track record as an excellent people manager and mentor, building high-performing autonomous teams and coaching individuals to achieve their performance goals and their personal development objectives.
Commercial mind-set and a proven history delivering on ambitious goals; bias for action, curious, innovative, risk-taking, and motivated by high growth.
Outstanding experience in designing and operationalizing multichannel (Email + Push) campaigns in ESPs (experience with Adobe Campaign Standard is a big plus) with strong focus on Mobile. Expert knowledge of Email and Mobile creative requirements, marketing trends and best practices.
Strong analytical skills with affinity for customer data (experience with Looker and Adobe Analytics is a big plus). Experience designing and setting up hyper-segmented customer lifecycle campaigns, using propensity modelling and setting up complex multichannel A/B tests.
Strong communication and collaboration skills across all organizational levels, fluent in English (Dutch not required).

We offer

A fast-growing e-commerce environment
An international office hosting over 40 nationalities
Competitive compensation, relocation support and lots of benefits
A social atmosphere (lunch, Friday drinks, parties, sports, etc.). To be resumed Post COVID-19!
An informal, fun and driven culture
A central location in one of Europe’s most vibrant cities, Amsterdam!

COVID-19 update

For the safety of our employees and following the measures implemented due to COVID-19, we currently work differently. Our Amsterdam and Nijmegen offices are closed while our production facility in the Hague is operating with proper safety and health measures. Our Recruiting process is currently entirely remote via phone and video calls. Our new hires will have a remote onboarding since the well-being of our employees is our number one priority. For the time being, most of you will be working from home until further notice. This situation can change at any time.

Job Title: Expert Portfolio Management Change & Conduct Lending (f/m)
Job Description:
You are an Expert within the field of Portfolio Management (PM) within Commercial Banking (CB). Portfolio Management will play an instrumental role in the execution of the CB’s 1st line of defence role in a capital efficient way and support its Originate to Distribute Strategy. The changes in the regulatory environment of banking require more efficient and effective risk and capital management to optimise returns in the highly competitive Commercial Clients segment.
Active portfolio management through central management of the CB credit portfolio and the ability to give insights and / or steer / advice on highest returning (over capital) opportunities are your focus areas. PM’s ambition is to increase Income / RWA through higher assets rotation (>10%) and in the same time stay in control of our lending activities.
PM Experts will be involved in a broad spectrum of projects and activities. Capacity within the team will be allocated in a flexible way, depending on specific needs in a certain period and (project) deadlines. An expert will have a flexible time/capacity allocation to various activities depending on the focus of PM at such time.

Your job
Primarily, your scope is Change and Conduct Lending. You ensure:
Execution and embedding of regulatory and/or lending related projects
Development / update of lending related guidelines and processes
Coordination and review of lending policies
Offering lending expertise for training & learning solutions
Enabling and support the Expert Leads of PM and the MT CB in related projects
Bank wide seek alignment in related topics with business lines, 2nd and 3rd line of defence parties
Establishing a strong risk culture and policy adherence
Working environment
Portfolio Management is a new department. You will report to Expert Lead Change & Conduct Lending. The department is located in Amsterdam (GML) together with the other FS&PM teams. FS&PM is a dynamic department with very talented, product skill driven colleagues.

Agile Delivery Manager
Ready to shape tomorrow?
Currencycloud is somewhere where innovative thinking and the power of technology know no limits. We know that the success of the business depends on the people who keep it moving, which is why we are looking for exceptional talent to join our international payments revolution.

About the role
We’re looking for a passionate, high-agency Agile Delivery Manager to join our company. Your mission is to chase down and remove all impediments for a dedicated scrum team so you can all concentrate on quickly and sustainably delivering value for our customers and business.
Your work will be framed by three questions:
 Technical discovery: Do the engineers and stakeholders have all the documentation and knowledge needed to deliver value for our customers and business?
 Delivery: What can be done to identify and remove all impediments faced by the scrum team in delivering value for our customers?
 Agile & lean practices: How can we ensure a culture of continuous learning when it comes to agile and lean practices?
This role will focus on the following activities:
Technical discovery:
Detailed discovery on things like payment files, bank or operational flows and systems maps
Working with internal & external teams to develop and maintain technical documentation
Ensuring requirements are detailed enough to take into sprint, including functional & non-functional requirements
Delivery:
Collaborating in the writing of epics and user stories
Doing what is needed to unblock the scrum team during the sprint
Stakeholder management
Reporting and managing operational delivery metrics
Agile & lean practices:
Leading/coordinating standard agile ceremonies
Suggesting improvements to agile ways of working to increase productivity & employee engagement
What Experience do I need?
1 year + proven experience in an Agile Delivery Manager, Scrum Master or Business Analyst role, preferably in a software-first Fintech or start-up
In-depth knowledge of Agile process and principles, with real experience in creating working environments that adhere to them
Proven track record of chasing down impediments to deliver value for customers and business
Ability to communicate equally effectively with both technical and non-technical stakeholders
Preferably domain knowledge in Fintech - e.g. payments, FX, transaction banking or trading
 What personal attributes do I need?
A self-starter who takes accountability for getting things done
Top-notch stakeholder management skills, including the ability to influence colleagues in small, cross-functional scrum teams
Exceptional structure and attention to detail
Comfortable challenging the status quo and always curious about the way things work
Great written and verbal communication skills
Comfortable working in a scale up or growth environment and as part of a wider team

Anything extra to add?
Along with a no dress code policy & flexible working arrangements we also provide all of our employees with a prepaid debit card each month to spend on Wellness, or a contribution to a gym membership.
We offer a comprehensive range of employee benefits which include 25 days paid leave, 5% pension, BUPA health insurance, life insurance, long term sickness protection, a day off for your birthday and socials every Friday.

About Currencycloud
Currencycloud is a global payments platform built on smart technology that takes the complexity out of moving money. Developers use our API building blocks to build customised payment solutions. Whether you want to embed our payments infrastructure into your products or services, or build on top of it, we’ll fit into your business in a way that works for you.
We take care of all the intricacies and regulatory hurdles involved with cross-border payments, giving you the tools to globalise your business.
Our cloud-based platform removes that complexity from international transactions, giving you clarity and control over your business so you can focus on the things that matter: your customers. With enterprise-class solutions for clients and partners such as Visa and Starling Bank, Currencycloud understands your needs and can help with market-leading products.

Job Title: Business Analyst, Point of Sale Operations
Job Description:
This is Adyen

We took an unobvious approach to starting a payments company, building a platform from scratch. Today, we're the payments platform of choice for the world's brightest companies. Our unobvious approach is a product of our diverse perspectives. This diversity, of backgrounds, cultures, and perspectives, is essential in helping us maintain our momentum. Our business challenges are unique, we need as many different voices as possible to join us in solving them - voices like yours. So no matter where you're from, who you love, or what you believe in, we welcome you to be your true self at Adyen.

Business Analyst, Point of Sale Operations

Adyen's Point of Sale solution is growing very fast, and therefore, we're looking for an enthusiastic, pleasant team member. In this role, you will be helping to scale the Point of Sale solution across the globe by making sure we're providing the best solution to our merchants. You will be responsible for the management of all our deployed payment terminals. In order to contribute to Operational Excellence this team will make sure that all payment terminals are running on the latest software versions and that there is a global strategy and proactive approach with regards to replacing old payment terminal models by our newer models.

What you'll do

You will optimise the software rollout strategy.
You will work closely with Account Management and Sales teams in order to enable execution of the software rollout strategy.
You will discuss software rollout strategy with our key merchants.
You will monitor the performance of newly deployed software versions.
The first point of contact for our internal teams if issues are experienced on newly deployed software versions.
You will set up a strategy and execution plan for replacement of deprecated terminal model

Who you are

You are an extremely quick learner;
You have outstanding analytical skills, and are not afraid to dive into complex, technical subjects;
You know how to manage a project
You can communicate in English fluently, both written and verbally, and are not afraid to get out there to let your voice be heard;
You take pride in putting your team first, you value teams over ego;
You collaborate well, with both technical and commercial teams;
Experience with distributed systems is a plus

Who we are

Adyen is the payments platform of choice for the world's leading companies, delivering frictionless payments across online, mobile and in-store channels. It is the only provider of a modern end-to-end infrastructure, connecting directly to Visa, Mastercard, and consumers' globally preferred payment methods. With offices around the world, Adyen serves nine of the 10 largest U.S. internet companies and many worldwide retailers. Customers include Facebook, Uber, L'Oreal, Casper, Bonobos, and Spotify.

Ready to meet us?

Amsterdam based - supporting our people in the Benelux & Central European Operations, and our Accounting and Fund Management Teams.
Are you ready to reimagine HR’s most misunderstood role: the HRBP?
At Prologis we offer a very entrepreneurial approach to the role of People & Culture Business Partner (HRBP). Based in Amsterdam, our European headquarters, the majority of time is spent working very closely with business partners across Benelux & Central Europe as well as our Accounting and Fund Management teams. You become their trusted advisor, helping them to develop into great leaders and, making them comfortable in operating within our organizational culture.
Are you an unofficial teacher, detective, peacemaker, and career planner?
How does it look like in practice?
To successfully build our leadership talent for the future, you will report into the European VP of HR, work alongside our Talent Acquisition Partner and lead a team of junior HRBP.
Key - you steer away from the traditional HR routes, spend time encouraging a feedback culture and coaching leaders on this matter. You regularly sit with teams to evaluate and improve dynamics while partnering to guarantee the organizational design matches the goals and strategy. You are skilled with understanding the business in which the partner operates and will advise taking in consideration all company’s aspects and not only their subject expertise.
You strive and love building “adult relationships”, before introducing any HR activity in the organization. Your motto is “what are we trying to solve with it?”, and are more than permitted to use very untraditional approaches. Our People & Culture Business Partners come continuously out of their comfort zone.
Are you the experienced person we are looking for?
#LI-LMP
People First
Each of us working at Prologis plays an essential role in the enduring success of our company. We value people who are decisive, courageous and adaptable. While we are one company, locations and departments operate with autonomy and accountability. Individuals take the initiative here.
When you join Prologis, you work shoulder to shoulder with some of the top talent in the industry to do the best work of your career. Every employee belongs. Every employee contributes. Employees advance their careers here.
As a successful global enterprise, Prologis has never lost sight of what matters most, our strong belief that our people are the most important part of our business. And because of that, we provide a generous total rewards package and take a lot of time to focus on quality management and leadership development. People come first here.
Employment Type:
Full time
Location:
Amsterdam, Netherlands
Additional Locations:

Job Title: Manager of Inside Sales - EMEA South
Job Description:
The Manager of Inside Sales is accountable for managing a team of Inside Sales Representatives, responsible for prospecting and generating revenue. This person is a metrics manager that directs Insides Sales Representatives to identify and execute on winning opportunities, proper and timely follow up, and delivering an excellent experience to the customer. The Manager of Inside Sales also ensures that the Insides Sales Representatives are operating at a high level of performance and prioritize opportunities in accordance to company objectives.


What You'll Do

People Management
Build a strong sustainable organization with high levels of employee engagement by attracting and developing superior talent and rewarding superior performance of teams and individuals.
Provide employees with coaching, feedback, and development
Reward superior team and individual performance
Maintain an atmosphere of respect, mutual support, flexibility, continuous learning, good humor, and commitment to business goals and customer needs
Match staff skills and talent to tasks to ensure optimal engagement and performance
Establishing and maintaining relationships and effectively communicating with customers, business unit leaders and senior management
Manage operations staffing, including recruitment, supervision, scheduling, development, evaluation, and disciplinary actions
Utilize leadership and management skills to close gaps between actual and desired results
Ensure team members have specific direction on closing new business with existing accounts

Sales Management
Perform sales forecasting and pipeline management
Maintain a strong knowledge of Workiva products through a commitment to ongoing training
Identify knowledge gaps on team and provide training when and where appropriate
Maintain high level of communication with Sr./Director of Inside Sales to stay abreast of continually changing focus in order to meet needs of sales organization and Workiva
Measure progress toward predetermined result areas, i.e. servicing existing account needs

Team Management
Manage Mid Market team to achieve quarterly bookings targets by driving value of Wdesk with current customers and new logos
Manage Business Development Manager (BDM) team to achieve Sales Accepted Opportunities, distributed evenly amongst field sales team
Manage BDM team to achieve quarterly bookings targets by driving value of Wdesk with current customers and new logos
Establish strong relationship with sales managers and ensure BDMs on the team are having weekly 1:1’s with each RSD they support
Ensure weekly meetings are scheduled between each field and BDM pairing—join these calls to ensure correct topics are covered and relationship is being established from both sides
What You'll Need
Undergraduate Degree or equivalent combination of education and experience in a related field.
Considerable knowledge of accounting preferred
Proficient knowledge of Software as a Service business model
Demonstrated coaching and leadership skills
Ability to motivate team members and influence others
Strong presentation skills
Strong knowledge of Workiva products and internal processes through a commitment to ongoing training
Excellent time and territory management skills
5+ year of progressive sales management experience, preferably in the software or technology areas
3+ years of proven sales growth in the field of selling Software as a Service products
Up to 50% travel in the field required to customer's offices
Reliable internet access for any period of time working remotely, not in a Workiva office.
Strong commercial acumen of Central and Southern Europe
Fluent English required; additional fluency in Spanish, French or German a plus
Where You’ll Work
Our values drive how we work and who we hire. You will see these values ingrained in how we support our customers, work with team members, build our products and in the work environment we’ve created.
Customer Success : Always delight our customers.
Trust: Rely on each other.
Integrity: Do the right thing, every time.
Collaboration: Share resources and work together.
Innovation: Keep creating solutions and finding better ways.
Inclusion: Support a diverse community where we all belong.
Accountability: Be responsible for your success and failure.

We believe our people are our greatest asset, and our unique culture gives employees the opportunity to make an impact everyday. We give our employees the freedom and resources they need—backed by our culture of collaboration and diverse thought—to continue innovating and breaking new ground. We hire talented people with a wide range of skills and experiences who are eager to tackle some of today’s most challenging problems.
At Workiva, you’ll enjoy:
Casual Dress: Workiva has a casual work environment, most people wear jeans to the office.
Involvement: Ability to participate in Employee Resource Groups, (Women in Tech, Women in Sales, Ethnic Diversity, Veterans, Rainbow (LGBTQ), Remote Employees, Caregiving) Volunteering, Company wide celebrations, and more
Work-life Balance: We have competitive PTO, VTO and Parental Leave. We encourage employees to spend time enjoying life outside of work.

Learn more: https://www.linkedin.com/company/workiva/life/
Workiva is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We believe that great minds think differently. We value diversity of backgrounds, beliefs, and interests, and we recognize diversity as an important source of intellectual thought, varied perspective, and innovation. Employment decisions are made without regard to age, gender identity, race, religion, disability status, sexual orientation, or any other protected characteristic.
Workiva is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to applicants with disabilities. To request assistance with the application process, please email talentacquisition@workiva.com .

Manager, End User Technology, EMEA
Equinix is the leading global interconnection platform, accelerating business performance by connecting companies to their customers and partners inside the world’s most networked data centers. Global network providers, financial services companies, cloud and content providers, and enterprises look to Equinix Internet Business Exchange (IBX®) centers for world-class reliability and network diversity. With 220+ IBX centers located in 65 strategic markets in 27 countries across Americas, Europe and Asia-Pacific, Equinix enables customers to reliably operate their mission-critical infrastructures on a global basis.


Why Equinix


As a recognized global leader in its industry, Equinix employs dedicated, driven experts who take pride in their work. When you choose to work for Equinix, you’re not just selecting a job, you’re embarking on a career. You’re not just working for a company; you’re joining a vital, global team.


As the manager of EMEA End User Technology team you will be leading a large team responsible for providing a world class user experience at Equinix. You will be responsible for managing 10+ teammates located in the Amsterdam, London, Frankfurt, Madrid, and Paris supporting over 16 countries. You will work closely with your direct reports, peer global management teammates, and upper management, in a highly collaborative environment to fulfill end user requests and incident management.
Responsibilities:
The EMEA End User Technology Manager will provide leadership for and management of the systems, services, and support provided by Equinix’s Global Help Desk teams. These teams are comprised of Technicians and Engineers providing 24x7 coverage of frontline customer support needs, as well as back-office IT operational services. The EMEA End User Technology Manager will be responsible for establishing and ensuring achievement of regular and measurable goals for the training and development of individual staff members. The EMEA End User Technology Manager will develop and implement processes and support structures to maintain superior service and ensures that the functional needs of the organization are understood and met.
The EMEA End User Technology Manager will be responsible for critical decision making and coordination, and is the escalation point for customer service and support issues. For projects and other defined engagements, the EMEA End User Technology Manager ensures proper resources are assigned and acts as the primary contact, lead, and coordinator when necessary.
Qualifications & Experience
Desired Knowledge/Skills:
Service oriented with excellent interpersonal skills and the ability to develop and maintain strong relationships with stakeholders throughout the organization
Excellent analytical skills and creative problem-solving abilities
Excellent verbal and written communication skills with the ability to advocate for solutions receive feedback and collaborate with other platform leads and architects.
Excellent time management and organizational skills
Understanding of ITIL practices, with heavy focus on Helpdesk KPI reporting via Service-Now
Embrace Equinix atmosphere/culture while being able to adapt to cultural differences all throughout the EMEA region
Requirements:
100% fluency in English and Dutch languages, written and speaking
Bachelor's degree or equivalent combination of education/experience in Computer Science, Information Systems, or related field
4 - 7 years of experience with the following:
Directly managing an in-person support team
Experience in M&A projects
Supporting employees and solving hardware and software problems with both Windows and Apple products.
Hands on knowledge of current IT and communications technology fundamentals (Mac, Windows, IOS, Android)
Experience with using and managing hosted productivity and communications applications, including Zoom, Microsoft O365, Adobe and others.
Possess both exemplary customer service skills and the ability to train and support employees on IT systems and hardware.
Strong interpersonal, oral, and written communication skills is required
Exceptional prioritization, proficient problem analysis, process, and project management skills
Results-focused, team-oriented professional with a strong work ethic. Able to multi-task and work in a fast-paced environment

Job Title: Head of Performance Marketing - hyper-growth healthtech
Job Description:
The Company
HeliosX is a group of healthtech startups, with fast-growing operations in the UK and USA.
We are dedicated to improving the quality, accessibility and affordability of healthcare for all. We’re on a mission to transform how healthcare and skincare are delivered, and we’re doing this through a market-disrupting combination of technology, science and excellent clinical care.
The Role
At HeliosX, we’ve experienced an exceptional period of growth as our group of companies continues to expand globally at a rapid pace and we continue to disrupt the health industry. To maintain this trajectory, we’re searching for an experienced Head of Performance Marketing to lead all paid acquisition activities across our brands. In this role you will be responsible for building and leading a world class performance marketing function and driving the strategy, budget, and execution of new customer acquisition through all forms of media, focusing intensely on quantitative analytics. You’ll join the leadership team and be a thought partner in company goal setting and strategic planning. This role reports directly to the VP Growth at HeliosX Group.
Responsibilities
Direct the channel strategy, management and budget allocation across the performance marketing mix, including paid social, search, display, shopping ads, affiliates, connected TV, podcasts amp; more.
Own global business metrics hit and exceed user acquisition targets with an eye toward cost-efficient growth and improving LTV:CAC.
Actively investigate and identify high potential opportunities to test and incorporate into the channel mix.
Plan, execute, and measure experiments and conversion tests to lower CAC and increase conversions.
Leverage performance marketing analytics to evaluate the end-to-end customer experience across multiple channels and customer touch points and identify opportunities for growth.
Implement marketing attribution capabilities inc. media mix modeling and multi-touch attribution as well as build out and advancement of these capabilities for use in planning and day-to-day channel management.
Hire, manage and mentor a team of best-in-class performance marketeers.
Create a culture of excellence and a clear system for understanding business priorities, aligning to them and being accountable for delivering results.
Establish quarterly OKRs for all paid channels and ensure that the team has a robust strategy in place to deliver.
Communicate and collaborate effectively across growth, branding, product and analytics
Requirements
6+ years of Performance Marketing across multiple channels (FB, Twitter, Reddit, Snapchat, Search, Display etc) is a must.
A successful track record of building and executing growth strategies with multi-million budgets for start-up and/or hype

Math Analyst - Netherlands
Haarlem, Netherlands Req #167
 Thursday, February 18, 2021
Do you love Math, but don’t want to work in a classroom? The Math Analyst I position is an entry-level opportunity for a graduate with a math background to apply their knowledge of probability, statistics, and programming into a real-world application. The Math Analyst is responsible for performing complex statistical methods to test software designs that impact the products and services in the gambling & lottery industry. Working closely with the Engineering team, the Math Analyst devotes a large majority of time directly towards testing and review, and may focus on standard game analysis, strategy game analysis, and/or random number generator (RNG) analysis.
Who We Are…
With over 30 years in the industry, Gaming Laboratories International is the global leader in the testing and certification of gaming devices and systems. We are proud of our stability and our history of world-class customer service delivery to more than 475 jurisdictions worldwide.
Why You Should Work Here…
Our employees are at the heart of everything we do, which is why they are our biggest investment. We offer competitive salaries, top-notch benefits and a company culture focused on employee development and career enhancement. Our team members have the opportunity to communicate and collaborate with colleagues around the world.
What You Will Accomplish Here…
The Math Analyst’s main focus will be on the following:
Testing and Math Analysis
Writing programs and performing other analyses to calculate needed mathematical features of games.
Writing programs or scripts to manipulate, parse or reorganize large data files into standard formats for testing.
Conducting and interpreting statistical testing on game simulation results and on RNG data.
Reading and interpreting jurisdictional requirements, consulting appropriately for interpretation.
Reviewing and Documenting
Reading and modifying programs and analyses developed by others to meet testing needs.
Reviewing, understanding, and documenting source code written in various languages.
Writing project reports by summarizing the testing conducted and the results.
Carefully reviewing analysis work conducted by others for accuracy.
Communicating Externally and Internally
Working with external clients, communicating professionally and courteously on topics of a technical nature
Effectively communicating and collaborating with other members of the Math Department and other employees
Experience, Education, Skills and Credentials:
Bachelor’s degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, or a closely related discipline
Associate degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, or 2+ years of equivalent experience may be considered; Certification, formal training, or experience may also be evaluated and considered in lieu of educational requirements
Must have knowledge of Probability, Statistics, and Combinatorics
Knowledge of a modern, object-oriented programming language such as C++, including appropriate use of object-oriented design is required
Must have an understanding of core programming concepts and techniques
Knowledge of Microsoft Excel is required
Must have the ability to communicate, both orally and written, with other members of the team and external contacts
Ability to handle and organize multiple projects and deadlines is required
Must demonstrate a high degree of attention to quality, details, and correctness
Must be able to pass a thorough background investigation
Gaming Laboratories International (GLI) is a gaming company. Any of our employees may be required to obtain a gaming license within one or all of the gaming jurisdictions. If you are requested by GLI to obtain a gaming license, your continued employment may be contingent on your ability to obtain that gaming license.


This job description should not be interpreted as all-inclusive; it is intended to identify major responsibilities and requirements of the job. The incumbent may be requested to perform other job-related task and responsibilities than those stated above.
GLI is an Equal Opportunity Employer
All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or veteran status.

 Picnic perks

Introduction:

Amplitude (Pre IPO) is the fastest growing digital analytics company in the world. With over $180+ million in VC funding raised from iconic investors Sequoia, Benchmark, YCombinator to name a few. Not to mention $100+ million in ARR, powered by 43% YoY revenue growth!

Amplitude is looking for Sales Development Representatives (SDR) to join our expanding team in EMEA. We are seeking driven individuals with high energy, sound business acumen and a natural sales instinct to join our Sales Development Team, and uplevel their enterprise software sales skills.

About The Role:

The Sales Development team is a strategic component of our go-to-market strategy. You will look to capture the attention of commercial & enterprise level companies to proactively build out our customer base. This position offers an outstanding opportunity to build a successful career in software sales.

As an SDR, you will be the first point of contact for new and existing prospects and customers respectively. With a mix of strong process and creativity, you will help drive new business revenue through both inbound and outbound opportunity generation.

You will engage effectively through various traditional channels such as email and phone while at the same time leveraging the latest prospecting methods like social, video prospecting and direct mail to generate meaningful conversations with product experts and senior business executives in prospect accounts to fuel our company's growth.

You will work closely with your assigned account executives to create and execute on a territory plan that will be critical to your success. You will also work closely with the marketing team to improve our campaigns and messaging in order to understand what's working and focus on where we win.

At Amplitude we are a company committed to your growth, your learning, your development, and your entire employee experience. We only win when our employees succeed. We have a cultural foundation built on diversity, inclusion, and innovation and we want you and your ideas to thrive at Amplitude.

Who?

You are right for this position if you:

Have a growth mindset and believe that your most basic abilities can be developed through dedication and hard work, brains and talent are just the starting point.
Have a positive attitude and are optimistic about situations and interactions and remain hopeful in difficult situations.
Enjoy working in a diverse team and environment where a rich and inclusive culture matters above all else.
Enjoy working in a high paced dynamic working environment where change is something that is always present.
Have gained some experience in sales, outbound calling or closing in the PaaS/SaaS industries OR in another industry.
Your long-term goal is to have a successful sales career in the tech industry, i.e. as an Account Executive or in a Team Lead role.

What?

As an Sales Development Representative, you will:

EMPOWER OTHERS: Partner with our Field Sales and Marketing teams to build creative outreach programs that build pipeline within your territory.
BE AN OWNER & DON'T SETTLE: Research and build new and existing accounts via adding contacts, outbound calling efforts and sending strategic email and social campaigns.
WEAR THE CUSTOMER'S SHOES: Engaging in high level conversations with Product Managers, Architects, Executives and C-Suite to enhance awareness and interest in targeted industries and segments.
BE INCLUSIVE: Develop strong relationships (both internal and external), and really excel at building long-lasting partnerships with prospective customers.

Ideal Candidate:

Ideally a minimum of 6 months of experience in a Sales related environment, we will consider graduate level candidates.
Solid business experience (SaaS sales preferred)
A "Can Do" / "Winner" attitude, with a hunger and 'self-starter' commitment to overachieve and succeed
Fluency in English is essential, you must also be a native speaker of either Swedish, Norwegian or Danish - if you speak more than one Nordic language it would be a bonus.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Bachelor's degree is preferable

Where?

Due to current European and worldwide restrictions our offices are currently closed. If successful you will likely be a remote employee in the UK for most of 2021.

Who Are We?

The Company: Amplitude is filled with humble, life-long learners who are eager to help one another and the company succeed. Our values of growth mindset, ownership, and humility are core to the way we work: we're tenacious in the face of challenges, we take the initiative to solve problems that drive our shared success, and we operate from a place of empathy and openness, seeking to understand many points of view.

We care about the well-being of our team: We offer flexible time off, a monthly wellness and health insurance stipend, delicious in-office lunch & snacks, commuting benefits, a 12-week parental leave, a generous Learning & Development stipend, and a full 10 year window to exercise your stock options.

The Product: Amplitude is the world's #1 product intelligence platform– we empower teams to use customer data to build great product experiences for growth. We're super proud of what we've built and continue to build on: a platform that enables companies to thrive.

Other Fun Facts About Amplitude

Founded in 2012, Amplitude is a Series E startup backed by Sequoia Capital, GIC, IVP, Battery Ventures, Benchmark Capital, Y Combinator and other top tier investors.
Twenty of the Fortune 100 are now customers of Amplitude as are innovative brands such as Atlassian, Twitter, FuboTV, and Thredup.
We have offices in San Francisco (HQ), New York, Singapore, Amsterdam, London, and Paris.
Our mascot is the datamonster, who loves to chow down on all your numbers, charts, and graphs. Nom nom.

Amplitude provides equal employment opportunities (EEO). All applicants are considered without regards to race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, marital status, ancestry, physical or mental disability, veteran status, or sexual orientation.

Amplitude's D&I Commitment: Amplitude believes that diversity enables creation of better products, ability to solve complex problems, and drive more powerful solutions. In order to make diversity possible, we commit to striving to create an environment of inclusion: an environment focused on psychological safety, empathy, and human connection, which will allow employees of all backgrounds to feel the care they need to thrive.

Our objective is to help people make better use of their data to make intelligent business decisions.

Historically this has been through data visualization and storytelling, this is now evolving through greater use of AI to automate insights and allowing powerful investigation driven by natural language queries. Augmented Insights drives intelligent decisions without lengthy data investigations.
Your job
As Augmented Insights Consultant, you will be part of the Strategy & Consulting team in Amsterdam. You will work directly with our clients in the Netherlands and sometimes also abroad to advise them from a business and technology perspective on how to become data driven. As Augmented Insights Consultant you operate in the intersection of data, business and design.
Your work can vary from advice on augmented insights platform they need to work on, including defining the solution architecture, to designing user-centric dashboards for employees to enable them in their data driven decision making.
As part of your day to day activities, you will be working with the latest technology and industry experts at top clients in the Netherlands and abroad to enable clients to become more data driven.
Your team
Our consultants in Strategy & Consulting are changing businesses every day using deep industry insights, knowledge and innovative ideas. Positioned at the crucial intersection of business, technology and industry, we devise creative new strategies based on trends, insights and data. With an eye for competitive advantage, digital disruption, operating models and the future workforce, we take on the challenge of designing and implementing transformative business solutions, using the newest technology.
Our research-based advice and situational analyses enable our clients to act with speed and confidence. Whether we're investigating complex issues or identifying new opportunities, our work always comes down to one thing: unlocking value and creating real, tangible impacts.

Your background
Master’s degree in areas like Information Management, Business Analytics, Supply Chain, Finance, Econometrics
1 – 3 years hands on experience in BI, data visualization in a business environment
UX/UI, visualization tools (Power BI, Tableau, ThoughtSpot, Qlik, MicroStrategy), Relational Database concepts, data transformation skills
English
Passionate about data driven decision making, eager to learn, creative thinker, analytical, entrepreneurial mindset
Willing to travel and work from home
Our offer
Accenture is an incredible place to work - and keep learning. By joining us, you’ll become part of a global company with a world-class brand and reputation. Besides the work we do for our clients, we’re proud of our vibrant, diverse workplace culture: we believe in openness and honesty, fairness and equality, common sense and realism. We want to get to know the real you and help you explore and grow - whatever it is you're great at. So, you will always have lots of learning opportunities (formal and informal) to improve your role-specific skills and expertise.
Besides our high-profile, challenging projects and our nurturing work environment, we offer excellent employee benefits, including:
A flexible transport arrangement that suits your personal situation (electric car or bicycle, flexible budget including NS business card)
An expense allowance
Discount on Accenture shares
The possibility to work 4 x 9 hours a week
Interested?
Are you ready to join Accenture for a career where you can be yourself and do what you love? Apply now and change the world around you.

Job Title: Senior Customer Success Manager - Large Enterprise
Job Description:
Our Customer Success team advises and guides a wide variety of customers, ensuring they launch Slack successfully, adopt it widely and continuously gain business value from our products and services. We serve as the trusted point of contact for Slack’s strategic key customers across the customer lifecycle; on-boarding, adoption, advocacy and renewal.


Working closely with Slack’s Account Executives, our CSMs provide strategic territory coverage, coordinating with the AEs to identify areas where existing customers could improve their use of Slack or uncover new uses for Slack. From time to time, our CSMs will work with Account Executives on pre-sales activities like pilot engagements to set up a customer for long term success.


Part coach, project manager, consultant and product specialist, our Slack Customer Success Managers are continually focused on helping our customers improve their team communication and be successful with Slack.


Slack has a positive, diverse, and supportive culture—we look for people who are curious, inventive, and work to be a little better every single day. In our work together we aim to be smart, humble, hardworking and, above all, collaborative. If this sounds like a good fit for you, why not say hello?


What you will be doing
You will evangelize our belief that the fastest way to achieve organisational agility is to change how people work - and we believe that requires established enterprises to rapidly evolve culture, process and technology at scale!
You will work closely with our largest enterprise customers to understand how they work, their business challenges, paint the art of the possible through Slack, and mentor them on how to personalise Slack to communicate, collaborate and work more effectively.
Understand the motivation, business drivers, strategic goals and desired business outcomes for your portfolio of large enterprise customers.
You will lead a cross-functional partnership across your named customer(s) and Slack and identify new ways our platform can differentiate them in the market.
You will craft joint customer success plans that include agreed upon scope, shared metrics, user engagement, sophistication of usage, adoption plans, timelines, communication, and eliminates barriers to customer advocacy and expansion.
Facilitate workshops with customers on best known practices, including sponsorship, governance, operating model, adoption, internal Champions network, platform maturity, and adoption techniques.
Facilitate Executive Business Reviews with economic decision makers and Slack executive sponsors, where we celebrate shared successes, and course correct where necessary.
Maintain high levels of engagement across a broad group of customers, with an emphasis on customer appreciation and advocacy
Serve as a mentor and coach to others on the Customer Success Team
Contribute to the library of customer success assets (customer references, case studies) and thought leadership (methodology, point of view, white papers)

What you should have
8+ years relevant work experience in customer-facing customer success, account management or strategic consulting roles. SaaS experience preferred
You are passionate about the future of work, and positively impacting the working lives of people in large organisations
This is a demanding role that requires strong leadership, committed priority management and high emotional intelligence.
You are an excellent teammate who has a consistent record of excelling in fast-growing environments and taking initiative!
Experience implementing and supporting large scale technology solutions at Fortune 500 companies
Consider program management a strength and have experience using joint sponsorship to execute against deadlines within a complex organisation
You have a passion for building trust and communicating with a broad range of partners: C-Suite, senior executives, business owners, Slack administrators, developers, and day-to-day users of the software
Experience in an enterprise solution sales environment and ability to partner with account executives in development and closure of sales opportunities is preferred
Fluent Dutch & English speaker

Slack has transformed business communication. It’s the leading channel-based messaging platform, used by millions to align their teams, unify their systems, and drive their businesses forward. Only Slack offers a secure, enterprise-grade environment that can scale with the largest companies in the world. It is a new layer of the business technology stack where people can work together more effectively, connect all their other software tools and services, and find the information they need to do their best work. Slack is where work happens.
Ensuring a diverse and inclusive workplace where we learn from each other is core to Slack’s values. We welcome people of different backgrounds, experiences, abilities and perspectives. We are an equal opportunity employer and a pleasant and supportive place to work.
Come do the best work of your life here at Slack.

About Cognizant
Cognizant (Nasdaq-100: CTSH) is one of the world's leading professional services companies, transforming clients' business, operating and technology models for the digital era. For the location Amsterdam-Zuid we are looking for a
Organon – Manager Demand Management & Fulfillment
Welcome in our team
Our Supply Chain Management (SCM) organization takes care of supply chain planning and execution in such way, that we can always meet demand from our markets and customers to ultimately serve health care providers and patients in the best way.
These supply chain plans drive manufacturing, packaging, purchasing, inventory control, inter-company supply and distribution. We closely collaborate with Marketing & Sales, Finance, Regulatory Affairs, Quality and Manufacturing teams all over the world. SCM is responsible to deliver the right product, in the right quantity and at the right time to our internal and external customers.
Demand Management & Fulfillment (DM&F) team is a vital part of the SCM organization. It oversees the downstream part of the supply chain, from Packaging Sites to Distribution Centers to customers in all markets in the EMEA region. The team receives and manages demand forecast and orders, it coordinates supply throughout the downstream supply chain, monitors inventories and provides services associated with supply management.
The position
The Manager DM&F leads, manages and develops a DM&F team of 4-8 people, who act as primary contacts to the Commercial Organization and customers in a certain geography in regards of demand and supply of pharmaceutical product. The Manager builds and maintains relations with these parties, as well as with other stakeholders in SCM, Quality, Finance, Manufacturing and Regulatory.
The Manager DM&F and his/her team are responsible to enable timely and compliant supply to meet customer and ultimately patient demand at optimal cost and inventory levels. He/she is engaged in continuous improvement and change management to achieve greater value for the company, its customers and the patients it serves.
The Manager reports to the Associate Director DM&F and acts as his/her back-up if and when needed.
Main responsibilities
Manage, develop and retain a high performing team. Motivate, inspire and coach your team in career and performance development. Identify and support training needs and enable growth opportunities.
Manage daily operations of the DM&F team for the assigned markets and/or customers, aimed at ensuring supply, in compliance with regulations and procedures, optimizing inventory levels and minimizing IQV and discards.
Effectively building, managing and maintaining relationships with many different stakeholders: Commercial Operations at regional and market level, 3rd party customers, our production sites and external suppliers, Global Support Functions and other Supply Chain Management areas.
Manage and resolve escalated supply issues via effective coordination and communication in close cooperation with the Planning teams, sites and the customers. Escalate risks and issues as appropriate via the Tier process.
Develop, implement and maintain key supply chain metrics. Help set performance targets. Evaluate performance against target and drive performance improvements.
Support demand reviews and support driving improvement of the demand signal.
Contribute to deployment, sustainment and improvement of IBP (S&OP) processes at regional and market level S&OP.
Drive or support initiatives to transform and improve supply chain management practices.
Support managing the financial budget for the area and help drive value capture and cost savings initiatives.
Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent is required. Advanced degree in an appropriate discipline is beneficial.
Minimum of 5 years’ experience and proven, significant accomplishments in Supply Chain Management and/or Customer Service.
Proven track record or clear potential to quickly develop solid skills in people management.
Solid stakeholder management experience; proven ability to build, develop and maintain productive relationships with different stakeholders.
Strong analytical skills, willing and able to invest in understanding and improving processes and systems.
Comprehensive computer literacy in Microsoft Office and ERP systems (e.g. SAP / Rapid Response).
Fluency in English language, both verbally and in writing.

You can send your application via our website.

We welcome you to a truly global, dynamic and challenging environment with great opportunities for personal development. Our benefits are very competitive; the summary below will give you an idea of what you can expect.
Competitive salary and a 3% year-end bonus;
35,5 days of leave;
Attractive collective health care insurance package with considerable reduction rates;

Who we are …
Organon delivers ingenious health solutions that enable people to live their best lives. We are a $6.5 billion global healthcare company focused on making a world of difference for women, their families and the communities they care for. We have an important portfolio and are growing it by investing in the unmet needs of Women’s Health, expanding access to leading biosimilars and touching lives with a diverse and trusted portfolio of health solutions.
Our Vision is clear: A better and healthier every day for every woman.
At launch, we will be more than 10,000 Founders strong, ready to rise together as we make a difference in a new way. As Founders, employees will create their future and will help shape the direction of Organon and its impact on the world. Our culture reflects our passion for those we champion.
At Organon, we all belong. We embrace diversity and give it a voice. Our commitment to supporting women is reflected in the make-up of our leadership team, which is majority female and our diversity of experience is core to who we are and what we are designed to do.
We are an equal opportunity employer, committed to fostering an inclusive and diverse workplace.

About PVH Corp.
PVH is one of the most admired fashion and lifestyle companies in the world. We power brands that drive fashion forward – for good. Our brand portfolio includes the iconic CALVIN KLEIN, TOMMY HILFIGER, Van Heusen, IZOD, ARROW, Warner’s, Olga and Geoffrey Beene brands, as well as the digital-centric True&Co. intimates brand. We market a variety of goods under these and other nationally and internationally known owned and licensed brands. PVH has over 40,000 associates operating in over 40 countries and $9.9 billion in annual revenues. That's the Power of Us. That’s the Power of PVH.
The Team
The Tommy Hilfiger Sourcing & Production team is one of the main drivers within Tommy Hilfiger Europe. Based in the Amsterdam HQ, the team is split into different product specialist teams.
The Tommy Hilfiger Non Denim Bottoms team is responsible for developing and producing the Non Denim Bottoms for several different Tommy Hilfiger divisions.
The Non Denim Bottoms team works closely together, in an informal setting, with Design and Merchandise to create superbly styled and high end quality products for an international consumer base.
The Position
The Product Developer is responsible for the product development from sketch (created by Design / Merchandise) until final product coming out of production. The product is developed, produced and received based on the standards and goals established in cooperation with the Design / Merchandising department. The key objective is to be responsible for the follow up of the total Non Denim pants development in collaboration with Merchandise, Design, Technical team and Sales.
Key Responsibilities:
Responsible for development and production of the Non Denim Bottoms Collection.
Works with the offshore offices, vendors to control the status and changes to the styles, follows up on deadlines for proto samples, lab-dips, sales samples, size sets and production approval samples.
Responsible for tracking all proto and fit samples for each season of the collection as well as proactive planning.
Prepares and participates in adoption and alignment meetings makes collection overviews with design and Merchandise.
Coordinates and ensures that all the systems are updated and matching as per internal information (PLM, VMS, etc.).
Responsible for the maintenance of the garment worksheets and size specifications in close collaboration with Design and the Technical team.
Travels to production facilities in Turkey and in Portugal, to check status and quality of samples and production.
Takes a pro-active role in continuously improving the product in ways of quality and fit. Searches new innovative way’s for washing and dyeing to enhance the Non Denim product.
Responsible for the option count of the Non Denim Collection, together with Merchandise.
Responsible for reaching the requested margin on the product.
Responsible for quality and on time delivery of production
Negotiates the best possible FOB per style. Has a deep understanding of pricing and understands the different components of cost.
Create a cohesive internal and external product team.
Reports into the Sr. Manager Non Denims Tommy Hilfiger.
The Ideal Candidate:
Education: higher textile education (AMFI, Saxion, TMO)
Minimum 5 years working experience in development/sourcing/production/washing of bottoms/pants field.
Used to working under pressure with deadlines. Is organized and structured.
Ability to think out of the box, solution orientated and pragmatic.
Excellent communication and negotiating skills.
Solid expertise of fabrics and physical production.
Solid knowledge of garment specifications, fitting and pattern making.
Willingness to travel.
Hands on product mentality and good fashion taste level.
Team player.
Fluent in English.

An international environment which respects diversity, equality, and individuality

About Netskope

Today, there's more data and users outside the enterprise than inside, causing the network perimeter as we know it to dissolve. We realized a new perimeter was needed, one that is built in the cloud and follows and protects data wherever it goes, so we started Netskope to redefine Cloud, Network and Data Security.

Since 2012, we have built the market-leading cloud security company and an award-winning culture powered by hundreds of employees spread across offices in Santa Clara, San Francisco, Seattle, Bangalore, London, Melbourne, and Tokyo. Our core values are openness, honesty, and transparency, and we purposely developed our open desk layouts and large meeting spaces to support and promote partnerships, collaboration, and teamwork. From catered lunches and office celebrations to employee recognition events and social professional groups such as the Awesome Women of Netskope (AWON), we strive to keep work fun, supportive and interactive. Visit us at Netskope Careers and follow us on Twitter @Netskope and Facebook.
