Every month Marktplaats, 2dehands and 2ememain handle over 11 million unique visitors and 12 million new advertisements, making us the largest online trading platform in the Benelux. But we want to go even further - we are constantly evolving our platform to deliver the experience our customers love. We are a mix of Dutch and Silicon Valley cultures; like both, we are an international team of passionate people who share a common interest in solving problems using software and data. We invite you to join us!
About the team:
Classifieds is shaping the future of local commerce by bringing people together through an enriched online experience that allows them to work closely with the community around them. We are comprised of more than 1,000 people who are passionate for local trade and maintaining the customer-centric nature of the Group, while exploring growth opportunities in both the countries where eBay Classifieds Group already has a presence and in prospective markets.
About the Role:
We are looking for an outstanding engineering leader to help us deliver on our mission of removing barriers to trade for our millions of customers.
You'll be responsible for a large group of multidisciplinary engineers that are building the services and capabilities that power our product today, and in the future. You will be the critical intersection of Engineering, Platform, Product and Commercial, and will be ultimately accountable for creating and delivering a product engineering strategy that supports us in our quest to improve the everyday lives of our customers.
What you'll bring:
Forward-thinking in anticipating the intersection of technology advancements, customer preferences, and business outcomes.
Ability to start with the business strategy and develop an engineering approach that builds extensible frameworks and architectures that tackle a range of future opportunities.
Ability to drive organizational change, balance business requirements with technology initiatives, provide technical leadership and lead execution on critical initiatives.
Ability to facilitate development of an architectural vision with a compelling narrative and financial analysis that supports and aligns to the business and technology strategy.
Outstanding communication skills with global & diverse audiences - Strong critical thinking and analytical skills.
Deep product development expertise and understanding of enterprise platforms, APIs, and microservices.
Exceptional leadership skills and an ability to develop and motivate a large team of engineers.
Strong analytical abilities to organize and solve for multivariate problems.
Above all, we want our engineering team to be energized by your leadership and motivated by how you help them think through exciting problems and grow their skills & knowledge base!
Benefits:
Benefits are an essential part of your total compensation for the work you do every day. Whether you’re single, in a growing family, or nearing retirement, eBay offers a variety of comprehensive and competitive benefit programs to meet your needs.
We love creating opportunities for others by connecting people from widely diverse backgrounds, perspectives, and geographies. So, being diverse and inclusive isn’t just something we strive for, it is who we are, and part of what we do each and every single day. We want to ensure that as an employee, you feel eBay is a place where, no matter who you are, you feel safe, included, and that you have the opportunity to bring your unique self to work. Do you have the ability to build great relationships and do you get energized by attracting and selecting the best talents for positions within Accenture? This is your chance! The Accenture Recruitment team is looking for a Recruiter.

Your job
As a Senior Corporate Recruiter at Accenture, you are responsible for the full recruitment cycle. With your positive attitude and team spirit you can look ahead and act as a trusted advisor for your stakeholders. You use your creative, analytical and commercial skills to empower Accenture to grow while also growing yourself.

Your main responsibilities will be:

Manage the full cycle recruiting process for experienced candidates, ensuring a smooth and positive candidate experience;
Act as our main point of contact for all candidates throughout the recruiting process;
You contribute in thinking about the recruitment strategy; you advise your internal clients and you will be responsible for efficient fulfillment of the recruitment demand;
Build effective relationships with internal stakeholders;
Develop innovative recruitment strategies and drive data-driven decisions;
Taking part and/or take ownership in Recruitment projects, like interview quality, candidate experience and diversity.
You will work closely together with a professional recruitment organization consisting of Recruiters, Talent Sourcers, Operational support and an Employer branding specialist.

Your team
As driven individuals within the corporate functions department we do whatever it takes to ensure Accenture’s success – every day. This department bundles together specialists from HR, Finance, Marketing + Communications, Legal and IT services to support our thriving consultants.
Your role entails being the internal consultant within our consultancy bureau: Based on your expertise, you will advise and help guide, support and improve our end-to-end business. Through modern tools, innovative practices and your expertise we take a different approach to modern-day obstacles – resulting in the new optimal outcomes.
It may seem like a constant struggle to fulfill the strategic roadmaps of our clients, partners and colleagues – but we can assure you that the result we achieve together is totally worth it.

Your background

You have successfully obtained a relevant Bachelor or Master degree
You have approximately 2 years of recruiting experience
Fluent in Dutch and English (mandatory)
You are able to build and manage strong relationships internally and externally
You have an ambitious mindset aimed at driving service excellence and continuous improvement
Our offer
Accenture is an incredible place to work - and keep learning. By joining us, you’ll become part of a global company with a world-class brand and reputation. Besides the work we do for our clients, we’re really proud of our vibrant, diverse workplace culture: we believe in openness and honesty, fairness and equality, common sense and realism. We want to get to know the real you and help you explore and grow - whatever it is you're great at. So you will always have lots of learning opportunities (formal and informal) to improve your role-specific skills and expertise.

Besides our high-profile, challenging projects and our nurturing work environment, we offer excellent employee benefits, including:
A flexible transport arrangement that suits your personal situation (electric car or bicycle, flexible budget including NS business card)
An expense allowance
Discount on Accenture shares
The possibility to work 4 x 9 hours a week
Interested?

We're looking for a Customer Success Manager for our office in Amsterdam, the Netherlands. The Customer Success Manager will be working strategically and practically with the customers and be their primary point of contact throughout their customer lifecycle with Leadfamly. We are looking for a team player who wants to become part of one of Europe’s fastest growing SaaS (Software as a Service) companies, and join our growth story.


At Leadfamly, we are creating a brand new marketing category; gamification.

We are the world’s leading marketing gamification platform. We provide companies around the world with the best chance to win the battle for their customers’ attention and loyalty. With campaign pages as the end product, gamification as the mechanism, and memorable experiences as the outcome, we ensure that our customers cut through the traditional marketing noise.


We’re playing to win with our clients. And we’re currently doing so with 500+ of Europe’s largest companies in a wide array of verticals by helping their marketers and business leaders create strong business results faster.


We are on a growth journey:

Within one year of setting up the company, we had our first 100 customers.
One year later, every second someone in the world was playing a Leadfamly game.
By December of that year it had doubled
On our busiest day that year we saw 1.2 million people playing our games – that’s within just
24hrs!
In one year alone we had 2 billion seconds of game play on our platform.


All this interaction and engagement makes our platform one of the highest potential marketing platforms in the world, and we need your skills and expertise in order to achieve our goal of making Gamification Marketing an indispensable part of the marketing stack.


About the position

We are looking for a conceptually strong and structured profile to join our global team of skilled and experienced Customer Success Managers. As their closest relation in Leadfamly throughout their customer lifecycle you will be teaching and empowering them to get the most out of the LeadFamly platform. You will be responsible for a successful and ongoing use of the platform from onboarding onwards as well as strategic advising the customers within marketing gamification.


Leadfamly is a tool typically owned by the marketing department, meaning it is key that you have experience within Digital Marketing, preferably from an agency, alternatively a marketing software company where you hold a position within digital project management, customer success or a similar structured, customer-oriented position.


Responsibilities & tasks

Independently manage a portfolio of clients across a range of different branches
Follow customers from when they have signed and support them through their onboarding
Manage the customer relationship throughout the lifecycle by monitoring health scores, satisfaction levels and customer engagement
Be in daily contact with customers by proactively reaching out and initiate dialogues on the use of the Leadfamly tool
Advise and assist our customers to make game-campaigns that create value for them and their customers
Monitor their successes to gather and distribute stories from our customers internally and externally
Provide solutions to customer complaints/issues in a timely and professional manner
Actively collaborating with other business functions internally (i.e. Account Management, Support, Sales) when organizing customer meetings and setting clients' goals
Handle the onboarding of new customers
Plan and carry out conceptual and inspirational workshops with customers


Skills & experience needed

Native in Dutch (written and verbally) and professional in English
3-5+ years of relevant business experience from a marketing agency position or other extroverted marketing consulting roles
Structured, proactive and service-oriented mindset with time management skills, organisational skills and attention to detail
Conceptually strong within the digital marketing space, including SoMe and E-commerce
Experience working with e-mail marketing/ ESP's and/ or working with a CRM
Experience with/understanding of automated retention programs
Agility and openness to the transitional culture of a start-up-minded company


What we offer

For the right candidate, we offer a position in a fast-growing company with offices in Denmark, the UK, Finland, the Netherlands, and Germany, with ambitious plans to expand further. We offer attractive and flexible terms of employment that will reflect your qualifications and results.


At Leadfamly, you will become part of a highly result-driven company with creative ideas and sky-high growth ambitions. We are backed by Vækstpartner Kapital, who are focused on investing in international growth and expansion, and we need your skills and expertise to scale further. We work in a social environment and expect for you to put your ideas freely forward, test them in real life, and learn from your experiences.


If you have any questions regarding Leadfamly or the position, feel free to contact our HR team and people@leadfamly.com. We process applications on an on-going basis and are looking to occupy the position as soon as possible.

Why Cisco
At Cisco, each person brings their unique talents to work as a team and make a difference
Yes, our technology changes the way the world works, lives, plays and learns, but our edge comes from our people
We connect everything – people, process, data and things – and we use those connections to change our world for the better

We benefit everyone - We do all of this while striving for a culture that empowers every person to be the difference, at work and in our communities

Job Title: Engineering Manager – Global Payments, Customer Domain, Group Digital, Ingka Group
Job Description:
ABOUT THE ROLE


IKEA is super busy growing a modern global digital hub in the beautiful Amsterdam location. This is your opportunity to get in early and have a big impact. You’ll hire your own engineering team and join with the other local leaders to shape the growth of Amsterdam together.


The team you’ll build up will be within Financial Services. Around the globe we would like customers to be able to apply and pay later for products they wish to buy from IKEA. Importantly we’ll be doing it with the strong IKEA culture and value set driving our approach. The opportunity here is enormous not only for IKEA but for you in terms of the challenges at scale that you’ll need to solve for a large successful iconic company.

Financial Services lives within Global Payments alongside Online Payments and Instore Payments. Basically, if you’re paying for something at IKEA it’s enabled by the services we build, own, and operate. You will join five other Engineering Managers as part of the complete Global Payments leadership group which is spread across Amsterdam, and Malmo.

ABOUT YOU

You know what it is to be a successful Engineering Manager having performed in this role previously. You’ve also been a hands-on engineer in your career, and you understand the most important core principles of this craft.


What type of leader are we looking for?

Highly collaborative working within your team and across teams.
Experience scaling up teams and growing engineering maturity to high standards.
Knows how to lead well within a multi-location team and group.
Able to achieve impactful results while dealing with complexity and constraints; navigating a large business with many stakeholders, goals, and priorities.

You inspire others through a bias to action and experimentation.

You listen as well as you speak.

Your time spent coding maybe beneficial for your team however you know how to evaluate opportunity cost before doing so.

You’ve managed budgets.
You know what it is to build, own, and operate services; you know how to fail well.
Payment knowledge is a strong advantage, but not a deal-breaker.
WHY SHOULD YOU JOIN IKEA?

Joining IKEA gives you an opportunity to take part in this unique and amazing company culture with values such as Simplicity, Togetherness but also Caring for people and planet. Our strong values are underpinning and guiding us in our everyday work life, in discussions, decisions and activities. Combine this with our vision “to create a better everyday life for the many people” – for customers, but also for our co-workers and the people who work at our suppliers, means that you will work and thrive in a truly people (and planet) positive work environment.

LET´S CONNECT

This position is located in Amsterdam, The Netherlands. We are open to relocation.

If you have any questions regarding the process or you have difficulties with applying, feel free to contact Veronika Grollova at veronika.grollova@ingka.com.

We are very much looking forward to receiving your application for this exciting position!

At Certara, we accelerate medicines to patients by partnering with life science innovators.
In the past 6 years, over 90% of companies that received new drug approvals by the FDA used our software or services. Our integrated and proprietary end-to-end platform with bio-simulation, regulatory science, and market access solutions combined with our strong team of scientists and subject matter experts enable our clients to have:
informed decision-making & reduced clinical trial burden
higher R&D productivity
improved patient outcomes & increased patient access to medicines
accelerated regulatory approval
Certara is a global team that fosters and nurtures a diverse and inclusive culture. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. The collective sum of our individual differences, life experiences, knowledge, innovation, self-expression, and unique capabilities and talent represents a significant part of our culture, our reputation and our achievement.
Together with our partners, we use bio-simulation and technology-enabled services to transform drug discovery and development across all therapeutic areas and innovative therapies.
Duties
Conduct secondary research, including reviewing epidemiological, clinical, and economic studies, compiling information from research databases, analyzing sales information and market trends of life science products and services being evaluated
Design scientific literature search strategies (systematic and targeted reviews) and develop search protocols
Create data extraction sheets for epidemiological, clinical, and economic outcomes data; review data extraction performed by analysts and interns
Conduct primary research, develop discussion guides, recruit respondents and conduct interviews
Analyze data and synthesize relevant information (qualitative/quantitative) from primary and secondary research systematically
Develop or participate in the development of Certara EVA products under Project Director’s supervision, including: systematic and targeted literature reviews, briefing documents, study reports, global value dossiers, HTA submissions, health economic and outcomes analyses, peer reviewed publications
Coordinate and manage communication with clients: schedule meetings, draft/send meeting minutes, present findings, update project timelines, coordinate timely delivery of documents and submit invoicing requests, provide updates to client
Contribute to the development and review of scientific content of proposals, participate in communication with prospective clients
Provide leadership, oversight and guidance to analysts and interns
Key competencies
Strong qualitative, quantitative and analytical skills
Dedication to detail and precision
Clear, coherent, and insightful written analysis in reports
Strong organizational skills
Diligent follow-up of project tasks to keep them on schedule
Skill in negotiation and interpersonal communication
Tact and discretion in dealing with clients
Ability to work independently
Willing and cooperative attitude when working with others internally and externally
Ability to follow directions and adhere to our methodology and formatting style
Growing expertise in use of software for communications, analysis, presentations and databases
Growing expertise in pricing and reimbursement of drugs, medical devices and diagnostics in key global markets
Requirements / Skill level / training / knowledge
MSc level degree in life sciences, health economics (HEOR), pharmaceutical services or similar disciplines AND 3+ years of experience is required

Who we are and what we do

SurveyMonkey (Nasdaq: SVMK), is a leader in agile software solutions for customer experience, market research, and survey feedback. Our platform empowers more than 20 million active users to analyze and act on feedback from employees, customers, website and app users, and market research respondents. SurveyMonkey's products, enterprise solutions, and integrations enable more than 345,000 organizations to deliver better customer experiences, increase employee retention , and unlock growth and innovation. Ultimately, SurveyMonkey's vision is to raise the bar for human experiences by amplifying individual voices.

What we're looking for

SurveyMonkey is looking for an experienced Account-Based Marketing (ABM) professional who can take on the role of planning, executing and measuring on programs that drive new business and accelerate existing opportunities with targeted accounts and prospects. Acting as quarterback between sales and marketing, this person will develop and execute on a plan which focuses entirely on 1-1 and 1-few tactics, all with the goal to drive growth in our targeted accounts.

You will:

Plan & Collaborate

Gather industry and account intelligence and gain a thorough understanding of the buyer personas and journey needed to develop account profiles
Work closely together with your cross-functional partners in sales to determine gaps and missing information of key personas in the strategic accounts
Together with the wider Demand Generation team, you develop lead generation and pipeline accelerating programs for these specifically targeted accounts
The tactics you use are highly personalized and have a 1:1 and 1: few approach
You engage all the right stakeholders in your plans upfront to ensure results are achieved

Execute & Communicate

Execute on integrated marketing programs that include email, live & virtual events, webinars, social promotion and others to drive new acquisition opportunities and expansion within targeted accounts
Enable your partners in the sales team on the value and content of these integrated marketing programs
Build, nurture and pursue your database of contacts until they are qualified by creating a personalized email programs supported by relevant content
Create landing pages and emails in HubSpot to drive lead capture for your programs

Measure & Improve

Recurringly analyze and report on the results of campaigns & optimize the approach based on findings
Be the ambassador and share learnings of program/collaboration wins and learnings with the relevant cross-functional teams


You have:

BA/BS degree or equivalent work experience
3-5 years of experience in B2B demand generation
Able to leverage ABM and digital marketing technologies such as HubSpot and Terminus
Excellent communication skills, both written and oral
Goal & detail oriented, structured, process led, with an analytical mindset.
Good project management and organizational skills with strong attention to detail
A proactive collaborator with a solution-oriented mindset
A self-starter who gets joy out of working with multiple cross-functional teams
Thorough understanding of digital marketing strategies (inbound/outbound)
Experience in rolling out targeted campaigns to generate & nurture leads and accelerate growth


What we offer our employees

SurveyMonkey is a place where the curious come to grow. By embedding inclusion into our processes, policies, and culture for our 1,000+ employees across North America, Europe, and APAC, we're building a workplace where people of every background can thrive. We've won multiple awards and received recognition for our forward-looking policies, including extended parental and bereavement leave, vendor benefits standards, and Take 4 sabbaticals.

SurveyMonkey was recognized by Great Place to Work® and FORTUNE as a top workplace in 2018 and 2019, and the company has also won numerous awards as a leader in global survey software, including being named among CNBC's Disruptor 50 and the Forbes Cloud 100.


Our commitment to an inclusive workplace

SurveyMonkey is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. Accommodations are available for applicants with disabilities.

Description

About Cleeng

Cleeng is the Subscriber Retention Management Company. We help our clients create a long-life relationship with their subscribers by providing predictive analytics. Our solutions are used by market-leading brands like Sinclair Broadcasting Group, CBC, Optus Sport, and rapidly scaling Entertainment brands like BroadwayHD, MXGP, CHL. Cleeng’s fully SaaS solution is built for scalability, flexibility, robustness, and innovation, and today, we manage 15 Million users on our platform.

Working at Cleeng is rewarding, fun, and challenging. We thrive on innovation. If you want to join a fast-growing business and make a real contribution to developing the ecosystem of subscription, come join our team and help shape the future of video consumption

Currently, for our team, we’re looking for an agile, and experienced Demand Generation Manager to realize our ambitions for revenue expansion / accelerate our global expansion.

Responsibilities
Your mission?
Ensure we reach - and capture quality leads, while promoting our innovative positioning on the Media & Entertainment industry worldwide. If you’re passionate about building and executing marketing programs that will provide sustainable growth, with a product/platform that helps broadcasters and Entertainment brands to manage and retain their subscribers, this might be the opportunity for you.

You’ll be coordinating/leading a cross-functional team, consisting of sales, content, product- and digital marketers, while part of our Marketing department. Our mission, as a department, is to ensure that The Media & Entertainment industry get to know the value that Cleeng delivers. You directly contribute to that mission by driving MQLs, sales opportunities, direct signs up, and the many touchpoints that make up a buying journey.

As a Demand Generation Lead at Cleeng you will:
Define, optimize and execute on (new) prospect acquisition channels aligned with our business goals (Enterprise and non Enterprise targets within the Media and Entertainment segment)
Grow our reach across all channels, including SEO, PPC, and inbound marketing
Develop a deep understanding of customers, products, and their conversion journey
Define and leverage a content strategy to reach the right part of the sales funnel at the right time.
Work closely with our Sales team to drive, optimize, and improve the quality of sales opportunities
Leverage marketing automation and lead management to streamline, automate and measure tasks and workflows
Measure, analyze, and report performance
Enable your team to deliver amazing work, by providing guidance, context, and the right environment to perform
Must Have Requirements

4+ Years in SaaS demand generation experience
Experience in leading/coordinating a (cross-functional) team
Extensive experience in the development of smart campaigns and execution of email marketing, social advertising, content strategies, SEO, and paid digital
Strong reporting capabilities with the ability to track performance and associated spend for both short-cycle self-serve customers, as well as complex sales-assisted deals
Extensive knowledge of Hubspot or leading automated marketing platform
Experience in the OTT industry
Your spoken and written English is near-native
Nice To Have Requirements
What would really knock our socks off:
Experience in a scaling startup environment (Series B, and beyond)
Being strategic yet hand-off when it comes to executing strategies
We offer

A massive amount of freedom and trust while your contributions help fuel our leadership and grow Cleeng for years to come
A true opportunity to invest in your personal growth and development in a fast-growing company and a booming industry
The opportunity to learn about Subscriber Retention Management by playing a crucial role in the Media & Entertainment space and serving the world’s most successful companies
The opportunity to work with an international team, headquartered in The Netherlands, with a presence in the USA
A modern recently renovated office environment optimized for comfort and collaboration, stocked with the latest tech*
The opportunity to work with inspiring colleagues in young and relaxed company culture.
Dear Applicant, please note that due to COVID-19, our team is completely remote (included the interview process) in all locations until we truly feel that working from the office is a super safe and risk-free solution for our colleagues. As our Cleengers’s health and protection are so important for us the travel opportunities and global in-person team building events are on hold for a while.

Languages English Education Master Experience 3+ years

As a Distribution Development Manager CEE, you will be responsible for driving sales growth of IDEXX LPD Products in the direct markets and via distributors across the assigned countries within Central & Eastern Europe.
You will Actively promote all IDEXX products, in CEE markets by establishing partnerships where necessary and interacting with new and existing clients.
You will Establish the strategic CEE sales direction & provide feedback to ensure implementation and achievement of business commitments for revenues, gross margin, operating expenses, and customer service
You will Deliver monthly, quarterly, and annual sales goals, within an expense budget reporting on a regular basis through the use of analytical metrics on productivity and historical trending
You will also Provide input to sales, marketing, and product development organization on progress, milestones, new ideas, and roadblocks to achieving sales goals, where relevant
You will be working with customer and product marketing and other functions to support advancements in strategic direction, new product definition and sales programs, product positioning, promotional initiatives, and sales force automation tools
Analyze the characteristics and trends of the market and help define customer needs for new or modified services
Fosters a culture for cooperation, best practice sharing, sales innovation and strong individual commitment to sales excellence
Expand the. distribution network in the CEE market.
Establish sales/marketing plans for each country with measurable goals to achieve sales target
Support distributors in major local exhibitions/tradeshow
Interact with the distribution team through regular “co-rides”, conference calls, local team meeting,s and other sales meetings where relevant to maximize sales effectiveness and territory potential
Organize and participate in and/or facilitate sales/product training for the CEE region.
What You Will Need to Succeed?
Degree level preferred, with a veterinary/agricultural background. DVM a strong plus
5-8 years of related business and sales experience required (preferably in medical devices or diagnostics environment) with a proven sales track record
Solid experience presenting at Congresses and Workshops
1-2 years of distributor experience
Why IDEXX?
We’re proud of the work we do, because our work matters. An innovation leader in every industry we serve, we follow our Purpose and Guiding Principles to help pet owners worldwide keep their companion animals healthy and happy, to ensure safe drinking water for billions, and to help farmers protect livestock and poultry from diseases. We have customers in over 175 countries and a global workforce of over 9,000 talented people.

So, what does that mean for you? We enrich the livelihoods of our employees with a positive and respectful work culture that embraces challenges and encourages learning and discovery. At IDEXX, you will be supported by competitive compensation, incentives, and benefits while enjoying purposeful work that drives improvement.

Let’s pursue what matters together.
IDEXX values a diverse workforce and workplace and strongly encourages women, people of color, LGBT individuals, people with disabilities, members of ethnic minorities, foreign-born residents, and veterans to apply.

Applicants will not be discriminated against because of race, color, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, religion, national origin, citizenship status, disability, ancestry, marital status, veteran status, medical condition, or any protected category prohibited by local, state, or federal laws.

Our support teams play a really important role at Design Bridge, and we're currently looking for an experienced bilingual (Dutch and English) Accounts Payable Specialist to join our busy Amsterdam Studio. Reporting to our UK-based European Finance Controller, you will be responsible for day-to-day operational finance tasks including the Accounts Receivable Ledger, Bank reconciliations and Company Credit cards for the team in Amsterdam, as well as ensuring the completion of finance data including the Payables Ledger, bank and credit card transactions, and taking on other ad hoc finance projects as needed. Job Category
Customer Success Group
Job Details
MuleSoft is the leader in implementing API networks by connecting data, devices, and applications. Our Global Customer Support team is looking for talented individuals with a passion for researching and understanding complex technologies to help our team drive customer success with our products. We maintain an extremely high level of satisfaction across our customer base, and we take great pride in our operational efficiency as well as the solutions we provide to customers in every industry.
As an Escalation Specialist , you will play an important role in our overall support growth by ensuring the de-escalation of customer issues and the ongoing happiness of our customers. As part of the Customer Escalation Management (CEM) team within MuleSoft's Global Support organization, the Escalation Specialist’s main task is the support account management and resolve of high priority issues that arise within the existing escalation framework. This includes but is not limited to, monitoring unresolved critical and escalated cases, working very closely with MuleSoft Escalation Managers to help drive ownership and accountability both internally and externally, tracking and managing numerous support cases, and managing/maintaining accurate and thorough customer support records.

What You’ll Do
Complete product, business, and messaging training.
Familiarize yourself with the MuleSoft Global Support org, customers, and cross-functional stakeholders.
Proactively engage with the Customer Success org regarding customers with scheduled Go-Live activities that may be at risk of delay.
Guide cases to resolution via collaboration among the Technical Support, Engineering, and Product teams.
Maintain an open communication channel between MuleSoft and the customer on their overall satisfaction.
Ensure important cases and issues faced by the support team are effectively summarized and communicated with upper management and other departments as required.
Actively participate in team and departmental meetings by providing feedback on current day-to-day activity and recommendations for improvement.
Join customer conference calls to facilitate the discussions and provide escalation management during issues where more input and project organization is needed.
Develop processes, playbooks, templates, or tools as part of continuous internal improvement.
What You’ll Need to be Successful
Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Business or equivalent field/work experience
1-2 years customer or technical support experience
Passion for solving customer issues and a champion of great customer service
Ability to plan, organize, prioritize and independently solve problems seeking help when necessary
Strong project management skills
Ability to multi-task
Ability to successfully handle difficult customers and/or customer situations
Excellent communication (oral and written), interpersonal, and organizational skills
Ability to work independently and under management’s direction
Ability to work in a cross-functional team environment
Positive attitude
Customer empathy & a sense of urgency
About MuleSoft, a Salesforce Company
Our mission is to help organizations change and innovate faster by making it easy to connect the world’s applications, data, and devices. Companies like Spotify, McDonald’s, and Unilever rely on MuleSoft to stay agile, deliver faster, and make the most of their IT investment with API-led connectivity. Hiring exceptional people who want to build a great company together is our number one priority, and we’re committed to providing an equal opportunity workplace where everyone is supported and inspired to do their best work. We work tirelessly to build this culture, and we’re proud to have been named the #1 Top Workplace in the Bay Area and a best place to work 6 years in a row.

Salesforce, the Customer Success Platform and world's #1 CRM, empowers companies to connect with their customers in a whole new way. The company was founded on three disruptive ideas: a new technology model in cloud computing, a pay-as-you-go business model, and a new integrated corporate philanthropy model. These founding principles have taken our company to great heights, including being named one of Forbes’s “World’s Most Innovative Company” six years in a row and one of Fortune’s “100 Best Companies to Work For” nine years in a row. We are the fastest growing of the top 10 enterprise software companies, and this level of growth equals incredible opportunities to grow a career at Salesforce. Together, with our whole Ohana (Hawaiian for "family") made up of our employees, customers, partners and communities, we are working to improve the state of the world.

Atlassian is continuing to hire with all interviewing and on-boarding done virtually due to COVID-19. All new and existing Atlassians will continue to work from home until it’s safe to return to our offices. When our offices re-open, we will provide the choice to work from home or return to work in an office unless a job requirement makes it necessary for a particular role to be performed at an Atlassian office.
Are you an experienced Customer Success Manager in search of that next challenge? This could be the role for you!
Customer Success Managers at Atlassian are responsible for maintaining relationships with key customers. Following their purchase, we meet regularly with customers to better understand their business needs, guide them through onboarding, and provide input into their implementation planning. We work strategically with customers on an ongoing basis to ensure that they are consistently achieving their goals and realizing value. We serve as an internal liaison and voice of the customer to bring contextual feedback into Atlassian regarding how customers use our products, customer requests for improvement, and insights into their overall experience. We monitor customer health and craft success plans to further drive their continued adoption of our product, all while collaborating with the larger account team.
More about you
You are passionate about the success of your customers, the value they receive from the solution you helped create, and you enjoy building strong partnerships. Adept at listening, documenting, translating, and conveying customer feedback to internal teams (Sales, Product Management, etc.). You possess the ability to learn, collaborate, communicate, and configure our product capabilities to meet the customer's needs. You are capable of researching and devising solutions based on your expertise, but able to solicit and incorporate input from other teams. You are an independent, self-motivated, results-focused individual. You strive to improve customer success practice through self-study, elevating industry standards, data analysis, and practical operational changes. You are focused on improving broader customer experience and having a visible global impact on processes, products, and teams.
On your first day, we'll expect you to have:
5+ years of experience working with customers adopting SaaS solutions
2+ years of Enterprise Customer Success Management experience
Project management and coordination skills
Customer monitoring and management skills
Experience helping an organization adopt an Atlassian product or similar
Proven aptitude for learning new technologies and understanding how to utilize them in a customer-facing environment
Demonstrated ability to take customer insights from the field and inspire changes to the business
Experience in handling high visibility escalations
Experience in communicating with a technical audience
Analytical skills to identify and articulate beneficial themes derived from customer data
Experience engaging closely with Sales, Product Management, and other teams
Confidence and motivation to creatively tackle problems, self-learn, and the ability to pivot and adapt quickly to change
It would be great, but not required, if you have:
Atlassian product experience with Trello or Access
Prior development or scripting skills
Salesforce and Tableau experience
Integration Products experience
Experience collaboratively brainstorming and developing strategic recommendations for how to improve post-sales processes (Implementation, Customer Success, etc.)
Ability to optimally communicate as the internal specialist with customers at an executive level on in-depth technical details, progress, and next steps
Experience in technical support, software services, and/or system administration for a large end-user community
Fluency in German or French
More about our team
Atlassian Customer Success partners with our customers to improve the value they realize in using our solutions through a high-touch engagement approach. We engage during onboarding and adoption, establish good relationships, and work to proactively mitigate any risks customers may encounter on their journey. We promote best practices and deliver insights back to the business.
More about our benefits
Whether you work in an office or a distributed team, Atlassian is highly collaborative and yes, fun! To support you at work (and play) we offer some fantastic perks: ample time off to relax and recharge, flexible working options, five paid volunteer days a year for your favourite cause, an annual allowance to support your learning & growth, unique ShipIt days, a company paid trip after five years and lots more.
More about Atlassian
Creating software that empowers everyone from small startups to the who’s who of tech is why we’re here. We build tools like Jira, Confluence, Bitbucket, and Trello to help teams across the world become more nimble, creative, and aligned—collaboration is the heart of every product we dream of at Atlassian. From Amsterdam and Austin, to Sydney and San Francisco, we’re looking for people who want to write the future and who believe that we can accomplish so much more together than apart. At Atlassian, we’re committed to an environment where everyone has the autonomy and freedom to thrive, as well as the support of like-minded colleagues who are motivated by a common goal to: Unleash the potential of every team.
Additional Information
We believe that the unique contributions of all Atlassians is the driver of our success. To make sure that our products and culture continue to incorporate everyone's perspectives and experience we never discriminate on the basis of race, religion, national origin, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, or marital, veteran, or disability status.
All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

T he Commercial Legal team delivers innovative, trusted and world-class legal services to advance and protect Salesforce's interests while creating a fulfilling work environment for our legal family.


Responsibilities:
The main focus of the role is to assist the indirect business in drafting and negotiating reseller agreements and related documents across EMEA, working with local counsel as needed to support the business, as well as privacy and product counsels and security experts.
The role includes a ‘subject matter expert’ role to ensure scalability, through coordination across the EMEA Commercial Legal team and with the HQ-based Alliances Legal team.
Collaborate with the Reseller’s legal representative as needed to facilitate completion of RFPs and other requests for information of the end client, as well as to put in place NDAs to ensure confidentiality.
Partner with the Indirect Office and Partner Operations to ensure compliance with internal policies and procedures.
Partner with the extended support teams to support and develop processes for contract and knowledge base management, order processing and revenue recognition.
Conduct various legal projects and other duties as assigned, including collaboration with outside counsels when necessary.
Participate in cross-regional team projects.
Assist in localising US templates and maintain library of template forms, negotiated provisions and other relevant information.
Help in developing and updating training materials and deliver training sessions to the sales teams.
Experience/Skills Required:
Qualified in a major European jurisdiction.
Substantive experience in IT and Contract Law. Knowledge of data protection law (including GDPR). Knowledge of / experience in distribution contracts and/or competition law will be a plus.
Excellent command of English, both written and oral. Fluency in other European languages is highly valued.
Excellent drafting and communication skills; detail oriented.
Strong analytical and creative problem-solving skills applied to legal, business and operational issues.
Demonstrated ability to work independently, and track record of taking initiative and multi-tasking whilst prioritizing and managing deadlines in a fast-based and demanding work environment.
Client-oriented (both internal and external). Committed and with a desire to work in a high-energy, sales-oriented culture and the ability to adapt and think out of the box in a quickly changing business environment with a large volume of deals.
Ability to work well with virtual, global and cross-functional teams across cultures. Team spirited and collaborative attitude.
Intellectual curiosity and interest in the technology.
Authenticity, and enthusiasm.

WE PUSH THE BOUNDARIES OF MEDICINE.

LEAPING FORWARD TO MAKE PEOPLE SMILE

Everything we do at KKI, is rooted in the idea of leaping forward to make people smile. We are committed to innovation, for the benefit of the patients who count on us to support them. From medicines for rare and underserved diseases, to the support families need when facing a life-changing diagnosis – our team is proud of all we deliver, but also humble in knowing how much more needs to be done. By listening to patient stories, we gain a better understanding of the obstacles patients and their families face – so we can work to better meet their unique needs. The real proof of our impact is in the smiles we see on patients’ faces, when we have helped answer a need, or improved their well-being through our work. While the journey is not easy, it is one that is filled with purpose.


Pharmacovigilance Operations Manager

Kyowa Kirin Pharma B.V. Amsterdam

Netherlands


**This role can be based in our Galashiels, Marlow or Amsterdam office.**

As a member of the Global Case Management Team, responsible for case processing, reconciliation, vendor management and oversight, in compliance with Global Pharmacovigilance Regulations and Kyowa Kirin procedures.

Provides Safety resources to functional groups in support of Global Pharmacovigilance projects.

Support Global Head of Case Management in increasing the Team’s effectiveness and profile within Kyowa Kirin.


RESPONSIBILITIES:

Proactively providing case processing activities as requested to ensure high-quality individual case safety reports of adverse events reported following the use of Kyowa Kirin’s products promptly.
Provides accurate individual case reports for submission to regulatory authorities, partner companies and participating clinical trial investigators in compliance with the regulatory timeframes for reporting.
Participate in regular meetings with internal and external stakeholders including case processing vendors for effective issue resolution.
Maintain oversight of vendor activities including routine review of cases, reconciliation and monthly review meetings.
Serves as a member of project teams. Communicates timelines, delivering quality and timely input to meet the needs of the project team and informs the project team on the status of activities and issues.
Maintain awareness of changes to regulatory guidance documents, requirements and state-or-the-art pharmacovigilance processes and make recommendations leading to operationalize and improve the effectiveness and profile of the department.
Revises and maintains processes and procedures for drug safety in compliance with regulatory requirements and company standards.
Provide training to case processing vendor.
Review, revise and approve Change Controls, Safety Management Plans, PV Agreements, SOPs, Working Instructions and other guidance documents, as needed, concerning the Global Case Management.
Support Pharmacovigilance Audits and Inspections as needed concerning the Global Case Management function.
Any other activity that may reasonably be required.


QUALIFICATIONS:

Health care professional qualification or life sciences degree (e.g. Ph.D., Pharm.D., MPH, or R.N.) preferred with a minimum of 3 years of relevant pharmacovigilance experience.
Strong knowledge of pharmaceutical/biotech industry and the drug development process
Knowledge of relevant FDA, EU, PMDA, Health Canada and ICH guidelines, initiatives and regulations governing both clinical trial and post-marketing safety environments
Expertise in MedDRA and WHO-DO coding dictionary
Experience in managing vendors, alliance partners and CROs is preferred
Experience with all PV operational activity required to ensure efficiency, cost effectiveness and compliance across the product life cycle
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills and excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
Strong scientific writing skills and experience presenting scientific and medical data in verbal and written format.
Ability to interact effectively with people of multiple disciplines (e.g. Safety, Clinical Development, Medical Affairs, Clinical Operations, and Regulatory) and cultures both within and outside the company on a global basis.
Proficiency in current safety systems (Argus) and MedDRA
Skilled in Microsoft Office applications (Word, PowerPoint and Excel).
KKI Core Competencies: Results Oriented, Sense of Urgency and Flawless in Execution.
Resolution focused
Ability to understand the principles of the team working and be a member of a high performing team
Driving tasks to completion
Ability to handle multiple assignments simultaneously
Ability to effectively manage and measure work
Strong project management skills
Attention to detail, organisational and problem-solving skills
Strong interpersonal and communication skills and ability to interface effectively with multinational teams in a multicultural environment
Ability to work under pressure whilst still meeting departmental and Company timelines.
Excellent communication, presentation and negotiation skills with emphasis on building consensus.


BENEFITS:

In return for your talent, we will provide support through smart working, adopting best practice, deploying the latest technology and ongoing personal development. Plus:

Competitive salary
Bonus
Pension scheme

To meet the expectations of our patients and to truly deliver on our Commitment to Life, we are continually looking for people who embrace this spirit. We are committed to providing a culture that offers both inspiration and reward – in terms of compensation and in work satisfaction. And in turn, we want people who’ll bring their unique ideas and diverse approaches, while also aligning to our ultimate goal of making people smile. If this sounds like a company that aligns with your values, we’d love for you to join us in our efforts.

Job Title
Channel Sales Director
Mastercard is a global technology company in the payments industry. Our mission is to connect and power an inclusive, digital economy that benefits everyone, everywhere by making transactions safe, simple, smart, and accessible. Using secure data and networks, partnerships and passion, our innovations and solutions help individuals, financial institutions, governments, and businesses realize their greatest potential.

Our decency quotient, or DQ, drives our culture and everything we do inside and outside of our company. With connections across more than 210 countries and territories, we are building a sustainable world that unlocks priceless possibilities for all.


RiskRecon, a Mastercard company, is looking for a channel sales director will take primary responsibility for producing incremental revenue and enabling key personnel at their assigned set of resellers. They will own the entire sales cycle, including recruiting resellers, enabling them, developing customer target lists, and driving marketing and sales lead gen efforts. They will team with RiskRecon and partner’s sales team to measure progress against agreed goals and ensure seamless end user contract fulfillment.


Responsibilities:

Meet agreed outcomes for your territory, including recruiting, sales and technical enablement, customer meetings created, qualified leads, pipeline, new logo revenue, and upsells
Co-develop with each partner an outcomes-based business plan with OKRs, activities, and owners clearly identified
Identify, recruit and develop new resellers that meet RiskRecon target profile(s) or identified by local RiskRecon sales team
Qualify all inbound prospect reseller inquiries
Collaborate with RiskRecon field marketing and sales teams to deliver marketing events/programs/campaigns that create interest and awareness within each partner’s customer base
Effectively position and communicate RiskRecon’s value proposition, competitive differentiation, capabilities and use cases to existing and potential new partners. Identify and help create tools and education programs to improve partner enablement.
Maintain and communicate progress toward goals with frequently updated dashboards management reports. For example, target recruiting lists, resellers signed, enablement level (sales, technical), deal registrations, partner-led pipeline and revenue produced
Manage the day to day relationship, escalations and issue resolution with all assigned resellers
Requirements:

Strong background in high-tech channel sales in an enterprise sales environment
Sales-oriented personality with track record of driving partner-led revenue
Experience with and desire to be part of young, high growth company
Strong presentation and communication skills.
Ability to wear many hats and successfully balance time demands from many partners
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, high-growth environment
Master's degree preferred or equivalent experience
. Knowledge of the cyber security or risk management space preferred


This role can be based in different European locations

As a Project Manager in the Commercial team, you will manage entire project lifecycle from kickoff to implementation under the Global Commercial Systems program partnering closely with IT Project Management.
The IDEXX Global Commercial Systems team is committed to delivering technology solutions to our internal Sales and Support teams striving for a personalized customer experience, ease of doing business with IDEXX while meeting productivity goals across our channels. We support nearly 2,800 users spread over 80 countries and 13 systems for our Companion Animal Group.
In this role:
You will build project plans (with Workstream Lead input) ensuring the necessary deliverables are included while meeting the strategic objectives of the business.
You will manage projects under the Commercial Systems program.
You will identify issues and risks and track effective mitigation strategies.
You will identify opportunities to improve and streamline processes both within the PMO and external partners within the organization.
You will coordinate with various business areas staffing of the projects.
You will manage project stakeholders: core team, workstream leads and others.
You will coordinate activities and ensures effective communication within the project team.
You will lead meetings and participant communications to drive decisions and action items.
You will provide for effective escalation and resolution of issues and concerns.
You will report regularly report to stakeholders on successes, concerns, milestones, resolved issues etc.
What does Success Look Like:
Day 1 – You are enthusiastic, willing to understand the role and absorb the content and eagerly jump in. You are self-sufficient and can organize meet-and-greet meetings.
Day 30 – you understand the program and begin management of enhancements and contributing to the reports.
Day 90 – you will run an enhancement initiative with oversight of your manager.
Day 365 – you will run all the enhancement initiatives under the program
What You Will Need to Succeed:
With a Bachelor’s degree or an equivalent, you have experience in managing projects in multi-disciplinary and cross-functional teams.
You have strong project management skills and knowledge portfolio and project management tools.
You have a strong understanding of business and its needs.
You are good at establishing and maintaining a high-level of customer trust and confidence.
You are an expert in setting and managing customers’ expectations
You can lead and motivate others without authority.
You are great solving problems.
You are detail-oriented and can understand the overall Program roadmap.
You excel at verbal and written communication, you can present and explain information in a way that establishes rapport, persuades others and gains understanding.
You are a team player with great interpersonal skills and can easily establish rapport with colleagues at all levels.
Why IDEXX:
We’re proud of the work we do, because our work matters. An innovation leader in every industry we serve, we follow our Purpose and Guiding Principles to help pet owners worldwide keep their companion animals healthy and happy, to ensure safe drinking water for billions, and to help farmers protect livestock and poultry from disease. We have customers in over 175 countries and a global workforce of over 9,000 talented people.
So, what does that mean for you? We enrich the livelihoods of our employees with a positive and respectful work culture that embraces challenges and encourages learning and discovery. At IDEXX, you will be supported by competitive compensation, incentives, and benefits while enjoying purposeful work that drives improvement.
Let’s pursue what matters together.
IDEXX values a diverse workforce and workplace and strongly encourages women, people of color, LGBT individuals, people with disabilities, members of ethnic minorities, foreign-born residents, and veterans to apply.

Are you an experienced customer care agent looking for a change of scenery? Do you need regular hours that also fit around your other commitments? or would you like to work flexible hours? Are you looking for the opportunity to be part of a team for the long-term? Interested in working in a fun, fast growing international company with big ambitions?

WE ARE NEWMOTION

We are Europe’s largest electric charging partner. We are on a mission to enable everybody to drive as many kilometres as possible powered by clean energy. We do that by offering large scale smart charging solutions to the masses. We contribute to a low-carbon world by making EV charging easy, accessible and smart, with the best expertise, highest quality & service.

WHAT YOU'LL BE IN CHARGE OF

Across Europe thousands of electric drivers are using NewMotion charging solutions whether that is our own charge points, our mobile apps and online platforms, or our charge cards giving them access to tens of thousands of charging stations. Our goal is to be on the other end of the line if our customers have questions. With the help of our out of hours call centre, 24/7 we are there for our customers to give them personal and professional advice on the products they are using.

Worried you don’t know much about electric driving? Don’t be! If you bring the customer care experience we will bring the training and support so in a short period of time you learn everything you need to know about our products and services. With a number of specific questions, you’re able to quickly discover which solution suits the customer best.

Our colleagues from Customer Care are true champions, they are the friendly voice for our customers everyday. The team manage to fulfill all of their responsibilities with professionalism and ease, and still have a cold beer with the team on a Friday afternoon. Sounds good? Then your new team waits.

THIS IS HOW YOU'LL CONTRIBUTE

First point of contact for our customers on the phone and by e-mail
Handling incoming requests and questions relating to our products and services
Analysing problems (sometimes technical ) and offering the right solution. If you can’t find the answer your technical support colleagues will help.
Communicating with different departments to analyse and solve any reoccuring errors you see removing the need for customers to contact us on that topic
Improving our customer service by identifying and implementing improvements in our processes to make electric driving even more attractive
Be the friendly voice as our business card to the outside world

THIS IS WHO YOU ARE

One to three years experience working in some kind of customer service role
World class communication skills both in Dutch and English (or French or German)
Living in or nearby Amsterdam
Tech savvy (bonus if you have been working in a technical industry)
Available for a minimum of 32 hours
Structured and accurate
Enthusiastic, proactive and able to work independently
Customer oriented, result driven and able to set priorities

BECOME PART OF THE CHANGE

Working at NewMotion means working in a fun, fast-growing international company with big ambitions.

By joining us, you will:

Contribute to a more sustainable future;
Become an expert in e-mobility;
Work in an open and transparent culture with colleagues from all over the world;
Receive a competitive salary that fits your experience + bonus;
Receive a MacBook;
Enjoy daily healthy lunches, prepared by our master chefs;
Develop your skills and expertise through several trainings. Besides this, you will receive a personal training budget and set your annual goals with your personal development plan;
Enjoy our fun weekly get-togethers (drinks), our annual winter and summer outing, NewMotion running team on the Dam tot Damloop, or any other event initiated by colleagues!

.

Bunge (NYSE: BG) is a world leader in sourcing, processing and supplying oilseed and grain products and ingredients. Founded in 1818, Bunge’s expansive network feeds and fuels a growing world, creating sustainable products and opportunities for more than 70,000 farmers and the consumers they serve across the globe. The company is headquartered in St. Louis, Missouri and has 25,000 employees worldwide who stand behind more than 350 port terminals, oilseed processing plants, grain facilities, and food and ingredient production and packaging facilities around the world.

In the role of Pricing Manager you will optimize Bunge’s B2B oils profitability, and act as a liaison to commercial functions. You’ll be joining and supporting a small and fairly new successful team of 4 Product Managers, but are also part of a broader closely collaborating commercial community such as sales, operations and trading. You’ll work on one of the most competitive and sustainable portfolio’s in the market with a focus to create understanding and awareness around the perceived value of B2B oils for more profitable pricing outcomes. You’ll be a key player in the development and execution of best practices, facilitating all aspects of the price discovery. In this role you will create and provide critical pricing insights, develop tools, monitor compliance and identify opportunities.

What makes this role so interesting?

As this is a completely new role you have the opportunity to shape it. As Pricing Manager you will work in close collaboration with the cross functional leadership team to drive strategic and tactical pricing decisions, therefor it is a key leadership role that will ask of you to act as change agent for the pricing function, co-develop multi-dimensional pricing strategies, and monitor the overall pricing performance and compliance. You’ll work in close collaboration with the Global Pricing Teams to share leading practices and adapt global strategies for the EMEA market.

Typical activities and responsibilities:

Develop a pricing strategy by channel / product lines to ensure maximum profitability while meeting sales volume and margin goals.
Develop and maintain a pricing structure for item pricing, based on sales volume, geography, channel, etc.
Analyze pricing data, including competitor pricing strategies and market trends, to provide management with information and policy/price change recommendations.
Drive the adoption of new pricing initiatives through the organization, acting as change agent to promote a Strategic Pricing Culture.
Work with various function to ensure accuracy of standard costs.
Development of tools for Sales Management to build price quotes and manage pricing execution.
Identify, prioritize, and execute pricing opportunities and initiatives, together with key stakeholders from Sales, Finance, and Marketing.
Monitor Sales compliance with pricing policies and structure; ensure consistency.
Work with Sales and Finance to develop pricing reports for Key Account Management.
Track pricing tools’ usage and performance, and adapt as necessary.
Provide guidance to contracting team for improvement opportunities of the quoting and contracting process.

What do we expect from you?

We are looking for a leader who has the skill to influence at all levels of the organization. A highly analytical collaborator with a commercial drive and a passion for the food industry. Ideally you understand our portfolio well and are adapted to a dynamical market like ours! Other than that you bring the following:
A Bachelor’s degree in Business, Finance or advanced mathematics5+ years related experience in a B2B environmentStrong communication, negotiation and presentation skills. Fluency in English is required and Dutch is preferredProven data management experience and strong analytical skills andBusiness & Financial Modeling, Value Proposition Development and Pricing Strategy / Pricing framework knowledgeProficiency in Microsoft Excel and Access. Knowledge of Tableau preferredAgribusiness pricing and Product / Portfolio Management knowledge preferred

What we offer
A key role in an organization with colleagues around the world, who are dedicated to improving the global Agri-Food value chain, one day at a time. Together, we bring food from where it’s produced to where it’s needed. We do this in an informal culture where an entrepreneurial mindset is valued. Being a global company with a constant need for innovation, a broad variety of challenges and development opportunities can support your long term career at Bunge. We value and stimulate development through, training, education and experience and offer effective/accredited tools and resources to support you in your journey.

If this description reflects your profile or ambition, we’re looking forward to see your application and motivation by hitting apply!

Your Opportunity

HVR Software is seeking a Human Resources Manager with exceptional people management and recruiting skills to support and scale our team. We are looking for a candidate with practical knowledge implementing and managing our human resources initiatives, as well as the ability to drive recruiting and people operations.

The right candidate for this role will work with an existing Director of HR in the United States to focus on culture, productivity, learning, and engagement, remote support, resolving employee issues, coaching executives and managers. If you love working with people and if you have 5+ years' progressive experience in HR, Recruiting and experience with diversity, equity and inclusion initiatives, we would love to talk to you about this position.

Responsibilities:
Assist in implementing HR strategies and platforms that support HVR business objectives across EMEA and APAC.
Serve as a business partner to hiring managers and executive leadership across EMEA and APAC.
Manage the recruitment process and evaluate staffing needs in EMEA & APAC, and collaborate with the HR team to create and implement recruiting strategies to address.
Responsible for nurturing a healthy office/remote culture and high employee engagement.
Partner with hiring managers on full-cycle recruitment to create job descriptions, post job openings, & recruit active/passive talent as needed.
Maintain employee records and HRIS updates as needed.
Manage the performance review platform and process, coaching managers as appropriate.
Collaborate with the HR Director to design and manage onboarding and termination processes companywide.
Assess training needs to implement and monitor training programs.
Collaborate with our HR Director to manage diversity, equity and inclusion objectives in all recruiting and retention efforts companywide.
Ensure legal compliance with appropriate laws and regulations in EMEA and APAC to mitigate risks and liability to the company.
Conduct annual benefits surveys to evaluate benefits plans that best serve the employee demographic and competitive recruiting market.
Create and implement employee relations policies to help increase employees' job satisfaction and performance.
Requirements:
5+ years of experience in human resources progressive roles.
Strong understanding of the recruitment/selection process, performance management, payroll, and other operational functions.
Knowledge of employment laws and regulations and Netherland specific employment laws is a must.
Highly organized and detail-oriented.
Excellent problem solving and communication skills.
Computer and tech literate. We use Slack, Zoom, Dropbox & Google Drive.
Bonus: Startup experience is a plus. Experience in an HR leadership position is a plus. Fluency in Dutch.

Travel

Travel Before Covid-19 we would say up to 15% travel was required with some weekends and holidays as needed with working from home or remotely representing the remaining 50%. Currently, we are 100% working from home and respond as required by law in a way that protects you and your family's health wherever possible.

This is a full-time position based in our Amsterdam, Netherlands office

HVR Software is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

HVR Software offers a competitive compensation package that includes base salary, medical, pension programs, and flexible time off and more. It's an exciting time to work at a quickly growing company. You can learn more about our company, and our products and services at www.hvr-software.com.

As a Reporting Analysts within our Customer Service EMEA team you will support the business by providing and maintaining quantitative reports and findings to problems that lead to steer the business.

The successful Reporting Analyst is able to work independently by using their experience in data collection, data preparation, data analysis and visualization to generate reports, KPI definitions and insights when applicable.

They collaborate with peers in their craft and support initiatives for data quality and stability, as well as maintaining tables & workflows.

The analysts are able to prioritize tasks and communicate results based on business needs in collaboration with their manager, team and stakeholders.

B. Responsible

Work independently with limited guidance of Analytics Manager / TL or business stakeholder on data collection and preparation
Use past experience and seek for help in complex scenarios to translate business problems into data stories
Deliver easy to understand analysis or reports from clearly specified and prioritised business topics, request tickets and/or projects
Maintain key reports, metrics and workflows running within their scope
By collaborating with teams and peers be able to communicate results and outcomes clearly to stakeholders
Communicate effectively, candidly, collaboratively, and challenge constructively to create rapport and establish trust
Actively participate in business and/or analytics team activities (standup, planning meeting, retrospectives)
Use previous knowledge and experience on data analysis and visualization to answer business questions in the most efficient way
Awareness and understanding of experimentation culture, process and results interpretation
Awareness of statistical models used within their scope
Familiarity with the larger data ecosystem at Booking and understanding of how it relates to the data
Collaboration and expectation to ask for support from other roles and seniors within their area
Flexibility in adopting new approaches and expanding technical competencies when a more efficient way presents itself

B. Skilled

1 - 5 years of relevant experience in the field
Driven and results oriented personality
Open to feedback and always looking for ways to improve own performance
Able to understand details while keeping an eye on the bigger picture
Analytical and curious mindset
Strong interpersonal skills
Open and friendly attitude
Knowledge and experience on data analysis, data visualization and data collection
Knowledge and experience using data analysis and visualization tools (e.g: tableau, data studio, powerbi, mixpanel, etc)
Knowledge and awareness of at least one data analysis language (e.g: R, SQL, Python, etc)

B. Offered

We are a performance-based company that offers career advancement and competitive salary plus bonus. We also offer what we call the “Booking Deal” with other competitive perks and benefits.

In this position, you will be able to grow, both technically and commercially. We have an internal process in place where you’ll be offered the possibility to move within the Reporting community to tackle new challenges as your skill set evolves, while making a great contribution and impact to our success.

Overview:

The primary purpose of this position is to manage assigned accounts while increasing the sales and profitability of the Vascular Division. This should be achieved by implementing local sales and marketing strategies which have been agreed with the vascular team.
Responsibilities:

The responsibilities will encompass, but will not be limited to:
Be the face of Cook Vascular in the assigned accounts.
Drive Business including sales with a clear focus on profitability in new and existing accounts.
Provide service to all relevant departments in the account selling Cooks Vascular portfolio to clinical and non-clinical customers which includes: frequent contact, support product roll-outs, introduce new technologies, ssset management, uncover opportunities within the account, maximise the revenues of contracts.
Identify, establish and develop relationships with key clinical and non-clinical decision-makers.
Ensure delivery of service as agree in contracts.
Discover and manage new opportunities within the assigned accounts.
Work closely together with the Clinical Support Specialist & Commercial Business Manager.
In collaboration with the team meet or exceed the clinical and non-clinical targets set by management.
Demonstrate knowledge of the Vascular product range and the associated medical discipline.
Follow-through on customer requests and commitments.
Monitor market share and competitor activity in the assigned territory.
Participate in local and international exhibitions and meetings as requested.
Provide written reports to the Regional Business Manager as appropriate.
Securing Employee Development and Organisational Culture:
Maintain our culture, values and commitment to Ethics and Compliance by recognizing, demonstrating, and enforcing appropriate and compliant behavior.
Within scope of responsibility, ensure all quality, regulatory, and product-specific requirements are met.
Understand and be accountable for conducting Cook business with integrity and in compliance with applicable standards including Cook policiess.
Secure the Cook culture and comply with company guidelines & policies.
Collaboration:
Develop and maintain active relationships with key accounts and key regional physicians.
Work closely and effectively with the other members of the sales team and with Cook support functions in order to provide the best possible service to the customer and the patient.
Work closely and effectively with members of Cook’s Integrated Business Solutions team to develop contractual opportunities with customers and maximize the service provided to the customer and patient.

Ability to meet frequently with customers and other decision makers.
Ability to travel frequently throughout assigned territory.
Proven track record of strong business acumen.
Previous medical sales experience preferred.
Product or Procedural knowledge an advantage.
Good communication and inter-personal skills.
Language Skills - good written and verbal command of English and other relevant languages.
Excellent numeric skills.
Good working knowledge of Microsoft® Office.
Proven problem-solving skills.
Excellent organizational skills.
High self-motivation.
