As the EMEA Channel Marketing Manager, you will provide strategic direction and support for execution to field marketing teams across EMEA. You will do this by driving marketing campaigns with and through the key resellers and distributors to end-customers across the regions. You will build the channel marketing program strategy, orchestrate the delivery of demand-gen journeys, and manage the tools needed to activate our European partner community to support scale partner-led demand generation strategy.
This position can be based in the UK, Amsterdam, or Germany and will report to the Vice President of Marketing based in the US. You will be part of a very close-knit team of field marketers who are equal parts creative, data-driven, and passionate. If you enjoy an environment where you have the freedom to experiment and continuously test new ideas, then this is the opportunity for you!

Responsibilities:
Collaborate with Marketing, Sales, and Channel team to determine programmatic market-, region- and partner-specific strategies, including support/participation in local shows and events, serving as the business product and program expert
Develop and manage the EMEA channel co-marketing strategy (both to and through) to deliver relevant, local marketing and demand-generation initiatives in tight collaboration with the partner managers and field marketing
Develop, with key stakeholders, the relevant KPIs and Channels performance metrics, ensuring that marketing strategies are appropriately targeted
Drive marketing programs with key tech partners i.e., Palo
Work with EMEA distribution partners to drive their Infoblox marketing strategy
Partner with the Product Marketing team to develop channel strategies for new product launches
Measure, analyze, and report on channel pipeline building activities to understand the contribution to pipeline health and to evaluate marketing effectiveness/return on investment
Partner with the customer advocacy team to grow the pipeline of public customer references for EMEA via the channel
Requirements:
BS in Marketing or related field
8+ years of technology channel marketing experience, ideally in enterprise security or networking
Proven success developing and executing channel marketing plans that address various buying cycle stages and personas
Deep expertise in a wide variety of demand generation tactics – particularly co-marketing, digital, and social
Preferably knowledge with partner success management or channel marketing tools, such as Zift
Adept at balancing and negotiating the needs of the region with the demands from corporate
Strong influencing and diplomacy skills – proven ability to get buy-in across a variety of stakeholders
Ability to work effectively with all levels of management and functional disciplines
Experience working with PR agencies a plus
Willing to travel 20-25% within Europe, and at least 2 times per year to the Corporate headquarters in the US.
Fluency in English
It’s an exciting time to be at Infoblox. We are the market leader in technology for network control. Our success depends on bright, energetic, talented people who share a passion for excellence in building the next generation of networking technologies—and having fun along the way. Infoblox offers a fast-paced, action-oriented environment. We promote a culture that embraces innovation, change, teamwork, and strong partnerships. Join the winning Infoblox team—our future looks bright, and so will yours. To check out what it’s like to be a Bloxer click here.

Are you creative, addicted to social media and have a natural talent for writing? And are you a student looking for an international internship for at least 4-6 months? Are you available to start in March 2021? Then we want to hear from you!

Purpose

We are looking for a copywriting intern who wants to gain hands-on experience with a diverse team delivering authentic yet impactful copy for our social media channels. As a copywriter for albelli, you’ll be the voice of our brand and often the first impression for potential customers via social media. You’ll also be required to assist our team with the management and delivery of copy translations through our external translation platform, so you get a true experience of what being part of a creative team is about.

As the copy intern, you’ll receive guidance and feedback along the way from our Copywriters and have multiple opportunities to contribute to the creative output of the team, whilst building on your own skills and experience.

Are you ready for the challenge? Get in touch!

Main responsibilities

Provide overall support to Copywriters, Designers and Social Media Manager
Oversee social media writing (Instagram and Facebook) for 7 European regions
Master and hone albelli’s brand voice and ensure consistency across all assets
Work closely with the Copywriters, Traffic Manager Marketing teams to maintain and deliver the editorial calendar and translation process of all of the above
Monitor, analyze and report on progress using relevant data tools, etc.
Requirements

To be considered, include a portfolio and/or website link in your application.
A passion for words
Social media savvy
Clear communication, especially over social medium
You’re at your best when working in collaborative, multicultural, and cross-functional teams
Organizational skills, with the ability to prioritize under tight deadlines
Excellent verbal and written English, fluency any other European languages (French, Dutch, Nordic) is a plus
Additionally, navigating your way around the Adobe Creative Suite is a benefit but not essential
Possibly a virtual placement

Offer
A fun and challenging creative internship in a dynamic and international environment;
An internship for at least 4-6 months, 32-40 hours a week;
Market conform internship allowance (425 euro for 40 hours per week);
Free daily lunch (Once we return full time to the office following COVID-19);
Informal and hands-on work culture;
Based in the centre of Amsterdam;
Awesome colleagues from all corners of the globe.

Internship Regulations

You must be enrolled at a university within the EU for the complete duration of your internship. We only consider hiring interns who are in possession of an EU passport or have a valid residence permit for the purpose of ‘study’ in the Netherlands for the full duration of the internship.

COVID-19 update

For the safety of our employees and following the measures implemented due to COVID-19, we currently work differently. Our Amsterdam and Nijmegen offices are closed while our production facility in the Hague is operating with proper safety and health measures. Our Recruiting process is currently entirely remote via phone and video calls. Our new hires will have a remote onboarding since the well-being of our employees is our number one priority. For the time being, most of you will be working from home until further notice. This situation can change at any time.

Copywriter

Do you have a university degree in communications combined with 2+ years of experience as a copywriter in a commercial organization? Do you have a quick pen and an agile mindset? Do you have experience with JIRA? If you answered yes on the above questions, then please apply for this challenging position in our fast growing scale-up environment.

This is CarNext.com

CarNext.com is a scale-up with a start-up mentality. We’re bold and have a passion to change the status quo. We’re building a transparent digital marketplace that customers can trust. And it’s the same at CarNext.com. We’re proud of our open culture, collaborative ethos, vibrant environment and can-do approach. As we grow our business, we’re keen to hear from people who understand what we’re about and can help us achieve our mission.


What will you be doing as our new Copywriter?

You will be responsible for creating copy for the website, apps, social media, e-mail and all other copy on CarNext.com’s owned media. This copy needs to fit with our brand and tone of voice, and should be consistent and UX friendly across all channels.

Your responsibilities

Responsible for all product and site related content on all owned media channels (e.g. websites, apps, social media, emails)
Ensures all content is accurate, available on time, in line with guidelines and brand tone of voice, and available in the required languages
Works closely with other departments to ensure alignment (Content, SEO, UX, Brand, Campaigns, Data insights, Product)
Works closely with brand & marketing teams for strategy and communication alignment on campaigns and other marketing activities
Increases conversion with site optimized
Works with content team on fixing errors and optimizing the customer journey

What do we think you need for this challenging position?
Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Communication
2+ years of experience as a Copywriter in a commercial organization
Experience with Content Marketing Systems, ideally Sitecore
Experience with JIRA
Fluent English – written and spoken


Grow with us

CarNext.com provides ample opportunities for personal and professional growth. If this position interests you, Go ahead, apply and send us your CV

Job Title: EMEA Velocity Senior Manager Sales Operations
Job Description:
At UiPath we see boundless potential in the way we live. It drives the way we work. Our culture is our most valuable asset, that's why it acts like a compass to us. We’re fast, immersed, humble and bold.And that’s not just words on the walls.
Eliminating time-consuming tasks means people get to do more of what they love. It’s an inspiring, high stakes challenge that motivates us, and this common passion bonds UiPath employees globally. We all strive every day to be better and to accelerate human achievement.
We make robots, but we hire people. Would you like to be part of this journey?
Your Mission:You will own and manage the fast-growing Velocity business across the region driving the new chapter of our amazing journey. As EMEA Velocity Senior Manager Sales Operations, you will play an instrumental role within the Sales organization and oversee a mix of sales operations, business development and transformational growth.This is what you'll do at UiPath:
Analyze the health of the business by interpreting key performance metrics and present recommendations to senior leadership. Drive root cause analysis and recovery strategies.
Identify opportunities to increase sales productivity and improve operational efficiency across the Velocity Sales organization in EMEA which includes both Inside Sales and Sales Development Teams.
Support Velocity Sales team with planning and operational requests e.g. annual planning, monthly and quarterly business reviews, target setting, sales coverage, territory assignment, headcount planning etc.
Manage Salesforce data, including uploading customer information/territory information, etc. and ensuring all data uploaded is clean, accurate and complete at all times.
Implement and maintain enterprise-class Salesforce environments.
Ability to synthesize big data into strategic and actionable insights.
Conduct and provide analysis of Velocity Sales key performance indicators (KPIs).
Design, document and implement specific initiatives to improve data hygiene and security, improve sales team throughout and efficiency.
Monitor lead flow and optimize it by working in sync with various stakeholders.
Cultivate relationships with cross-functional teams (e.g. Marketing, Tech Stack, Product etc.) to drive strategic initiatives.

Have you heard of JBL or Harman/Kardon, some of the world’s leading audio brands? The market we are leading in, is fast paced, fun and dynamic. Our Lifestyle division has seen continuous growth over the last 5 years and doesn't plan to stop there. For our marketing department within Harman Consumer Lifestyle, based in Amsterdam, we are looking to hire a:
Digital & Social Media Content Specialist
About the Role:
Content marketing is all about telling a story that engages. That’s why we’re looking for a Content Specialist who knows how to tell a story about our leading brand JBL. This role is within our integrated EMEA digital marketing team in Amsterdam. The role is a cross-divisional role between Consumer Audio (COA), and Professional Solutions (PRO), with emphasize on our Pro Solutions division and brands (e.g. JBL, AKG, Martin Lighting) situated in London, Apsley. Therefore, traveling on a frequent basis to London is an aspect of the role.
This role requires a high level of flexibility in terms of day-to-day and a motivational self-starter that spots opportunities everywhere: in every product, event and conversation. It’s important to bring a level of maturity, on how a story starts and where and how to best tell it. Therefore, you need to be a digital native that is channel and platform agnostic, as it shouldn’t matter if you’re telling a top funnel story on social media or a bottom funnel story on a product page with one of our retailers or resellers. Or you’re a fast learner, eager to learn new ways to engage audiences with our iconic brands. You have an eye for detail and never lose sight of the bigger picture in terms of divisions, campaigns and stakeholders.
What You Will Do:
You will be planning, driving and executing all digital activities of the Pro Solutions department and Consumer Audio digital campaigns.
You will be planning, maintaining, monitoring and reporting on our PRO and COA social media channels and planning and maintaining web content with the global content team.
You will be translating business and marketing objectives into calendars, campaigns and content.
Staying updated on digital developments in the landscape relevant for your expertise.
Making data-driven digital analyses that drive decisions (ROI and ROAS).
Making understandable native and non-native reports of our digital plans and campaigns.
What You Need:
A bachelor’s or master’s degree in Marketing & Communication.
At least 3 years of working experience in digital marketing.
Understanding the basics of digital marketing and Social Media.
A second nature in analyzing digital media and actually doing it.
Ability of telling a digital brand story is what you live and breathe.
What is Nice to Have:
Experience in building and driving digital brand campaigns and plans.
Speaking more than one language; fluent English is a must.
What We Offer:
HARMAN offers a great work environment, challenging career opportunities, professional training and competitive market base compensation plus a 13th month salary, 28 holidays per year. You will also receive a highly valued commuter travel package, an interesting collective health insurance scheme, pension and top-notch employee discounts on Harman’s Consumer Audio products.
A unique opportunity to contribute to drive revenue growth and nurture strategic trust-based relationships.
A friendly working atmosphere and good work-life-balance with a fine salary and secondary employment conditions.
The ability to work as a Digital & Social Media Content Specialist in a company that is driven by technology.
The chance to work with on complex problems and continues improvement.
An informal, enterprising and results-orientated culture.
And a few reasons you might love it:
At HARMAN we create useful, playful, beautiful things. Our many iconic brands including; JBL, Harman/Kardon and AKG are transforming the car, the workplace and everywhere in between. We work hard, look for brilliance from all our 30,000 employees and in return you can expect a career full of brilliant possibilities. If you want to be part of a business offering industry-first features, innovation, superior sound technology and the guarantee that you'll never have a dull day - HARMAN could be the place for you!
(www.harman.com)
Is this the challenge you’ve been looking for? Click to apply now! Don’t forget to add your resume.
We look forward to receiving your application! Send your application with your resume and letter of motivation. We will process the applications as we receive them. About us

Skin Faculty (working name) is building a digitally enabled, personalized skincare brand for the modern

consumer. The venture is based in Amsterdam, backed by a global leader in cosmetics and a venture capital fund and is looking for stellar talent to complete the core team in the run-up to a public launch in 2021.

Opportunity

Skin Faculty (working name) is looking for a creative strategist with a deep passion for skin care, content production, social media, PR and influencer management to take on the role of Content Marketing Manager. This is a unique opportunity to join a well-funded, early stage company and collaborate closely with the founders to create a business designed to change the way we care for our skin.

What you’ll do

Content management: Develop and execute the content strategy for all owned channels including the website, app, email and social media and support the creative direction of marketing campaigns.
Content production: Produce written and visual content for all owned channels, partly in collaboration with external partners.
Community management: Nurture a growing community of brand ambassadors by reaching out, responding to and engaging with consumers in a way that makes them feel truly valued and a part of the company.
PR: Contribute to developing an (inter)national communication strategy. Develop and maintain a network of PR partners, journalists and tastemakers representative of the brand values and target audience.
Analysis and reporting: Set relevant KPIs and ambitious goals and rigorously track progress against these goals.
Product marketing: Participate in future product development by being the voice of the consumer. Develop scrappy yet effective methodologies to put consumers at the heart of product creation and generate strong customer insights.
Art direction: contribute to guarding and overseeing the consistency of the brand image throughout all touchpoints and creative assets.
Put the customer first in everything you do, regularly reaching out to them to sharpen your vision, challenge convictions and soundboard new concepts and ideas.

Who you are

Creative genius / jack of all trades - You are a writer, a photographer, a creative strategist and an art director with a strong intuition and an impeccable sense of style and culture.
Skincare aficionado - You are deeply passionate about clean cosmetics, know your active ingredients and take great pride in bringing clarity and honesty in an often confusing and intimidating industry.
Collaborative entrepreneur - You are an inclusive, imaginative and solution-oriented team-player and truly believe the customer should be at the heart of everything we do.
Excellent Communicator - You have outstanding communication skills, with the ability to inspire and influence internal and external stakeholders.
Startup - You like working in a high-growth environment where things move fast and roles and responsibilities evolve. You can manage your own time and you are flexible enough to go the extra mile if needed.
Ownership - You do what you promise and you take ownership of tasks. You always aim for the highest standards with respect for timing and budget. You understand the why of decisions and you suggest improvements when you see an opportunity.

What you’ll need

3+ years of relevant experience, with a proven ability to develop compelling content and campaigns.
Master's degree in a related field (Marketing, Communication or Creative) or equivalent
A great eye for detail and strong esthetics.
Solid project management and problem-solving skills
Experience in high growth environments, e-commerce and/or lifestyle industries.
Superior proficiency in English. An additional language is a plus.

What we can offer

Become one of the key employees of an ambitious start up
Have a real impact on the company’s growth and direction
Work with a close-knitted team who love what they do every day
Competitive compensation in accordance with the European startup market
Flexible working conditions
Unlimited holidays

Customer Service
About the job
We are looking for a dynamic Customer Experience Manager (CEM) to help manage our partner network and drive our EMEA Customer Service strategy forward as we continue to expand our footprint. The CEM will share responsibility for our outsourced Customer Service (CS) operations for the EMEA region with other CEMs. You are a true allrounder with great leadership and collaboration skills who brings the perspective, approach, and knowledge (of tooling, technology, analytics, processes, and the industry as a whole) required to achieve operational consistency and excellence globally, as well as maximal value to the business.
You will report directly to the Director of Netflix Customer Service, EMEA.
Success in this role will be measured through your ability to drive Netflix CS performance and value proposition to be the best in our network and industry, while also building a culturally aligned team dirven to provide an excellent customer experience and increasingly added value to the business through cross-functional collaboration.
Responsibilities
Partner and Performance Management:Manage and maintain an excellent relationship with our partners.Manage and drive our partners within the EMEA region to deliver excellent service.Manage and analyze performance across all EMEA languages, sites, and channels.Launch, build, and scale vendors in EMEA.Define and develop standards of service excellence to achieve through high touch culture, guidance, and accountability.Build a culture which supports our primary aim to deliver an amazing customer experience anchored on the Netflix global values.Negotiate and coordinate commercial agreements.
Strategy, Initiatives, and Collaboration:Actively contribute to and execute against regional strategy and clearly communicate direction and expectations to the partner network.Collaborate closely and proactively cross-functionally and within the global team.Spearhead and drive improvement initiatives that allow us to uplift our service and customer experience and identify best practices to share across the CS network.Exercise critical thinking skills by finding meaningful patterns and insights when assessing partner performance and customer experience.Translate those findings into feedback to partners and/or to the business while ensuring accountability during execution.Drive to innovate, and use technology and data to improve the customer experience.
Experience
Strong experience in Customer Services and/or Operations management, including senior leadership in an international environment.Business Process Outsourcing experience is strongly preferred.Experience in managing medium to large scale operations preferred.
Proven ability to track, measure, and optimize multi-disciplinary operations.Business Analysis experience is strongly preferred.
Strong knowledge of the EMEA region, having worked with an EMEA scope.Knowledge of the CEE subregion or the META subregion preferred.
Extensive experience managing and driving customer experience.
Project management experience preferred.
Skills:
Excellent relationship and partnership building skills (both internal and external).
Excellent collaboration and communication skills.
Excellent analytical skills, ability to interpret and summarize complex performance and consumer data to drive actionable plans that are impactful to the business.
Good skills presenting reports, trends, and recommendations to the business.
Strong commercial and strategic insight.
Knowledge of Customer Experience (CX) management strongly preferred.
Understanding of SVOD platforms preferred.
Excellent business English (additional languages preferred).

Your job

Working environment
ABN AMRO Clearing offers an integrated approach to global transaction processing, financial logistics and risk management. Clients benefit from our global reach as well as from our staff's extensive expertise of local financial markets. With 11 offices around the globe we offer proximity to market infrastructures on 4 continents. We strive to deliver the most professional service, to make our clients globally competitive. We consistently ranks among the top three clearers in every time zone, based on market share of transactions cleared.

Working at ABN AMRO Clearing means thriving in an international, professional yet informal, fast-paced environment. The Network Management Team has a lot of knowledge and shows drive and passion. Your profile

Do you want to work on shaping and driving our client’s commercial excellence agenda, focused on realized profitable growth? This role is based in our Amsterdam office. Read on to find out if this job fits – and apply now
Your job
We are currently looking for a Manager Growth Strategy. You will focus on realizing results together with our leading clients on 3 key market themes:
Seamless Customer Experience - Focused on customer experience strategy and -transformation, leveraging most innovative digital technologies of today
Sales & Commercial Excellence - Focused on commercial excellence strategy definition and sales transformation
Pricing & Long-term Profit Optimization - Focused on pricing strategy definition and shaping pricing transformation programs to help C-level realize EBITDA uptake

As Manager Growth Strategy you will advise client executives in defining their strategy and targets, assess and analyze alternatives and shape executable action plans. Illustrative examples of activities include:
shape value case to define impact of new strategy
design new commercial strategy based on insights (interpret results of data scientists)
shape transformation program to execute strategy (e.g. how to leverage technology/AI)
run workshops with commercial teams to validate strategy
assess commercial capabilities & propose improvements

Your team
Our consultants in Strategy & Consulting are changing businesses every day using deep industry insights, knowledge and innovative ideas. Positioned at the crucial intersection of business, technology and industry, we devise creative new strategies based on trends, insights and data. With an eye for competitive advantage, digital disruption, operating models and the future workforce, we take on the challenge of designing and implementing transformative business solutions, using the newest technology.
Our research-based advice and situational analyses enable our clients to act with speed and confidence. Whether we're investigating complex issues or identifying new opportunities, our work always comes down to one thing: unlocking value and creating real, tangible impacts.

Your background
Completed Master’s degree
Minimum of 6 years (strategy) consulting experience
Experience with commercial excellence transformation
MBA preferable, not mandatory
Enterpreneurial mindset
Fluency in Dutch and English required

Our offer
Accenture is an incredible place to work - and keep learning. By joining us, you’ll become part of a global company with a world-class brand and reputation. Besides the work we do for our clients, we’re proud of our vibrant, diverse workplace culture: we believe in openness and honesty, fairness and equality, common sense and realism. We want to get to know the real you and help you explore and grow - whatever it is you're great at. So, you will always have lots of learning opportunities (formal and informal) to improve your role-specific skills and expertise.
Besides our high-profile, challenging projects and our nurturing work environment, we offer excellent employee benefits, including:
A flexible transport arrangement that suits your personal situation (electric car or bicycle, flexible budget including NS business card)
An expense allowance

Interesting online training at renowned international universities

Interested?

Job Title: Integrated Marketing and Programs Manager Europe
Job Description:
As the Integrated Marketing and Programs Manager Europe you will be part of the Global Marketing team for the IDEXX Companion Animal Group (CAG) and take on Integrated Marketing and Programs responsibilities within the Regional Marketing and Customer Programs team.
The Companion Animal Group (CAG), provides diagnostic capabilities that meet veterinarians’ diverse needs through a variety of modalities, including in-clinic diagnostic solutions and outside reference laboratory services. The Integrated Marketing and Programs Manager will report into the Regional Marketing and Programs team, which is in charge of developing and executing regional marketing plans, programs, pricing and tools aligned with global strategies and in close partnership with commercial teams.
As the Integrated Marketing and Programs manager you will be responsible for:
Marketing programs & promotions management for several product categories and/or functional program areas
Planning, implementing and monitoring marketing programs & promotions with a regional scope ensuring these are in line with organizational strategies and contribute to achieving our goals
Closely collaborate and align with key stakeholders in the matrix – including finance, legal and compliance, IT, commercial, sales training and global & regional marketing – to ensure commercial offers are in line with ROI and legal expectations and rolled out effectively in the regions
Define and present program & promotion proposals to regional and global senior executives
Manage and escalate critical issues related to programs and promotions
Train and coach marketers when rolling out new marketing programs & promotions in the region
Support the development and management of our programs policies and procedures across Europe
Skills and Abilities that will help you navigate in this role:
You possess a Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration or equivalent combination of education and experience. Master’s degree or equivalent preferred.
You have strong communication skills in English, both verbal and written. Any other European language is a plus.
Preferably 5+ years in a similar Marketing management role
Ability to develop and implement strategic programs
Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills required
Cultural sensitivity a must as the job involves working with an international team
Proven ability to work-in and lead with influence project teams which are highly matrixed, cross functional and technical.
Demonstrated marketing and product management skills (segmentation, product positioning, pricing, distribution, forecasting and promotion, etc.)
Strong technical and market knowledge
Strong analytical and business case modeling expertise required
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills; ability to anticipate and resolve issues
Ability to prioritize, maintain focus, and manage multiple projects simultaneously
Ability to manage strategy and details concurrently
Strong/advanced presentation skills; ability to present and explain product information to all audiences
Good financial acumen and budget management skills
Proficiency in MS office applications–with strong/advanced knowledge of spreadsheet and database software
Open to travel up to 20% on yearly basis (after COVID restrictions are removed)
Why IDEXX
We’re proud of the work we do, because our work matters. An innovation leader in every industry we serve, we follow our Purpose and Guiding Principles to help pet owners worldwide keep their companion animals health and happy, to ensure safe drinking water for billions, and to help farmers protect livestock and poultry from disease. We have customers in over 175 countries and a global workforce of over 9,000 talented people.
So, what does that mean for you? We enrich livelihoods of our employees with a positive and respectful work culture that embraces challenges and encourages learning and discovery. At IDEXX, you will be supported by competitive compensation, incentives and benefits while enjoying purposeful work that drives improvement.
IDEXX values a diverse workforce and workplace and strongly encourages women, people of color, LGBT individuals, people with disabilities, members of ethnic minorities, foreign-born residents, and veterans to apply.
IDEXX is an equal opportunity employer. Applicants will not be discriminated against because of race, color, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, religion, national origin, citizenship status, disability, ancestry, marital status, veteran status, medical condition, or any protected category prohibited by local, state, or federal laws.

Why Recharge.com

At Recharge.com, we make recharging digital prepaid credit for yourself or someone else fast, safe & simple - anytime, anywhere. Our customers use our platform to recharge their accounts in various services from App Store & iTunes or Google Play, to call credit operators or prepaid credit card providers worldwide. Our customers love to share their experiences with us publicly which has led to our current Trustpilot score of 4.5! This drives us to ensure we live up to their expectations on a daily basis. Our work hard - play hard mentality keeps us going, to learn more about our culture check out our Instagram or browse our company website.
The Role

We’re on the hunt for a Business Development Manager in our new Business Development Team, reporting to our CCO. The objective of the new team is to develop a future proof outward looking global expansion strategy and consequently a continuous pipeline of strategic business development initiatives. It is your mission is to accelerate growth in EMEA, with the immediate focus to expand our platform into GCC and across Europe. Key to success is thoroughly understanding our existing user base, so we can deliver innovation and new revenue streams that better serve their needs and expectations with high growth potential.
What you have

Minimum of 4 years working and proven track record in strategy consultancy, corporate strategy, business development, or innovation
International experience and mindset
Curiosity! An open mind and interest for change to drive new ideas, to understand, new cultures, to implement opportunities
Fluent in English; Arabic language is a big plus
Strong communication and project management skills
Proactive, getting-it-done mentality
Master degree required
You will work on things like

Consumer, competition and country research
Developing a vision on how to expand in EMEA, starting with GCC and Nordics
Partnering with business teams to launch new markets and understand market challenges that generate new innovation projects
Understanding our consumers needs and which growth initiatives to develop to better serve them
What We Offer

30 days vacation, good compensation, pension contributions & one of the best relocation packages in Amsterdam.
Choice of a Macbook Pro (13” or 15”) or a HP
An international English-speaking office & free Dutch courses to help out with daily Dutch life
Free lunch & snacks with veggie & vegan options
Weekly boot camps, yoga & Friday drinks*
Regular parties & celebrations*
Online during Covid-19 restrictions

Job Title
Graduate Development Program - HR
Job Description
In this role, you have the opportunity to
Philips is a global health tech leader, making life better for billions of people globally through meaningful innovation and solutions. From complex medical devices and connected care systems to personal health and wellness, the work we do is shaping the future of healthcare for all. For recent graduates, we offer a unique two-year program to explore life at Philips while experiencing different areas of our organization. You will fulfill three challenging assignments. After the first, you will be in control of choosing what comes next. Stick to one specialization or branch out in new directions? It is your future and your decision. We will support you with a personalized learning journey that combines hands-on experience with mentoring from leaders, coaching from peers, and guidance from our Career Center to find your own personal landing spot within Philips — one that best suits you, your career and life goals. Our culture of collaboration brings together diverse teams to support each other, expand our perspectives, and be our best. You will be connected to a community of graduates around the world to share your experience, learn from each other, collaborate and spark ideas.
You are responsible for
We have several assignments (location Amsterdam or Eindhoven) available, each assignment has a specific focus.
Department HR Precision & Diagnosis
Lead the cross-cluster initiative to improve the talent bench for upcoming business category, GM and innovation leaders. Make an integral plan together with talent acquisition, leadership and learning and the HRBP’s
As member of the business HR team, join us in improving the talent to value ratio to 85% by identifying critical roles, jobs to be done, role risks, etc. in precision diagnosis
Support/create a cross-cluster HR platform on HR business topics. This to take all HRBPs along in sharing cross-cluster knowledge/best practices and learnings so that you can enable these x-business connections more.
Potential add-on project: Boost inclusion and diversity culture in Business clusters
Department HR Innovation, Strategy & People Analytics
Support agile portfolio planning process for HR Leadership Team
Support projects such as HR way of work and HR Leadership Team off sites
Follow up on action planning
Department HR Merger & Acquisitions
Fully participate in the HR Merger and Acquisitions project teams from pre-acquisition until integration
Formulate and maintaining HR M&A project plan, incl identification of synergies & potential risks, risk mitigation. progress charts, KPI tracking and report out to key stakeholders
Connecting with other M&A workstream during deals to ensure business success through putting our customers first
Build a structured culture integration journey based on a quantitative measurement of the differences and similarities of both organizational cultures.
Drive continues improvement through supporting team innovation goals and activities e.g. data analytics, deploy employee engagement surveys, interviews
To succeed in this role, you should have the following skills and experience
Recently or almost graduated with a Master’s degree in HR, Business Administration, Psychology or equivalent.
Max 1 years of work experience straight after your graduation
Excellent inter-personal and communication skills, so you can persuade colleagues at all ranks in the organization
International experience or an international mindset
Self-starter with an entrepreneurial spirit, eager and ambitious
Speak and write fluent English
Able to bring structure
Story-teller
Commercial mindset
Cultural awareness
Ability to think across functional domains
In return, we offer you
Launch a career in health technology
Join a company making a difference to people’s lives
Actively contribute to innovations that matter
Work on a diverse international team
Gain hands-on experience in multiple areas
Develop your capabilities and knowledge
Build a solid professional network
Recruitment process
When you are interested to join the Philips Graduate Development Program, please apply online latest 4th of April 2021, applications that come in after this deadline can not be taken into account.
Upload your CV and/or motivation
In week 14 you will be informed whether you passed the pre-selection round and if yes you will be invited to perform an online test.
In week 15 you will be informed whether you are selected for the next round, the virtual video interview which will take place between in week 16.
In week 19 you will be informed whether you belong to the best performers, you will be invited for the final virtual assessment center, which will take place on the 3rd June. During this event, you will work on several challenging exercises together with similar minded graduates. Of course we will also provide you with more information on the Graduate Development Program and the assignments. This is the final step in the selection process. In the same week, we will inform you with the outcome.
When you successfully complete the selection process, you need to be able to start fulltime per 1st July 2021. We do understand that in some cases you have not received your official diploma yet, but you need to have finalized all your mandatory classes and handed in your thesis (a proof of this could be requested).
Why should you join Philips?
Working at Philips is more than a job. It’s a calling to create a healthier society through meaningful work, focused on improving 2.5 billion lives a year by delivering innovative solutions across the health continuum. Our people experience a variety of unexpected moments when their lives and careers come together in meaningful ways. Learn more by watching this video. To find out more about what it’s like working for Philips at a personal level, visit the Working at Philips page on our career website, where you can read stories from our employee blog. Once there,you can also learn about our recruitment process, or find answers to some of the frequently asked questions.
